story:
Tow'rs is excited to announce that we're going back into the studio to record our third album!  This is definitely going to be our best album to date.  In order to bring these new songs alive, we need to raise with your help $40,000 to cover the cost.  We have the month of December to make this dream a reality! Here's more details about our campaign...

 

Why we need your financial support?

The cost of recording a professional album as an independent artist is SIGNIFICANT! Renting a studio, hiring engineers, mixing the album, and mastering the album will cost Tow'rs over $25K.

The cost of marketing an album as an independent artist DOUBLES our bands expenses! Designing the album, hiring a publicist, making music videos, etc for the album will cost Tow'rs an additional $25K if not more.

These numbers don't even include the cost of us making physical copies, creating vinyl (something we're excited to offer next year), travel for the band to the studio in Denver, etc.

 

Don't be discouraged! We can get there with your support!

We would love to see our campaign go over the $50K mark, but we've only set our goal to get to $40K.  Be realistic we say! :)

We have about 5,000 people connected to us online.  If only 50% of our supporters partner with us using the first perk of $15 - we can raise $37K overnight.  You all have believed in us from the beginning, and we have gotten so far with your help!  Help us write the next chapter to this story & let's make this campaign a huge success!

To say "Thank You" to everyone who partners with us, we've setup several awesome perks! We're giving all our partners an early download of the album two weeks before it is released to the public.  We're designing some killer stickers, posters, and shirts based on our last album. We're hosting an album listening party in Flagstaff for anyone who wants to join us! And we're excited to meet our biggest partners over a Skype call or to play an intimate show in their living room!

 

Go the Extra Mile with Us & Spread the Word!

1 - Share the campaign link on Facebook.

2 - Share the campaign video on Facebook.

3 - Retweet the campaign on Twitter. Retweet this tweet.

4 - Download the campaign trailer & share it on Instagram. Download the video here.

 

Make a Custom Contribution via PayPal

If you prefer to make a private contribution of your own amount, please visit PayPal.Me/towrsmusic.

story:
Summary

       The Musicians International  is an extensive collection of original film clips with the specific purposes of encouraging young audience to explore the vast field of orchestral music. It is also a means of putting the work of young musicians out in front of a wide, internet-based audience.

        The players creating this music are accomplished international-class musicians whose talent, enthusiasm and determination is deeply inspiring. This winning combination deserves to reach the widest possible audience, especially the peers of these kids who may never have listened to this kind of music before. This is why I have already devoted five years to developing the project. 

       And to me, they are kids; I'm 75, while both the target audience and the players are aged between 14 and 24, with some overflow at either end. A career as a professional musician is one of the most difficult career paths of all, and those who choose it do so because it is their passion.     

       Just so that you know, the older generations aren't being left out; there is plenty here for us as well. 

       That said, the zeal and excitement that these young players put into their music has immense appeal, and their concert-hall and open-air performances attract large, appreciative audiences. The choice of music offered by The Musicians International  will continue to grow as I am able to film at venues in other parts of Australia, Asia, the UK and the USA.  

       This project began in 2011 as part of my doctoral research into the impact of digital technology on documentary production. The making of a 55-minute documentary, The Musicians, was an integral part of this work. This film is based on the career paths of several young musicians from the Western Australian Youth Orchestra and other WA ensembles. However, the story that emerged demanded far more coverage than a single film could provide. So, The Musicians became the launch-pad for this more extensive multi-media project. 

The Musicians - a 3-minute introduction to the documentary 

  

A filmmaker's perspective

   

       I have been a professional filmmaker for the past 45 years, and most of my 60-or-so broadcast films on wildlife and the performing arts have made extensive use of both traditional and contemporary orchestral music. 

A 30-second clip of some of my work   

       The Musicians International will bring a range of orchestral music to the conscious attention younger audiences, I say "conscious attention" because the whole gamut of orchestral music is now commonly heard in film and television sound tracks, so at least the sound of it is already familiar. This project provides the detail to encourage further audience engagement. 

       In the course of my research, I filmed a great deal of performance by young musicians. This large stock of raw material, combined with the increasing importance of the internet in our day-to-day lives, convinced me that now is the time forThe Musicians Project to happen; to bring an understanding and appreciation of orchestral music to a new world-wide audience.

       Part of a documentary-maker's brief is to preserve the past. In the clip below, two performances of the same piece have been recorded  at different times and in different places, and played by the same artist ... the remarkable piano prodigy, Shuan Hern Lee.  When combined, they provide an interesting example of the passage of time. .   

Shuan Hern Lee plays a Chopin Etude.             

       A pivotal role of The Musicians International is to show the human face of orchestral music. Young musicians will be encouraged to tell their own stories; to reveal themselves as individuals who are real people with talent and purpose. Rather than providing just a string of exhibition pieces, this project will show something of the music-making process, and the fierce drive, blood, sweat and tears that go into a life of performance.  

       The Musicians International will explain what an orchestra is, how it works, and say something about the instruments that make it up. Very much "orchestral music without tears". 

This 3-minute excerpt from the Haydn Trumpet Concerto played by the student-developed Swan Philharmonic orchestra, combines both rehearsals and performance footage.

The Team

       Considering that I am well past my teenage years,  I will gather a support team from the target generation, partly drawn from dedicated music academies in Western Australia, and partly from similar sources in the UK and USA.  This team of six to eight teenagers will be  familiar with what people their age are looking for in terms of entertainment, how they negotiate and access web-based information, and how the website/library should be designed to best suite their preferred viewing platforms; that is, tablets, laptops  and smartphones. Members of this team will be comfortable working with modern communications technology as well as being musicians in their own right. 

      To balance this, there will be myself and at least two members of the older generation to ensure that the end product also has application to vintages beyond the primary target audience. Developing the web site functions from a distance can be easily  achieved via teleconferencing.  

Why is The Musicians International important?  

        There is a rumour that interest in orchestral music is dying out.

        While most musicians and members of concert audiences may not necessarily agree, there is a trend for young people to not be exposed to traditional orchestral music. It is possible that their parents weren't exposed to it either, or even their parents.   

        By showing young musicians at work, The Musicians International  will demonstrate that orchestral music is not something mysterious or elitist, and has a significant place in our lives. 

       The interactive nature of The Musicians International  website will encourage young people to embark on their own exploration of what orchestral music is all about and how they can be involved in it; more importantly, they may already be involved without realising it. 

       The Musicians International  is also a means of sharing the emotional depth that orchestral music can promote within us. Our emotional responses to music are some of the strongest associations we have with life events, individuals, and life processes, including loss. 

       This photo of my wife Gwenda and myself, taken in early January, 2002, was the last photo that we had taken together. On the 5th. of March, 2002, Gwenda died from the ravages of pancreatic cancer. 

       During the months that followed the diagnosis and its inevitable outcome, our home was frequently filled with the richness of our favourite classical and popular orchestral music. Apart from being a source of peace and pleasure, this music was also a source of strength, which was very much needed in our lives at that time. I firmly believe that this level of personal enrichment is valuable and worth sharing. 

       Later, as I began to further research classical music, I became increasingly aware that so many young people could gain so much from the power that orchestral music has to affect our lives in so many positive ways. This strongly influenced me to begin creating this resource that will ultimately become The Musicians International. 

Getting the best out of the project 

        Whether filming wildlife or an orchestra, it is critical to remain invisible and not become part of the event being filmed. It is also essential to get the best imagery possible to create the strongest connection between the viewer and the subject. With this in mind, I use the smallest cameras available that provide quality results. As with most modern technology, the quality and compactness of film equipment is constantly being improved. Over the past few years, High Definition equipment has become outdated, virtually redundant, and Ultra High Definition (UHD and 4K) is the new standard filming medium.

   Ultra Hight Definition equipment creates images that provide the filmmaker with much greater creative flexibility while working at a greater distance from the players. These smaller cameras can also be placed within the orchestra, and controlled remotely without being in any way disruptive. Thus everyone's job is made easier, with much better results.    

Timing, crowdfunding and distribution

       Filming of this kind requires patience, a detailed knowledge of the subject, a great deal of trust on the part of the musicians concerned, and, or course, time. And in any language, time is money

       The initial  collection of some 50 topic-specific film clips plus background information can  be completed within nine months of commencement. The web site will continue to develop from thereon in, and will become part of the well-established educational organisation, Storyteller Media (www.storyteller.com.au/). This will ensure that the project continues to move forward, and will receive maximum exposure and distribution.   

    An important aspect of funding the project  through Indiegogo is that it can be created free of outside influences. As an experienced independent filmmaker, I can work far more efficiently and cost-effectively using my own proven methods. 

The project budget 

       To achieve the level of professional results that this long-term project deserves, I will buy (rather than hire) up-to-date cameras and accessories. Modern compact production equipment is not fiendishly expensive, but it isn't cheap either. Because of the long duration of this project, it is far more economical to purchase rather than hire equipment.  My estimate for additional filming equipment on current pricing is $19,000.

       To meet some of the costs of airfares and accommodation within Australia, and travel to the UK and USA to work with young musicians in these places, I have included a budget of $12,000. I anticipate augmenting this part of the budget by doing some industry-level teaching and developing some saleable footage in the process. 

       For additional equipment costs, including computer hard drives for footage storage, I have allowed $6,000

       If there is a shortfall in the proposed budget, the project will still go ahead using exisiting footage and my own resources as necessary. Long-term development will continue, but at a slower pace. This notwithstanding, support from contributors to boost the development that I have already undertaken will see The Musicians International become a viable reality, and a valuable resource.   

BUDGET SUMMARY

Camera equipment ............................. $19,000

Travel and accommodation ............... $12,000

Peripheral production equipment ..... $ 6,000 

Total crowdfunding budget:             $37,000

Processes, outcomes and challenges

       It is intended that The Musicians International will link up with other on-line sites that present a range of performance clips by talented young artists, and provide a complimentary view of the extraordinary ability of these musicians.  

        While each of my former productions, including several TV series, has had its challenges, the stability, comparatively low cost and quality output of today's digital technology literally ensures production success in experienced hands.

       Given the remarkable advantages offered by today's digital equipment, only the most basic of all stumbling blocks remains; the ever-present one of funding. As mentioned, this is especially critical if the required level of creative independence is to be maintained. It is hoped that this can be surmounted by the phenomenon that is crowdfunding.    

Get on board in whatever capacity!

      Not everyone may be able to donate to this campaign, but please spread the word. SHARE this proposal through social media such as Facebook, Twitter, Google + and you own circle of friends to help make this NFP project happen.  My sincere thanks. Bob

story:
Legend is still alive! One of the most interesting gothmet-bands The Lust is back with completely new studio album. The Lust will tell it's own story about infamous Elisabeth Short, better known as Black Dahlia. Another legend...

Who we are? We are gothic/melo-metal project The Lust. The band exists since 2003 and has already released 5 CD's and many digital albums and EP's on different labels (FONO Rec., Sleaszy Rider, Irond, Worldlessness Records) and by itself. Our music is hard to compare to other femal-fronted pathetic-metal bands because of our non-sympho approach, unique melodies, simple and dynamic core and interesting and very specific voice by our new vocalist Anna Dust. 

Most of our career we have paid a record production and distribution of our albums at our own expense. But now we urgently need your help to implement our next release. After long pause we have completely new studio album "Black Dahlia Poem" to be done, with fresh energy, cool songs, new singer and several prominent guest. 

"Black Dahlia Poem" is our first conceptual album with different songs and different moods. It's dedicated to Elisabeth Short and her story of life and death. Sure, many of you know or have heard about the cruel murder of young woman from 20 century. Our album "Black Dahlia Poem" is our personal musical and lyrical vision of the whole story, our look behind this cold case and playing with possible reason of the Elisabeth's murder. And for the first time in THE LUST's history we have so many collaborators. The listeners will be surprised for sure :). 


Our new album "Black Dahlia Poem" is already recorded. Now we need money for best possible mixing/mastering and releasing our album in a way everyone will be satisfied with. It would be great to do it as box with digi-pack CD, vinyl, bonus-tracks, T-Shirt, some fan-items and great artwork by designer Pablo "The Elephant" Antonov. But it will depends on the result of this campaign. Anyway we'd like to do something special for our supporters and we are already working on it!

Here is the first song from our future album - My Pieces (Single Mix) - https://soundcloud.com/dissector-band/the-lust-my-pieces

Spread the word and help us finishing our milestone!

story:
Been looking to get music out to you and with recording costs it will take awhile to get anything out and I'm not looking to drag this project. I would appreciate any bit that will help, I'm not one for begging for money, but since you contribute what you like, you will be rewarded with some cool merch. 

Also, since I am the only member in this project, writing all the parts, setting up everything and so forth it is stressful to have to gather all the cash together, unlike most bands that have 3-5 member and can split, I rely on myself. 

If you enjoy supporting the scene and art then you know how much this would mean to me. 

Thank you! 

https://www.facebook.com/AstralSlumber/
story_txt: Been looking to get music out to you and with recording costs it will take awhile to get anything out and I'm not looking to drag this project. I would appreciate any bit that will help, I'm not one for begging for money, but since you contribute what you like, you will be rewarded with some cool merch. Also, since I am the only member in this project, writing all the parts, setting up everything and so forth it is stressful to have to gather all the cash together, unlike most bands that have 3-5 member and can split, I rely on myself. If you enjoy supporting the scene and art then you know how much this would mean to me. Thank you! https://www.facebook.com/AstralSlumber/

story:
The NINE BEATS Collective has come together to make a soundscape of songs, instrumentals and spoken word that explores the ancient wisdom known as 'The Beatitudes' – and we’d love to invite you to help us make it happen!

Why are we so passionate about this project? Because these words speak about another world being possible, another way of being human: in these turbulent times, could they actually offer us steps to a new reality? NINE BEATS explores these powerful notions - and presents them back to the culture around us through music and art.

“The arts and theology and spiritual formation are really great conversation partners because…we’re invited to question the assumptions of the systems that we are part of … they point out that the emperor has no clothes on and then invoke the possibility of newness to come … there’s a longing inside of us for another world, something better than what’s here right now … the Beatitudes invite us in to that possibility and say there is a new way to be human, another world is possible.” Mark Scandrette – author & speaker

 The Collective features:

​

  • World renowned guitarist Caleb Quaye - Elton, Jagger, Hall & Oates, and, well, you name them! (USA)

  • Award-wining composer and artist Mikael R Andreasen (Denmark)

  • Artist, performer & Child Rights campaigner Ambassada (Uganda)

  • MOBO-winning producer, songwriter & guitarist Tony Bean (UK)

  • Acclaimed singer-songwriter Heatherlyn (USA)

  • Super-talented keyboard player & music director Martin Trotman (UK)

  • Brooklyn’s brilliant band leader Rev Vince Anderson

  • Songwriter, philosopher, cultural commentator & one-time AC/DC sound engineer Barry Taylor,

Add in thought leaders, spoken word artists & cultural commentators like Mark Scandrette, Eric Leroy Wilson, Rozella Haydée White and Christine Yi Suh, and this is an awesome Collective!

Here’s what we need:

By end October, we want to have finished the 'soundscape' album of songs, music, and spoken words: that will be released as a download AND a vinyl album (complete with gatefold cover, great artwork, concept album styling).

Right now, we need £10,000 to complete this recording, and produce the first drop of vinyl to initially release of the album early in 2017.

The funds we raise will help us:

  • Complete the writing & pre-production at 5am Records studio (Birmingham, UK) through the summer.
  • Complete the vocal recordings in USA with the best negotiated recording equipment & studio hire (x2 people, recording over 1 week in diverse locations)
  • Complete mixing & mastering for download & vinyl
  • Initiate the production of the first drop of vinyl

Here’s some goodies for you:

We’ve got some great goodies to perk up the process:

All of the funds raised will go towards the album – we’re committed to making it happen, and we aim to release in February 2017.

Impact

“We live in a world that doesn’t have very much hope right now and if you get a glimpse, a glimmer of something that could actually give hope and actually transform the human heart, and communities, and the world, that’s powerful.” Eric Leroy Wilson (Award-winning poet, playwright, producer, spoken word artist & spiritual formation director)

These NINE BEATS are ancient words that on the face of it might seem unfashionable: they’re found in the Bible, spoken by Jesus – and yet a closer look reveals they are bursting with startling relevance to today. As we’ve explored them we’ve found they’re about a welcome, not a weapon – hidden treasures worth sharing! With all that’s happening culturally and politically, we think this unique album has a timely theme. It’s got a great cast of international artists and different cultural vibes, something really compelling and intriguing. You can help us make it a reality!

If we exceed our £10k target, that will be just fantastic because we can then look at things like visuals, live events and at our other ideas like digital and physical resources to help people explore the NINE BEATS for themselves.

Risks and challenges

All of us involved have a solid track record in the music, art, film, creative and even academic/theology worlds: we’ve delivered many albums and films and we’re just so excited about this concept, the ‘heart’ of this project.

The main funders thus far, whilst not in the music industry, do have a 128-year heritage of creatively communicating Bible content through art, booklets, live programmes and community projects across the globe.

Any challenges, we believe, can be confidently handled by this great group of professionals and artists – if we fail to achieve our targets, we’ll still press ahead and seek other avenues – we’d just prefer the people to speak and journey with us!

It’s all under way, it’s happening – we’re ready for you to jump on board. Anything you can give is a massive gift to us, so THANK YOU in advance!

Other ways you can help

If can’t give but you resonate with the NINE BEATS vibe, you can be a massive help by getting the word out

  • through whatever social media platforms you use
  • through your networks and circle of friends
  • through Indiegogo share tool

The more people that hear there’s a NINE BEATS to the bar rhythm rising, the better!

story:
We Are Hawk and Dove.  

For seven years we have been playing the kind of haunting, furious, psychedelic music that accompanies your fitful dreams on a humid summer night.

We have recorded demos, an EP and a full-length record. We've toured more than 40 cities and towns, from Massachusetts to Texas to Iowa and back again. Over seven years we have spent more than $50,000 on recordings, touring, duplication, rehearsal space and a short yellow school bus. It has all been worth it.

Now, here we are. Standing at the edge of that precipice, our next record. We've got the songs. We just need you.


A Story About Living and Dying

In his early 40s, Elijah's father was diagnosed with young-onset Parkinson's. Over the last of their time together, Jedd tried a series of cures, from conventional to alternative medicine, to hopeful miracle. Elijah traveled with Jedd through India. He lived with him through the genius and abuse of a German scientist—trying everything geography, medical communities, and the internet had to offer. The hope for a cure did not succeed in distracting them from the depression, memory loss, sleep deprivation, and pain of trying to die with grace, while maintaining hope.

Here in America, we hunger for luxury, ease, and longevity. Yet so often we satisfy that hunger at the expense of other people’s lives. How many years do we have a right to live? How much violence does it take to keep ourselves alive and feeling good? What is the physical and psychological toll of that violence? What is it, in this arrangement, that we are so addicted to? We hope this album will be a companion to others who are feeling lost in the adventure of life and death in the Golden Age.


We're Not Just Making a Record. 
We're Making a Community. 

We believe our music should be heard by listeners around the world, from our local scene to far beyond. It should be recorded with talented professionals, and top-notch equipment that will effectively capture the sounds we create. Yet in today's financial climate—in business, in music, and beyond—it is nearly impossible to do what we are trying to do. 

We don't really need another record. What we truly need, and what we have been chasing all these years, is a way to make more art, and more community. To travel and sing and perform, and share more days with more of you. In these [extra]ordinarily perilous times, when even going about our daily business can be rife with violence and fear, we feel a deep need to build. We don't claim to have any answers, but we do believe that participating in a rich dialogue is a necessary part of any attempt to live and die with grace.


The Budget:

To record and promote this album, we need to raise $19,483. 

+ $3000 for engineering, mixing, and use of a small studio
+ $1000 two days' time in a large studio w/ isolated rooms to track the rhythm
+ $2900 to pay musicians who can play instruments we can't  
+ $1000 to master both the digital and vinyl editions of the record
+ $2276 for vinyl production
+ $1200 for album art/package design
+ $6000 for a 4-month promotional campaign ($1500/month)
+ $550 for merchandise and postage perk fulfillment 
+ $1,558 for Indiegogo and CC/Paypal Fees-they take 8% (5% & 3%)  
Total   $19,483


Any amount that you give will have a huge impact. 

In exchange for your generosity, we are offering a menu of perks. In addition to the items listed, we can offer private performances and various objects and services. If you are interested in an unlisted perk, please reach out. We’re ready to get creative!

If you are unable to contribute financially, you can still help us out! Over the course of the next month we will be posting acoustic demo versions of the songs from our upcoming album on Instagram and Facebook. We would be deeply grateful and indebted to you, if you would consider reposting our music, along with a link to the fundraising page and a few words about why your friends should check it out.


Thank You!  We love you.

    hawk + dove

story:
Short Summary

Here's the deal: We have assembled a team of exceptional human beings with an array of various  talents and skills and we are hitting the road to spread the good word about the renaissance that is happening in DC right now. This is the most #DCASFUCK crew we could rally and we are ready to hit the road. DC government is steady cutting budgets for art and music but we are making it work on our own. This will be our 6th year in Austin for SXSW, we have gone every year without any government funding and this year wont be any different.

We are hitting the road on March 10th to go to New Orleans for BUKU festival, Austin Texas for SXSW and then lastly Detroit for North American Bike Week. We are also curating stages at Broccoli City in April, The Funk Parade in May and several more festivals in the early spring alone. We will also be featuring the bus at over 16 locations in the DMV in April for National Poetry Month with Nationally acclaimed poets. Between March 10th and May 30th the bus will be in front of over 500,000 people that number will more than triple by the end of August. We have media passes and performances lined up for each festival.

On this tour we will be traveling with John Jazz (Sax, DJ, MC), Glynn Pettiford aka GUDO (Bass, Drums, DJ, MC, Producer), Melina Cienfuegos (vocalist) and Bomani Armah (Poet and community leader) as well as a small team from One Love Massive to drive, market and organize the trip. We will be doing gigs, events, bus painting parties and just generally spreading the good word about DC. We will also be travelling with an amazing photograher and videographer, Geoff Mast, to document the entire trip which will allow us to produce a documentary of the  experience that we can share with you. 

Last year we got this bus and decided to turn it into a moving art installation and tour bus. We took out most of the seats in a shuttle bus and welded 8 bunks onto the frame and turned it into a functional tour bus. We then covered the bus in a 10k Plastidip paint job, meaning we covered the bus in black rubber paint which can be painted over up to 300 times and then peeled off. We spent the last year traveling the country bridging the gap between legal and illegal street art by covering the bus in amazing graffiti everywhere we went and we aren't stopping now.

This current tour will make stops in:

3/10 Charlotte NC

3/11 Montgomery AL

3/12 New Orleans LA

3/16 - 3/23 Austin TX

3/23 Dallas TX

3/24 Nashville TN & Memphis TN

3/25 Cincinnati OH

3/26-3/31 Detroit MI

04/01 Pittsburgh, PA

We will arrive back in DC again on April 2nd. If you live in any of these towns and want to have our awesome bus parked in front of your house let us know :) 


 What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $7,500 so that we can turn the bus into a much more efficient vehicle with a significantly smaller imprint and cost.

  • The Solar panels will power our laptops and cell phones as well as provide free power for people to charge their phones during events. All 100% green. A little bit of power can go a long way in terms of lighting, phone charging and basic needs. The less we use the generator the better, solar panels are the answer.  It's a big black bus that soaks up sunlight all day and we would like to harness that and use it.
  • Repair the AC. It needs to be replaced and will cost approx $2500. This is an expensive repair but crucial come May, it gets hot in the bus real quick. With the windows painted shut it leaves very little room for fresh air. Living on a bus is pretty awesome until it hits 80 and there's no AC.
  • Converting the engine to process biodiesel will help us save money on the road and make the bus greener, plus smelling like french fries all the time cant be bad can it? Not only can we use less gas but we can support local bio-diesel makers and local restaurants. Win win. 
  • The generator will help us power the sound systems and air conditioning at night when we aren't near a power source. An electric generator is much more quiet which means we can park almost anywhere and still have a function bus without disturbing every possible neighbor.  We can save a lot of money on lodging by being able to renegade park. We have a generator but we would like to avoid using it as much as possible because its loud and burns a lot of gas. 
  • The small budget is for repairs on the road because believe us, they will happen. Big buses have big repairs. The bus is not old and in great shape and has very few miles on it and a Diesel engine. It's far from a money pit but big machines need big repairs and maintenance, it's inevitable.
  • If we don't reach our goal we will use the funds for the most important things first and then work our way down. Every dollar is helpful, no amount is too small. 

Why are we asking for your help?

  • We are doing this campaign because we think we could do a better of job of not impacting the environment so much when we travel. It's a really simple fix; solar panels, electric generator, biodiesel conversion, etc. The bus is in great shape but making a few adjustments would really reduce not only our imprint but our expenses too.
  • The One Love Bus is not a party bus, we don't make any money with the bus and we don't want to. Its not about money its about art and exposure for the artists as well as bridging the gap between the people who want art and music and the people who make it, on a much more obtainable level than what you will find in a gallery. We are doing important work and we need a hand with the costs.
  • Everyone involved is invested in making this work. Everyone is giving everything they have to spread the good word about the One Love Bus and why music and art are so important. A small financial donation from a lot of people will make our trips safer, more comfortable and move available. A little bit goes a long way, help us support the artistic community. If everyone reading this gave $1 we would reach our goal. 
What do you get out of it?

  • We have awesome perks including  DC AS FUCK shirts, DC Face Masks, Stickers, Lighters, Pure Hemp Rolling papers,  a Love Mixtape, a copy of the Documentary of the trip, your name or message custom painted on the Bus with a top quality print for you to frame and many other awesome perks. Maybe you will even get a spot on the bus for one of our trips.

Risks & Challenges

The hardest part about this bus is the expense of it all, both financial and personal. Living on a bus for weeks at a time can be trying but we are committed to spreading love through street art  and music and your help will make all the difference. 

  • If we are fully equipped we can go anywhere and do anything.
  • We have a full team ready to go we just need the budget to stay safe, cool and moving.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share, Share and Share. If you think this is pretty awesome and worth your donation your friends will probably feel the same, please share your donations with your world to help push this thing forward. 

Thank you in advance for being so awesome and helping us reach our goals.

We have awesome perks including  DC AS FUCK shirts, DC Face Masks, Stickers, Lighters, Pure Hemp Rolling papers,  a Love Mixtape, a copy of the Documentary of the trip, your name or message custom painted on the Bus with a top quality print for you to frame and many other awesome perks. Maybe you will even get a spot on the bus for one of our trips. 






Risks & ChallengesThe hardest part about this bus is the expense of it all, both financial and personal. Living on a bus for weeks at a time can be trying but we are committed to spreading love through street art  and music and your help will make all the difference. 
If we are fully equipped we can go anywhere and do anything.
We have a full team ready to go we just need the budget to stay safe, cool and moving.
Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Share, Share and Share. If you think this is pretty awesome and worth your donation your friends will probably feel the same, please share your donations with your world to help push this thing forward. 
Thank you in advance for being so awesome and helping us reach our goals.

story:
Who are Ormond Opera ?

Named after Ormond Road in Richmond, Surrey, Ormond Opera was formed in 2015 by Justin Bindley and Rosalind O’Dowd with a view to presenting staged, costumed opera concerts and full operas with piano accompaniment.

The aim is to mix emerging and experienced artists in a diverse repertoire that will see us perform operas by Puccini, Sullivan and Verdi amongst many others in the future.

Our first season sees us presenting scenes from five popular operas by Puccini, followed by a concert of Gilbert & Sullivan. 

Rosalind O’Dowd – Creative Director

Rosalind has a wide audience following around the Richmond area, having sung locally over a number of years for Richmond Choral Society, CantantiCamerati, Isleworth Baroque, West London Opera, at the Twickenham Festival and in the concert series Soprano Soprano!, which recently celebrated its 8th concert.

Before turning professional, Rosalind spent 10 years working in marketing for a variety of blue-chip companies and brings a wealth of business experience to this new musical venture.

Justin Bindley – Musical Director

Justin is a highly experienced musician with a career spanning over 20 years. Alongside his singing career he has pursued a long standing singing and coaching practise , and also his first love in music –  conducting and musical direction. He has formed and managed various opera groups over the years.  In 2013 he was appointed Music Director of the Salveo Singers, a department of Health choir, which he ran until 2014.

Plans for 2015-16

Ormond is planning for the long term.  It aims to build up a successful following through popular concerts, which can be replicated across the UK and beyond.

26th September 2015 •Inaugarual concert: Puccini Chunks, Richmond

3rd October 2015 •Gilbert and Sullivan Concert, Ware

17th October 2015 •Gilbert and Sullivan Concert, Birmingham

Christmas 2015 •Concert in Richmond

Spring-Summer 2016 •Madama Butterfly (extract) and The Pirates of Penzance (extract) •UK Tour of the Gilbert and Sullivan concert

Summer onwards….•Full opera •Further opera extracts concerts •Workshops and masterclasses

What We Need 

Putting on operas can be an expensive business.  Ormond Opera wants to present professional, high quality operas, and this can come at a cost.

Our shopping list includes:

Venue hire  £  120.00
Singers' fees  £  800.00
Accompanist fees  £  100.00
Alcohol licence  £  21.00
MD Fee  £  250.00
Marketing/PR  £  150.00
Bar   £  200.00
Flowers/gifts  £  50.00
Programmes  £  160.00
Ticket printing  £  20.00
Flyers  £  40.00
URL & website  £  10.00
Not to mention costumes, transport, sets, lighting, back stage team etc etc.....

The Impact

'Music expresses that which cannot be said and on which it is impossible to be silent.'  

Victor Hugo

Not only will Ormond Opera give pleasure and enjoyment to audiences, but it will give the artists involved invaluable experience for their ongoing careers.  Rosalind O'Dowd, Creative Director, says 'I was very grateful in the early days of my career to experience being part of some fabulous operas, and I hope to give that opportunity to others.' 

We want people to be excited by opera, and give them access to it in venues near where they are.

Challenges

In setting up an opera company, the challenges begin immediately.  The set up costs are high (we have a long shopping list!) and the success of the company will be, in large part, whether we can find a critical mass of audience members who will pay to watch us perform, time and time again.

However, in starting in Richmond, where some of the current Ormond Opera artists are already well known, it is hoped that enough audience members will attend, to give us a fantastic start.  It is with your help in donating that it will really take the pressure off worrying about whether our first concert will result in profit or loss, so we can concentrate on delivering top class music.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, that doesn't mean we don't need your help!

  • Tweet about us @ormondopera, like our Facebook page, and share this page with your friends and colleagues.
  • Are you local to Richmond, Ware or Birmingham ?  Can you give out some flyers and invite your friends along to watch us ?

story:
My name is Jesse Atkinson and I am the CEO of Urban Threshold Inc and I am the author of the critically acclaimed book "The Independent Music Grind." Equally important, I am the founder of the Underground Music Awards, which has become the biggest national award show for independent urban music artists. The Underground Music Awards were created to acknowledge and honor the achievements and contributions of independent artists and producers within the urban music scene.

After 11 successful years, Urban Threshold Enterprises Inc. continues to make it our top priority to bring together music professionals, artists, DJ's, fans, media outlets and more to network, build relationships and celebrate the culture of independent urban music. Past winners of the UMA's include Nicki Minaj, MGK, Maino, Cory Gunz, Papoose, Fred The Godson and so many others.

Not only do we pay homage to the future stars, we also honor the legends in the Urban Music genre. Past Honorees of Urban Threshold's Underground Music Awards include: Mr. Cheeks, Michael Bivins, Ice T, Naughty By Nature, DJ Marley Marl, The Force MD's, EPMD, Kid Capri, MOP, Slick Rick, Run DMC, Whoodini, and many more.

In the previous years this event has been covered by such prestigious press as MTV, XXL, AllHipHop.com, Thisis50.com, The Village Voice, and more.


THE MAGNITUDE OF YOUR SUPPORT NEEDED TO CREATE THIS EVENT:

The underground is what keeps Hip Hop alive. The underground is what keeps Hip Hop leveled. We have dedicated ourselves to bridging the gap between the unsigned artist and the music industry. Your contribution will assist us in taking the Underground Music Awards to another level.

We would greatly appreciate a donation to help us honor the future stars and legends of the urban music genre . In return for your generosity, we are able to provide various different benefits to you such as a copy of the critically acclaimed book "The Independent Music Grind," tickets to the 2015 UMA's and more.




What We Need & What You Get

We are asking your assistance to complete a total funding of $25,000 for the 2015 Underground Music Awards event, which is scheduled to take place October 25th, 2015 in NYC. Here’s what your contribution will go towards:

Venue rental fee: BB Kings in Times square, NYC

Printed Program Booklets

Step n Repeat (print & delivery)

Production of Awards/Trophies

Additional Security

Flyers

VIP invites for music executives



The Impact

Every year there are incredible records released by independent labels and artists. Very rarely do the institutional accolades of the music industry reach or embrace the independent music community of artists and fans who now represent 32% of all global music sales. Hence, the Underground Music Awards Program was born to fill that void.

We encourage community awareness, artistry enrichment, family responsibility & we teach the importance of maintaining stable business relationships. For over 10 years, Urban Threshold has provided valuable services to educate, energize and inspire independent music artists and producers. 

We hope that you understand and support our vision by helping us to fund the 2014 Underground Music Awards.




Challenges

Our mission is to continue to present the Underground Music Awards on a major platform. The urban independent music community deserves that. We plan on presenting the 2015 UMA's at The legendary BB Kings concert hall in the heart of Times Square, NYC. BB Kings is an amazing venue. However, it is also a very expensive venue. Right now, funding the rental of the BB Kings Concert Hall is our biggest challenge. We are targeting a myriad of potential sponsors to help to underwrite the costs. However, we do need the support of the many fans and artists of the urban music community to make the 2015 Underground Music Awards a success.


Other Ways You Can Help

For those of you who can't contribute financially, please help by getting the word out about our campaign for the 2015 Underground Music Awards. Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
"Elevation" 

Danny Janklow's 1st Full Length Album

My journey with music began when I was first handed a saxophone by my middle school band teacher. Unbeknownst to me, at that time, that music would help me transform myself, my soul and touch countless lives young and old. This evolution has given way to so many opportunities to make the world just a bit brighter, more soulful and harmonious. This campaign is a culmination of my many years of learning music, performing and teaching to prepare me to disseminate my craft in an elevating work for you and others to enjoy. "Elevation" is my first full length debut album, featuring some of today's best and brightest contemporary artists. With friends and respected colleagues, I have been graced to have recorded this album which features nearly all original tunes and compositions written by me. As well, these tunes are masterfully executed by the likes of Eric Reed, John Beasley, Ben Williams, Ben Shepherd, Jonathan Pinson, Sam Barsh, Nick Mancini, Jesse Palter, & Michael Mayo. We are truly excited to have you become a part in the phenomenal production. We believe it will be one of the best new albums to date!


As some of you may know, the recording industry has made many changes that affect how artists are published and managed. The digital age has enabled instantaneous downloads nearly anywhere, anytime. Thus, this campaign will help Elevation succeed in not only it's rendered form, but to be promoted nationally and globally to appreciative and discerning music enthusiasts. Your contribution will help insure that this music is professionally mixed mastered edited, published and also printing of CD's, cover art, promoted and even toured. Money will be utilized for the costs of the post production as mentioned, distribution and video promotion as well as marketing to expand its reach through radio and other distribution channels. This is a well thought plan that enables us to take our destiny in our own hands. I am fortunate to have the support of mentors and industry execs alike all interested in leveraging what we are creating and if you have read this far, we know you are like minded and value the arts as we do. We are planning some amazing perks that will put you front and center with this new classic! Our best foot has been placed forward and you can help us in this next step! Make a contribution of $5, $20, $100, $2000 every dime brings this project to a new level! 


More ways to help! we welcome you sharing this link, promoting our webpage as well as utilizing the indigo go share tools available to get the word out. Thank you again for your contribution in whatever form it takes, may you be elevated for your kindness.

Danny Janklow - Saxophonist/Composer 

25-year-old Danny Janklow is quickly gaining international recognition for his soulful and innovative musical voice. His heart-felt, passionate, and highly energetic music has reached and inspired thousands of listeners from Japan to Holland to Mexico. His live performances, often described as "emotionally charged" and "vibrant celebrations," leave his listeners always wanting more...  

Born in Tarzana, CA in 1989, Danny Janklow was handed the saxophone at the age of 11. His life would soon change as he was introduced to the remarkable sounds of Charlie Parker, Cannonball Adderley, and John Coltrane. Just 2 years later, it was obvious to all that the music had chosen him. During his time at Agoura High School, Danny was recognized by Wynton Marsalis and the Lincoln Center Jazz Orchestra as the first-ever triple instrument "Outstanding Soloist" on tenor saxophone, flute and clarinet.

In 2007, Danny was awarded a full-tuition scholarship to Philadelphia's Temple University Boyer College of Music and Dance where he was mentored by saxophone legend Dick Oatts and incredible trumpeter Terell Stafford. In 2010, Danny won 1st place in the North American Saxophone Alliance competition held in Athens, Georgia. While living on the east coast, he frequently played at the Village Vanguard with the Vanguard Jazz Orchestra, the Kimmel Center, the Apollo in Harlem, and Dizzy's Club Coca-Cola in New York.

After graduating in 2011, Danny moved back to Los Angeles to take the scene by storm. He rapidly became one of LA's most in-demand saxophonists and bandleaders. In August 2012, he won 1st place at the Detroit Jazz Festival Saxophone Competition and headlined on that year's festival. He took part in a 2-year Mentor program teaching at Stanford Jazz Camp where he discovered his deep passion for teaching students of all ages. In 2013, he was selectively chosen as a semi-finalist to compete in the Thelonious Monk International Saxophone Competition in Washington D.C.

Danny has enjoyed the pleasure of sharing the stage and recording with the likes of Wynton and Branford Marsalis, Benny Golson, Terell Stafford, Wycliffe Gordon, Eric Reed, John Beasley, Ben Williams, Jason Moran, Savion Glover, Vanguard Jazz Orchestra, Bill Holman Big Band, Gordon Goodwin, Barbara Morrison and Jimmy Heath.

The "Elevation"  album is a true celebration of passionate, soulful, and beautiful music. This is Danny's feature length album debut! Aside from a cover of Radiohead's "Creep," the album features Danny's original music written over the span of 6 years. Danny was honored to be joined by the most incredible musicians he knew to play on this remarkable studio session.The result was a complete masterful performance by everyone. Magic shined through on each note that was played. The  record's title "Elevation" is a reference to the remarkable process of lifting one's spirit and reaching new spiritual & emotional peaks. 

With your generous help, we will be able accomplish mixing, mastering, packaging, promotion, and completing the final product of this glorious album. We will be releasing music videos from the studio session and much more to come over the course of the campaign.

We truly appreciate you!!!

story:
What’s our goal?

Opera NEO is a San Diego-based opera company and educational program for young opera singers. We are seeking to raise $15,000 to fund the symphony orchestra for our 2015 summer season and the education of the extraordinary young artists in our program.

Where will the money go?

Opera is a unique art form that is a synergy of the most powerful human expressions: poetry, drama, singing, instrumental music, dance, visual arts, color and light. It is international, dynamic, and exciting. But this is why it is also one of the most expensive artistic endeavors.

Part of the amazing musical experience is created by the 30 musicians playing in the orchestra.

What is Opera NEO?

Opera NEO is a venture for young opera singers created to prepare and inspire them to grow and perform at the highest level. Participation in the program is based on a highly selective national audition process. Selected singers are voice majors in nationally recognized conservatories and college music programs, and post-graduate young professionals. We strive to unlock their full potential while nurturing each individual's artistic qualities and personality to help them develop into independent and successful artists. In addition to classes, seminars, lessons and master classes the young artists perform in two fully staged opera productions accompanied by a symphony orchestra.

Why support Opera NEO?

We are passionate about opera as a modern art form and about educating the artists of the future. We are here to help the most talented singers by providing training, experience, and confidence. Opera NEO is the only professional opera-training program in San Diego and the only workshop of its kind in Southern California. We believe in the power of working together. We invite you to join us as we create experiences that will invest in the future of opera, enrich the life of our community, and contribute to our vibrant city. Opera NEO is educating the artists of the future and giving them opportunities to perform for you today!

We have one month left to raise this money! With your help we can do it!


More info: www.operaneo.com

THANK YOU!

story:
Dear friends, family and my dearest fans, 

My first solo album is almost ready for release. I have spent may countless hours working very hard and putting my own resources be it financial or otherwise, into the album. It has entailed lots of blood, sweat and tears but I am proud to say that the finish line is in sight. 

As I make the final push, I turn to you, my loyal supporters, to help make my first album a reality. I humbly ask that you pledge to buy my first album instead  of seeking out a pirated copy. The price is only $10 for a very fine quality mastered audio CD in a sealed, cool plastic jewel case, all printed and recorded proudly in Canada. 

This pledge will not only boost my morale but also give me a better idea as to how many CDs I need for bulk production so that I don't shoot myself in the foot. : )

If you would really like to contribute, here are some cool ways:

1. For $10, you can either get my digital album via a downloadable link containing high quality .mp3 or .wav files or as a playable CD shipped to you via snail mail. (Shipping only within USA or Canada)

2. For $25, you will receive both my digital album via a downloadable link containing high quality .mp3 or .wav files and a playable audio CD shipped directly to you. (Shipping only within USA or Canada)

3. For $100, you will be recognized under "Special Thanks" on my album's hard-copy booklet, in addition to receiving both a downloadable version of the album and an audio CD, as described above. 

4. For $500, you will become an executive producer of my debut album, plus all of the above.

Sounds like a great deal? It sure is :D

So here is a quick breakdown where you money will actually go:

$3,000 will go towards the recording, mixing and mastering of the full album.

$1,000 will go towards the session musicians who will play any live instruments.

$500 will go towards the CD cover and booklet design of the album.

$2,000 will go towards the printing/CD replication of the album.

$500 will go for any miscellaneous expenses that are not included above.

I personally like to thank everyone for their time, support and consideration. If you can't purchase/pledge towards my new album, I would greatly appreciate if you could share my music as support takes on many forms so please join me on www.facebook.com/asadques or www.twitter.com/asadques and wish me luck!

Let's keep the music and indie artists alive!

All the love & peace...

Asad Que.

www.asadque.com

www.soundcloud.com/asadques

www.youtube.com/asadques

www.vimeo.com/asadques

story:
BIO

Don't you(,) mean people? is a post-rock band from Thunder Bay Ontario and have been around since 2011. Since then these three gentlemen have released one six track album titled "EP!!" which won best Thunder Bay album of 2013. They have also released a demo entitled "Comfy onion" which is a teaser for their first full-length "Who cares?" to be released in the fall of 2015.

"Who cares?" is going to play an important role as our first full length album. We are planning to take this album across the country and we need your help to make it happen. A band's first full length sets a standard which that band will always be compared to, and we believe that "Who cares?" is a perfect example of a first album gone right.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $4,500 to cover our expenses for the production of the physical albums. We are producing 12" vinyl records and custom flash drives.  The records will come with our 9 track album and one digital-only bonus track.

We are also offering up other things not related specifically to the album including private concerts and play-through videos!

If we don't meet our goal, don't worry! You will still receive the perk that you paid for. But to help reach our goal please share this crowdfunding campaign on your social media such as facebook, twitter, instagram, arts and culture mags, news media, music blogs, and by good old fashioned word-of-mouth.

The Impact

Any band's first full-length record is a big deal! The rest of a band's career relies on it. So far we have produced an EP which won Thunder Bay's best album in 2013. We are very proud of our previous work, but we guarantee that this record is our best work yet! We know that this record is going to make a splash in Canada's national music scene as well as the international math-rock/post-rock scene. Be an early supporter, you'll earn bragging rights!

Risks & Challenges

Recording a studio album is EXPENSIVE! We have already exhausted our individual savings accounts paying for the recording, mixing and mastering of our songs. But it's entirely worth it; the record sounds great! We are prepared to produce this entire project ourselves, but with your help we can move forward with the physical production AND pay our bills on time.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're as broke as us or if you want to buy a record from us personally when we go on tour in the fall, make some noise on the internet, scream about it in the street and talk proactively about it at quaint social gatherings.

We need to get the word out about our record to as many people as possible. If you know of any arts and culture magazines/websites/blogs etc. that have an audience which is receptive to our type of music send us a message or help us get in contact with them! If you're interested in going out into the world to put posters up in your local area let us know and you can become an official member of the DYMP street-team!

story:
Who are we?

Yemadas is composed of seven artists, including musicians, dancers, theater actors of improvisation and poets. 

Inspired by ancient cultures of countries considered as poor and 3º world, they discovered that his artistic wealth,musical, spiritual is enormous and found a similarity in all of them, that all these peoples have a happiness,joy, spirit of sharing,optimism and unity.

It is a project that was born in India in 2011 ,at Auroville (www.auroville.org), eco-village that looks for human unity.

 Than the band at 2014 decided to go and live at Portugal, once we love this country and we found a piece of land with the potencial to  realize our dreams

The main characteristic of Yemadas, is the toghetherness, the sense of equality, of sharing,harmony between all the members at the band. Actually all the band lives togheter at their own land ,south of Portugal, called YEMADA-that means Mountain Farm.

 In YEMADA  they are developing a new Project, how to live in full harmony with the Nature and themselves, looking foorward to produce their own food. This CD is one way of raising funds to develop the Farm and realize their dream.



What do we need?

 -We need 3000 Euros for making our CD ready:

-1500 Euros for recordings, materials(mics,stands,mixing table,sound engineer)

-500 Euros for design and printing of the covers

-1000 Euros for editing and publishing the CDS(making 1000 copies)

The CD - Chamado

This CD is to raise funds for the Yemadas Community Farm, where we have many infrastrutures to improve and a organic farming Project to develop.

-New Community Kitchen

-Studio for receiving artists and bands for Residencies in Nature

-Childrens Land(playground for the Kids)

-Toilets

-Nursery

 -Irrigation System

Why the CD?

Yemadas wants to survive with their passions Art and Nature, and also  to be able to live togheter as a band and a community that supports eachother.

 We are trying to mantain ourselves at the farm and not going out individualy to work in things that we don t believe just for financial issues.

 We found this Cd the best way of sharing our good enenergy, deep messages and vibes that we have been living at the Land  with other people outside. At the same time geting we look foorward to generate enough income to keep moving our project YEMADA FARM and to realize our vision of Sel suficiency and Independence.

WE are looking forrward for your suport and please spread the word!.

 THANK YOU ALL THAT SUPORT THIS PROJECT!
 WE APRECIATE YOUR TRUST!!
 BEM HAJA!!!

story:
Mykel Music

It has been my lifelong dream to release my very own album, and make it big in the music industry.
As a senior in high school, I even took out a loan to pay for my first 3-song EP titled "Imagine". Three of the songs on my EP were selected as tracks for MusicWorks, a national dance choreography CD, and my song "Just Wanted You to Know" was featured in the Lifetime Original Movie "His Secret Family". 
Now I need your help to finish the rest! This campaign is the start of a lifelong career in music, and entertaining that I want YOU to be a part of. 

What do we need?

My goal with this $10,000 is to release a 4-song EP to then combine with my previous EP to become a 7 song Album. This new material will be toured, and pitched to Television and Film programs.

  • 8,000 Dollars will be going toward Production, Studio Time, and Mastering
  • 2,000 Dollars will go toward distribution and music videos.
Any amount is greatly appreciated. Also, as a thank you for your donation, you will be eligible for perks such as - Shout Outs on my Social Media Channels, Free Copies of the Album, A chance to be an Extra in my Music Video, Executive Producer Credit, and even a Personalized Concert for you and up to 10 friends!
If we don't reach the target goal, we will downsize the project by either doing lower scale music videos, or reducing the amount of songs on the EP.

Your Impact

This project has been close to my heart, and I hope to make a difference by producing quality music with a message. In todays society I would love to be a positive example. 

I am willing to work as hard as I can to make this dream a reality, and I want YOU to get in on the ground floor of the movement that is Mykel Music!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the funds to contribute to the movement, you can still help out by spreading the word about the project. Indiegogo even has a built in share tool we can use to get the word out about this amazing project.

Thank you so much for your support, and lets go create something AWESOME!

story:
Short Summary


  • The Vineyard Band is a country music band comprised of sibling trio, Amber, Eddie & Andrew Pierce.   We are almost ready to release our debut album, "Cheap Motel Rooms," but we need your help!
  • It has been our life long dream to complete an album.  We started recording in December of 2014 & finished the recording process in October 2015.  Now we are ready to take the next steps to make our dream a reality!
  • If you donate and spread the word, not only will you be helping us complete our album but you will also be contributing to the music community.


What We Need

We need $1,100 to complete our album, here is a breakdown of costs:

  • 100 CDs in jackets with shipping = $300.  (DiscBison.com)
  • Album Copyrights = $50.  (Copyright.gov)
  • Album artwork/graphic design = $150.  (Roberto Wilson-Gimeno)

  • Album Mastering = $300.  (Shadow Sound Studio, Macon, Ga.)

  • Promotional Merchandise  = $300  (T-shirts, Coozies, Stickers, Etc.)

What You Get

For your generosity & support, we will show our appreciation with the following perks:

  • For just $10, you will receive your own personal, signed copy of the album, a coozie & a sticker!
  • For only $25, you will receive your own personal, signed copy of the album, a t-shirt, a coozie & a sticker!
  • For a donation of $50, you will receive two signed copies of the album, two tshirts, two cozies & 2 stickers.
  • For $100, you will  receive two signed copies of the album, two tshirts, two cozies & 2 stickers AND special mention in the album credits!

For $100, you will  receive two signed copies of the album, two tshirts, two cozies & 2 stickers AND special mention in the album credits!

story:
Short Summary

Heading into its 4th year, the Tiffin Music and Art Festival was founded to raise awareness for the arts in the greater Tiffin, Ohio area, as well as benefit the surrounding community.  In the first three years attendance and the number of performers grew, and profits from the event were donated to the Parks and Recreation Department or to save Tiffin's fireworks one year.

This year we want to take the festival to the next level, and have booked some great headliners and attractions to increase attendance and hopefully generate a larger profit.  The profits from the event this year and for years in the future will fund the Tiffin Music and Art Festival Scholarship program, which will award a $500 scholarship to at least two Tiffin high school seniors who will be pursuing further education in the performing or visual arts.

What We Need & What You Get

What we need is help raising the remaining amount of expenses for the festival that this years sponsorships have not covered.  The operating expenses for this years festival are projected around $22,000.  To date we've been able to secure donations and sponsorships to cover around $6,000 of the cost, but we are seeking to raise the remaining difference so we can ensure that all profits from the event can fund the scholarship campaign.  We are asking for slightly over the difference to account for the potential 18% fee we can face if your goal is not met.

In exchange for your financial contribution, we are offering a number of packages that reward you with some Tiffin Music and Art Festival swag, or a VIP experience at this years festival.  

We are a 501C3 non-profit organization, all staff members donate their time served, and all money raised after expenses for the event goes directly to funding the scholarship program. 

The Impact

In prior years the festival has always generated a profit, and profits have gone to the Tiffin Parks and Recreation Department, or to save the city's fireworks.

This year we introduced our Tiffin Music and Art Festival Scholarship program, which awards at least two $500 scholarships to area high school seniors pursuing further education in the performing or visual arts from both Tiffin Columbian and Tiffin Calvert high schools in Tiffin, Ohio.  

We believe in paying it forward, and hope that by helping area students to gain the knowledge they seek, they will come back and help with the festival and raise awareness for music and arts in the greater Tiffin community.  

Simply put, the more profit we have at the end of the festival, the more students we can help out, with larger and more awards.  

If enough of a profit exists we also want to establish a fund that will provide a cushion should future festivals have inclement weather or other mitigating circumstances, so that we can consistently provide impact to graduating high school seniors year in and year out.

Risks & Challenges

The risks and challenges we have faced in the past are weather, promotion, and attendance.  Weather wise we plan on having a sufficient number of tents, as well as covered stages so that the festival can go on rain or shine.  Promotion wise we have considerably stepped up where we are advertising the event this year.  Attendance wise we are more than confident that our line up will bring a large crowd and give us a raise in attendance over last years plateau.

The new risk and challenge is with adding more attractions and headliners, our cost has nearly doubled compared to years prior.  We are hoping to overcome this increase by fundraising via this campaign, as well as getting in touch with more companies about sponsorships.  We've also decided to incorporate a minimum donation to get into the beer garden area.  This will help to ensure that we raise enough money to not only cover our costs, but be able to provide great scholarships, and possibly establish a fund that will offer some cushion for future festivals and scholarships.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford a financial donation we invite you to visit our Get Involved / Volunteer page.  We have a number of positions we are looking to fill for this year and moving forward, as well as forms to fill out to volunteer for the festival.

story:
The Goal

Hey guys, Keith Kenny here.  I've been performing my "one-man-rock band"  show around the country for the past 12 years and for the first time ever I had an opportunity to record my songs with Producer / Engineer Justin Guip.  Justin is currently the drummer for Hot Tuna and has won three Grammy Awards as Sound Engineer for Levon Helm on his last three studio albums.  Having his ear on my songs was an honor and his influence during the recording process really brought the project to the next level for me.  The album is an eclectic mix of ten original songs deeply rooted in guitar and banjo riffs, foot stomping percussion, and vocal melody hooks.   I truly believe that it covers the gamut of musical influences I've had throughout my life digging into rock, blues, folk & heavy metal.  I think it's the best work I have put forth to date.  With this great opportunity came some hefty expenses that I am hoping to raise here so that I can give this album the proper release that it deserves.  I have also been working with a 3D printing design team to make the perks of this campaign extremely unique and special for everyone who is willing to contribute.  Thank you for taking the time to read this and I am so grateful for your support.  

The Costs of Producing the Album

  • Recording and Mixing - $8000
  • Mastering - $1000
  • CD Pressing / Duplication - $1000
  • (OPTIONAL) Vinyl Pressing / Duplication - $2000

If we exceed the goal of $10,000, additional donations will go towards pressing VINYL!!!

  • Limited Edition Vinyl for everyone who contributed $100 or more to the campaign
  • If we don't reach our goal that's OK too, any contributions will still be put towards the costs of producing the album. 

 Perks for Contributing

  • Advance Digital Download -$10
  • Suitcase Keychain + Advance Digital Download - $20
  • Signed CD and Digital Download- $30
  • Mini 3D Printed Suitcase and Signed CD - $50
  • T-Shirt Bundle with Signed CD and Mini Suitcases - $75
  • 3D Printed Suitcase CD Package - $100
  • Complete Discography & 3D Printed Merch Package - $125
  • Original Handwritten Lyric Sheet & 3D Printed Merch Package - $150
  • VIP Seating & 3D Printed Merch Package at Album Release Show -$200
  • Studio Visit and Album Preview - $300
  • Limited Edition Suitcase Photo Lyric Book (8 -1/2" x 11") - $400
  • Record Your Band at Studio 303 - 10 hours with Keith - $500
  • Private Show for YOU and your friends - $1000
  • Executive Producer Credit - $2000
  • Two Night Vegas Getaway - See Keith at House of Blues - $3000

Where your money goes

5% of all donations automatically go to Indiegogo.com for hosting this campaign.  3% of donations go to credit card fees.  If you contribute $100... Indiegogo.com takes $5, Credit Card Fee takes $3,  and I will receive the remaining $92.

The Impact

The nature of the music business today has left a lot of hardworking musicians to fend for themselves because there are less record labels willing to invest in upcoming artists.  In a way this new model allows for us to connect with our fans in a more direct way and keep our creative freedom without being manipulated by record executives.  Your contribution is the support that makes the music possible.  Every dollar goes right back into making more music!   

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the funds to contribute there are still other ways you can help:

  • Share the campaign video with your friends on Social Media
  • Encourage friends or family to donate
  • Help promote an upcoming show 
  • Come see a live performance 
  • Buy some music from the website www.KeithKenny.com/music , iTunes, or CD Baby. 
  • Listen to me on Spotify (I'll get 0.0001 cents for each listen!!!)
story_txt:
The Goal
Hey guys, Keith Kenny here.  I've been performing my "one-man-rock band"  show around the country for the past 12 years and for the first time ever I had an opportunity to record my songs with Producer / Engineer Justin Guip.  Justin is currently the drummer for Hot Tuna and has won three Grammy Awards as Sound Engineer for Levon Helm on his last three studio albums.  Having his ear on my songs was an honor and his influence during the recording process really brought the project to the next level for me.  The album is an eclectic mix of ten original songs deeply rooted in guitar and banjo riffs, foot stomping percussion, and vocal melody hooks.   I truly believe that it covers the gamut of musical influences I've had throughout my life digging into rock, blues, folk & heavy metal.  I think it's the best work I have put forth to date.  With this great opportunity came some hefty expenses that I am hoping to raise here so that I can give this album the proper release that it deserves.  I have also been working with a 3D printing design team to make the perks of this campaign extremely unique and special for everyone who is willing to contribute.  Thank you for taking the time to read this and I am so grateful for your support.  

The Costs of Producing the Album

Recording and Mixing - $8000
Mastering - $1000

story:
Sono nata e cresciuta nella musica, la mia più grande libertà e la mia più grande schiavitù.
Quando ho incontrato Paul Whitehead, la sua arte e i suoi aneddoti mi hanno riportato ai racconti che mio papà mi narrava da piccolina: le slitte di legno a percorrere distese innevate, le corse dei bambini all'uscita di scuola come fossero trenini elettrici, il mito degli anni '70, dove tutto sembrava una gigante scoperta ed ogni conquista era motore di bellezza e sorpresa.

Chi è Paul Whitehead
Paul Whitehead, illustratore inglese, è uno dei più grandi disegnatori di copertine della storia del rock.
A metà degli anni '60 realizzò la sua prima cover per un album di Fats Domino, ripubblicato con una nuova veste grafica. Dopo l'incontro con il produttore John Anthony, Whitehead fu messo in contatto con i Genesis e gli fu affidato l'incarico di disegnare la copertina di "Trespass": fu in questa occasione che Paul dimostrò al mondo la sua straordinaria capacità visiva ed espressiva.
Per i Genesis l’artista ha realizzato anche le copertine di “Nursery Cryme” e “Foxtrot”, entrando di diritto nella storia visuale e iconica del prog-rock degli anni Settanta.
Nel corso dei decenni successivi, Whitehead ha firmato – tra le altre – alcune copertine per i Van der Graaf Generator, Peter Hammill e Le Orme.

Come nascono i suoi disegni?
"Quando lavoro con un cantante o un gruppo voglio sempre ascoltare la musica e leggere i testi. Provo a catturare le sue idee creando un’immagine che rispecchi l’album. Dipingo di continuo. Quando mi commissionano un lavoro può capitare che abbia già il quadro adatto”.

Il suo stile
“Sono vicino ai surrealisti: le opere della mente, dei sogni, dell’immaginazione. Un importante riferimento culturale resta la copertina di “Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band” dei Beatles, realizzata da Peter Blake”.

Sito ufficiale
www.paulwhitehead.com

Le sue opere
Genesis: Trespass


Genesis: Nursery Cryme


Genesis: Foxtrot


Grazie!!

Vi chiedo un contributo per vedere impresso uno scorcio di questi ricordi nella copertina del mio secondo album.
Grazie di cuore,
Ilenia Volpe

Passaparola!

https://www.indiegogo.com/project/preview/8991c339

story:
Summary
Rikroshi (fka Bells and Parks) is a dream pop duo from Austin, Texas formed in May of 2015. The band consists of vocalist, guitarist and pianist Tessa Bennetch and drummer Darryl Schomberg II. Their self titled debut album will be released Summer/Fall of 2015.

Formerly known as Bells and Parks, this "dreamy, electronic, indie outfit" of Tessa (vocals, synth, guitar) and Darryl (drums) has captivated the ATX community with "dreamy hooks plus interplaying guitar and synth lines...so delectable, you'd think they were Swedish." - Lyynks Music

We are teaming up with Stuart Baker (Caveshare Studios), frontman of Young Tongue, to record and produce our first full-length album, full of ornate synthesizers, driving rhythms, and lyrics that explore the dreams of our minds and souls. We are looking to you, our friends, to help us to fund our release of the new record. With your continued love and support we can make this happen.

What We Need & What You Get:

The cost of professionally recording, mixing, mastering, manufacturing, promoting, and distributing an album is quite high, so I've come up with a very modest $7,500 dollar budget to get the job done well. Your generous contribution will go toward:

. Tracking & Mixing- $2,500
. Mastering - $1,500
. Manufacturing - $1,500

. Publicist- $2,000

We've also come up with some great little perks as a small thank you for your generous contribution to my music. You can see them in the "Perks" section on the right!

We can't wait for you to hear the new album!
Thank you for your encouragement and support.

Love,
Rikroshi

https://vimeo.com/121398551
https://rikroshi.bandcamp.com/
https://soundcloud.com/rikroshi
https://www.facebook.com/pages/Rikroshi/6295485...



More about Rikroshi (fka Bells and Parks):
Following the Bells and Parks EP, Versailles--hailed as "a powerful and ambitious EP" by Deli Magazine, readers of the magazine voted the outfit Artist of the Month.
                                                                 ~~~~~~~~~~~
"....sharing a stage with SoKo earlier this year, Bells and Parks assuredly have a bright future on their horizon. Tessa Bennetch and Darryl Schomberg II commanded attention with their larger-than-life presence, and thrived on stage until the very last airy note. A second glance on stage proved that Bennetch and Schomberg prevail in creating something much larger than what you would expect from a musical duo and succeeded in creating an encompassing electro-synth sound, reminiscent of Brooklyn-based dream-pop acts. Bennetch’s vocals put the audience in a euphoric dream-like state, her voice both soothing and strong to the senses. Schomberg drum’s echoed throughout the venue and his driving beats pulsed through to the audience’s core. Be sure to keep an eye and an ear out for their full length album, coming out in spring of 2015."
- The Austin Live Review | Contributing Writer: Trish Connelly
