story:
I'm in the finishing stages of an exciting new solo CD project, The Promise of the Sowing.  All of the songs center on the people who give us our food - farmers, fieldhands, and fisherfolk - and the earth that sustains us all.  It's an eclectic collection, honoring people and the environment, deeply rooted in tradition and place.

This album includes many of the best songs I know, ranging from field hollers to anthems, and closing with Jean Ritchie's powerful "Now Is the Cool of the Day."  Aided by the amazing talents of Kim and Reggie Harris, Mara Levine, Kathy Westra, George Stephens, Geeta Shivde, Dick Swain and Charlie Pilzer, I truly believe that The Promise of the Sowing represents some of my best work.

Copyright royalties for many of the songs will be donated to environmental or cultural conservation organizations, including Appalachian Voices, The Natural Resources Defense Council, Musicians United for Bristol Bay, and others.

Most of the work on the album is now completed - with this campaign I hope to raise $5,000 to finish the mixing, master the CD, and pay for graphic design, replication and basic promotion:

$700:  final mixing at Airshow in Takoma Park, MD
$800:  mastering at Airshow
$1000:  graphic design
$1500:  replication and printing
$750:  promotion and mailing
$250:  Indiegogo expenses

I am keeping this campaign relatively modest, but the goal is still ambitious.  Reaching $5,000 will allow a greater portion of your donation to go directly to the project, and if we exceed the goal, we'll be able to do a much stronger release.

Even if you are not able to contribute, I hope you will share the campaign with friends and help get the word out!

Bio:

Dan Schatz is a Grammy nominated folksinger, songwriter, multi-instrumentalist, producer and author.  His work has been described by reviewers as "brilliant" (Autoharpoholic), "blissful and heartfelt" (PopMatters) and "magical" (Sing Out!), and he was recently listed by Indie music blog Fatea Magazine as one of the artists in "the topmost drawers of American folk music."  He has appeared on PBS, NPR, and at concerts and festivals nationally.  In addition to his solo albums, Bring the Morning Home and The Song and the Sigh, he co-produced two major compilations - Singing Through the Hard Times: a Tribute to Utah Phillips (Righteous Babe Records), which garnered him a Grammy nomination in 2010, and the acclaimed 2014 release Dear Jean: Artists Celebrate Jean Ritchie (Compass Records).

Dan is also a Unitarian Universalist minister, serving the BuxMont Unitarian Universalist Fellowship in Warrington, Pennsylvania, which for the past two years has focused its public ministry on Climate Action.

story:
“The Visit is very close to essential listening” – Sputnikmusic

The Visit emerged barely two years ago from Ottawa’s music scene, quickly establishing a reputation for their incendiary live performances and their emotional intensity and virtuosity. The band’s unique brand of music captivated audiences and quickly set them apart. Before long, The Visit had garnered coveted slots at Nouvelle Prague Festival in Prague, Czech Republic, Ottawa’s very own RBC Bluesfest, and the Royal Conservatory’s esteemed 21C Festival in Toronto. After two years of refining their craft and sharing stages with artists of all genres, only one element was missing: an album.

Now the wait is over. The Visit's first full-length opus, Through Darkness Into Light, comes out this September. 

The band has thus far covered its expenses for recording and mixing. Now The Visit needs to raise funds to cover the mastering, manufacturing, publicity costs.

story:
The Cameron Highlanders Pipe Band of San Diego, California, USA

         Pipe Major Charlie Rosenberger (front and center) leads the 
Camerons  into competition.
Who We Are
The Cameron Highlanders Pipe Band is not only among the most successful and oldest Highland bagpipe bands in the United States, we are also a top competitor in the US and are the 2016 United States Mid-Western Champions, and the 2015 Western United States Pipe Band Champions in Grade 3 and 4.  In addition to competitions, our organization has been giving free piping and drumming lessons to interested players of all ages since the band's founding in 1946.  As a 501(c)(3) educational organization, we have a strong commitment to the preservation and growth of the art of the Highland Bagpipes and the unique drumming styles associated with this music.  Many of our students have gone on to become nationally and internationally recognized champion piper and drummers.  



Our Campaign Purpose

To mark the 70th anniversary of our founding, the Cameron Highlanders Bagpipe Band of San Diego is competing at the 2016 World Pipe Band Championships this August in Glasgow, Scotland.  It is our honor to represent the USA, California, and the beautiful city of San Diego before a worldwide audience.  This is our chance to show off the results of the many hours of hard work and dedication we have put into playing this beautiful and complex music well.   

We are excited to field bands in two competition classes this year, grades 3 and 4a, but we need your help.  Transporting all of the band members, instruments, uniforms and other equipment overseas is a complex and costly undertaking.  Your generous donation is needed to make this possible for all of our musicians to be able to attend this exciting adventure at the "Worlds", and since we are a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization, your donation is tax deductible, too!


A few of the drum corps' tenor drummers.


Positive Impact on the Band Members

For many of the younger members of the band, this trip offers additional opportunity as most of them make their first trip outside of our own country into a wider world.  This is a chance for them to develop stronger skills of teamwork, responsibility and personal excellence, while gaining self-confidence and the friendship and camaraderie that accompanies meeting others and competing in a shared sense of purpose.  

 

     Susie and Elaine Shoemaker, mother and daughter champions.  

The Cameron Highlanders Perform at the Spreckles Organ Pavilion in SanDiego


How You Can Continue To Help Us  
We need you to help us spread the word!  Use the Indiegogo share tools at the bottom of the page to share our campaign with anyone and everyone you know. Even those that prefer a different type of music can be encouraged to help support this group as we represent San Diego, California and the United States. Help make our campaign go viral; the more people learn about what we are  doing, the greater the chance we will reach our goal and allow more players  to experience this great opportunity.  For information about the World Pipe Band Championships and the group that holds them, please view the link for the Royal Scottish Pipe Band Association: RSPBA.org To watch BBC coverage of the World Championships go to:  World Pipe Band Championship's Competition  

Cameron Highlanders on Parade.


Our Perks

The estimated arrival date for the perks is 11/2016, but we will send out          the perks as soon as possible.  
The Sponsor Perk:  We will print your name or company name on our bass drum as an official sponsor for the year, 2017.  You brand or name will be seen at all of our many performances throughout the United States for one year.  

Official Band Photo

Cameron CD

Band Uniform Cap Badge

Sporran


Tee-Shirt

Front

Back


Cameron Baseball Cap




Pipe Major John Rosenberger, founding member of
The Cameron Highlanders Pipe Band of San Diego

History of the Cameron Highlanders Pipe Band

 After returning from World War II, where he served with his bagpipes in tow, John Rosenberger, along with his father, Karl Rosenberger, founded the Cameron Highlanders Pipe Band of San Diego, California in 1946.  The band is now the oldest bagpipe band in the Western United States.  The band's early uniform was inspired by and modeled after the British army regiment, The Queen's Own Highlanders, and wore the modern Cameron tartan.  Her majesty Queen Elizabeth officially recognized the Cameron Highlanders Pipe Band in the 1950s.  Our bands now wear the Ancient Cameron of Eracht tartan.

Founder John Rosenberger (then a private) took his pipes with him into WWII.  He is pictured playing on the 4th of July 1944 in Normandy, France. 

                        

 Founders Karl and John Rosenberger with sons and grandsons                    Charlie and Malcolm Rosenberger. 


Since its birth, the Cameron Highlanders have competed and performed throughout the Western United States, including performances for Prince Charles and Queen Elizabeth, countless community parades and a wide variety of local performances at churches, Scottish and Irish festivals, private shows and the band's own annual Tartan Ball.  The band is now led by Pipe Major Charles Rosenberger, the son and grandson of the founders; our drum corps is led by Drum Sergeant Aaron Mars, a lifelong member of the band. 



   The Cameron Highlanders Pipe Band 

     Throughout the Years


   
       The Cameron Highlanders (circa 1980)

The Camerons play at the Spreckels Organ Celebration in San Diego (2005)



    The Cameron Highlanders Pipe Band (1952)  

The Cameron Highlanders Pipe Band 
performing at their annual Tartan Ball (2015)

The Cameron Highlanders Pipe Band on Parade.


 

 The History of the Bagpipes

While the Scottish Great Highland bagpipes have the greatest visibility with the English speaking world, bagpipes have been played for centuries in many countries and several different forms and continue to be played throughout large parts of the world today.  For an excellent explanation of bagpipes and their history please view this page:  Wikipedia.org Bagpipes

Our Campaign Purpose
To mark the 70th anniversary of our founding, the Cameron Highlanders Bagpipe Band of San Diego is competing at the 2016 World Pipe Band Championships this August in Glasgow, Scotland.  It is our honor to represent the USA, California, and the beautiful city of San Diego before a worldwide audience.  This is our chance to show off the results of the many hours of hard work and dedication we have put into playing this beautiful and complex music well.   
We are excited to field bands in two competition classes this year, grades 3 and 4a, but we need your help.  Transporting all of the band members, instruments, uniforms and other equipment overseas is a complex and costly undertaking.  Your generous donation is needed to make this possible for all of our musicians to be able to attend this exciting adventure at the "Worlds", and since we are a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization, your donation is tax deductible, too!




A few of the drum corps' tenor drummers.




Positive Impact on the Band Members
For many of the younger members of the band, this trip offers additional opportunity as most of them make their first trip outside of our own country into a wider world.  This is a chance for them to develop stronger skills of teamwork, responsibility and personal excellence, while gaining self-confidence and the friendship and camaraderie that accompanies meeting others and competing in a shared sense of purpose.  
 

     Susie and Elaine Shoemaker, mother and daughter champions.  


The Cameron Highlanders Perform at the Spreckles Organ Pavilion in SanDiego

How You Can Continue To Help Us  
We need you to help us spread the word!  Use the Indiegogo share tools at the bottom of the page to share our campaign with anyone and everyone you know. Even those that prefer a different type of music can be encouraged to help support this group as we represent San Diego, California and the United States. Help make our campaign go viral; the more people learn about what we are  doing, the greater the chance we will reach our goal and allow more players  to experience this great opportunity.  For information about the World Pipe 
Band Championships and the group that holds them, please view the link 
for the Royal Scottish Pipe Band Association: RSPBA.org To watch BBC coverage of the World Championships go to:  World Pipe Band Championship's Competition  




Cameron Highlanders on Parade. 






Our Perks
The estimated arrival date for the perks is 11/2016, but we will send out          the perks as soon as possible.  

The Sponsor Perk:  We will print your name or company name on our bass drum as an official sponsor for the year, 2017.  You brand or name will be seen at all of our many performances throughout the United States for one year.  



Official Band Photo
Cameron CD


Band Uniform Cap Badge

Sporran


Tee-Shirt Front
Back

Cameron Baseball Cap










Pipe Major John Rosenberger, founding member of The Cameron Highlanders Pipe Band of San Diego



History of the Cameron Highlanders Pipe Band
 After returning from World War II, where he served with his bagpipes in tow, John Rosenberger, along with his father, Karl Rosenberger, founded the Cameron Highlanders Pipe Band of San Diego, California in 1946.  The band is now the oldest bagpipe band in the Western United States.  The band's early uniform was inspired by and modeled after the British army regiment, The Queen's Own Highlanders, and wore the modern Cameron tartan.  Her majesty Queen Elizabeth officially recognized the Cameron Highlanders Pipe Band in the 1950s.  Our bands now wear the Ancient Cameron of Eracht tartan.


Founder John Rosenberger (then a private) took his pipes with him into WWII.  He is pictured playing on the 4th of July 1944 in Normandy, France. 


                        
 Founders Karl and John Rosenberger with sons and grandsons                    Charlie and Malcolm Rosenberger. 

Since its birth, the Cameron Highlanders have competed and performed throughout the Western United States, including performances for Prince Charles and Queen Elizabeth, countless community parades and a wide variety of local performances at churches, Scottish and Irish festivals, private shows and the band's own annual Tartan Ball.  The band is now led by Pipe Major Charles Rosenberger, the son and grandson of the founders; our drum corps is led by Drum Sergeant Aaron Mars, a lifelong member of the band. 













   The Cameron Highlanders Pipe Band 
     Throughout the Years


   

       The Cameron Highlanders (circa 1980)



The Camerons play at the Spreckels Organ Celebration in San Diego (2005)


    The Cameron Highlanders Pipe Band (1952)  


The Cameron Highlanders Pipe Band performing at their annual Tartan Ball (2015)
   

The Cameron Highlanders Pipe Band on Parade.




 



 The History of the Bagpipes


While
the Scottish Great Highland bagpipes have the greatest visibility
with the English speaking world, bagpipes have been played for
centuries in many countries and several different forms and continue to be played throughout large parts of the world today.  For an excellent explanation of bagpipes and their history please view this page:  Wikipedia.org Bagpipes

story:
Click Here for Romanian!

George Enescu (1881 - 1955) is Romania’s best known and world renowned composer. His house in Mihaileni (Romania), where he worked and composed, was built by his mother’s parents between 1775 and 1830 and is the expression of Romanian vernacular architecture in the first half of the 19th century.

One year ago, we started the rehabilitation of George Enescu's house, a place where the great musician grew up. As a continuous campaign to raise funds, we have succeeded to involve the local community and many generous people that helped us reach the final phase of the restoration, but this was only the beginning. 


“This building, small as it is, represents more than a restoration; as Raluca Știrbăț said so well , it’s not the walls that count; it’s about a common project, and how to grow it in a direction that even the master George Enescu would have wanted.”

-Arh. Șerban Sturdza, vicepresident of Pro Patrimonio Foundation  

                       

Our project for the reactivation of the historical site is The George Enescu International Music Academy, a center of excellence for the study of classical music, with a focus on traditional architecture, crafts and visual arts.

The Academy will blend the memorial components with an educational function, as a big part of the project revolves around the local community and involving children in the area. The academy will generate a cultural and educational opportunity to an area that needs to be revitalized, near the border between Romania and Ukraine.

                        

The priority now is to raise the funds needed to end the first phase of the project, that is the restoration of the carpentry, 3 traditional stoves, plastering, floors and the final touches. This amounts to 15.000 euro, however the budget for the creation of the academy, including furniture, a piano, amenities and the building of a concert hall, exceeds this amount, so every donation is much needed and appreciated.

The total budget to launch The George Enescu International Music Academy is 55.000 euro.


Please donate and help us preserve an invaluable piece of history and keep the memory of Enescu alive. Through a small gesture you can receive your own mock-up Enescu’s House or become a member of Pro Patrimonio, gaining access to all its events, publications, newsletter and network.

Every donation gets us closer to our goal!

The conservation and care of the locations of Enescu's early years represent a mission and a responsibility of great importance for our European heritage. Enescu's house has the potential of becoming  a place where great scholars connect with talented young people.


The Pro Patrimonio Foundation - Romania’s National Trust - is an international non-profit organization with branches in Romania, UK and France, established in 2000. The goals of the Foundation are to save, preserve and restore architectural and cultural heritage in Romania. Pro Patrimonio lobbies for the protection of Romania’s existing cultural heritage, aiming to teach people to appreciate its value and to provide support for the restoration and re-use of historic buildings. Our projects have saved an important number of architectural monuments until now and we pride ourselves with providing examples of good practice in restoration and reactivation of cultural heritage across Romania. Please visit our website for more information on our projects.


The Enescu Music Academy will offer the rare opportunity to learn from revered musicians and internationally respected teachers, to create a community of gifted young talents from all over the world and will provide a combination of highly intensive training courses in the beautiful, picturesque Mihaileni, where the memory of Enescu is strongly connected to the rural landscape and atmosphere.


Donate, share and spread the word!

Thank you!


Română

George Enescu (1811 – 1955) este cel mai cunoscut compozitor român de talie internațională. Casa lui din Mihâileni (România), unde a muncit și compus, a fost construită de bunicii săi materni între 1775 și 1830 și reprezintă o expresie a arhitecturii tradiționale din prima jumătate de secol 19.

Cu un an în urmă am început intervenția de urgență pentru salvarea casei George Enescu din Mihăileni. Cu ajutorul comunității locale și a generozității donatorilor, am desfășurat o campanie de strângere de fonduri care ne-a adus aproape de ultima fază a restaurării casei. Acesta fost doar începutul.

Proiectul de reactivare a casei maestrului este crearea Academiei Internaționale de Muzică George Enescu, un centru de excelență în studiul muzicii clasice, cu interes spre arhitectura tradițională, arte vizuale și meșteșuguri. 

                       

Academia va îmbina componenta memorială cu funcțiunea educațională, iar o parte importantă a proiectului va avea ca focus comunitatea locală, implicând copiii din zonă. Academia va genera o oportunitate culturală și educațională într-o zonă care are nevoie de revitalizare, aproape de granița dintre România și Ucraina.


Prioritatea, în acest moment, este strângerea de fonduri pentru a termina prima fază a proiectului. Aceasta constă în restaurarea tâmplăriei, a trei sobe tradiționale, tencuielii, podelei și în finisaje. Suma necesară pentru prima fază este de 15.000 de euro, dar bugetul pentru crerea Academiei, incluzând mobilă, un pian, facilități și construcția unei săli de concert depășesc suma aceasta, așa că fiecare donație este necesară și mult apreciată.

Bugetul total necesar pentru lansarea Academiei Muzicale Internaționale George Enescu este de 55.000 de euro.


Fiecare donație ne aduce mai aproape de scopul nostru!

Conservarea și îngrijirea locurilor în care Enescu și-a petrecut primii ani din viață reprezintă o misiune și o responsabilitate de mare importanță pentru patrimoniul european, Casa Enescu putând deveni un loc unde artiști virtuoși pot interacționa cu tineri talentați.


Fundația Pro Patrimonio este o organizație non-profit internațională, fondată în anul 2000, cu filiale în România, Marea Britanie și Franța. Scopul fundației este de a salva, restaura și păstra moștenirea culturală și arhitecturală românească. Pro Patrimonio promovează protejarea moștenirii culturale românești existente și are ca scop educarea oamenilor spre aprecierea clădirilor istorice cât și sprijinul în restaurarea și refolosirea lor. Proiectele noastre au salvat un număr important de monumente arhitecturale până acum, și ne mândrim cu posibilitatea de a oferi exemple de bună practică în restaurarea și reactivarea moștenirii culturale în România. Vă invităm să vizitați www.propatrimonio.org pentru mai multe informații despre proiectele noastre.


Academia Muzicală George Enescu va oferi o oportunitate rară de a învăța de la muzicieni și profesori de talie internațională pentru a crea o comunitate de talente tinere din toată lumea și va oferi o combinație de combina cursuri intensive în frumosul, pitorescul, Mihăileni, unde amintirea lui Enescu este legată de peisaj și sentimentul rural.


Donați, distribuiți și ajutați-ne să răspândim vestea mai departe!

Vă mulțumim!

story:
Who is Phil Marshall and What is Scatterbed?

I’ve been playing guitar, or at least trying, since the day my mother bought a Yamaha FG-180 for my sister and me back in the fall of ’69.  When I was 19 I met Chuck “Colorblind James” Cuminale and within 48 hours we played our first gig with Thaddeus Iorizzo on doghouse bass.  In 1980 we moved out to San Francisco and formed what eventually became The Colorblind James Experience.  

During my tenure with the band, we put out the self-titled album followed by “Why Should I Stand Up?” “Strange Sounds From The Basement” (as the Death Valley Boys) and “Solid! Behind The Times”.  It was through my close association with Chuck that I began to figure out how to put a song together. Eventually I left the Experience and formed my own band, Lalaland.  Lalaland released “Nude”, my first CD of original songs. 

Over the years I’ve also had the great pleasure of being asked to contribute guitar to the recordings of Annie Wells, Woody Dodge, Connie Deming and others.  I also played guitar and penned a couple of songs on SLT’s “Gone Dead Gone” CD.  Soon to be released is the new CD by Annie Wells which features her own arrangements of Home Sweet Home and Nothing Left To Lose.  

I’m looking forward to releasing this latest batch of songs entitled “Scatterbed”.  Scatterbed reflects 2 years of working closely with Chris Zajkowski.  During that time our association blossomed into a true friendship.  As the album developed, it went off in a direction I had not anticipated.  What I had intended to be a casual, 60s tinged pop CD became a more acoustic based reflection on loss, grief, faith and the lack thereof.  

Through Chris’ support and encouragement, I felt open to explore themes and feelings dark and painful as well as humorous and hopeful.  Watching the songs grow and go off in unexpected directions was thrilling.  The themes are all there in the titles such as Grief Walks In, Here’s Hoping, Faith and Heaven Is Waiting.  Ebb and Flow, Marmalade, Black Ice and Wrapped In a Comet’s Tail deal with depression, family, friends and loss.  Home Sweet Home is a humorous play on nursery rhymes that questions what lies behind the veil of domestic bliss while Shirley Jane imagines a scenario played out by the artwork in my living room!

I felt so fortunate to be able to receive the instrumental contributions of Ken Frank, Peter Miller and Mark, Scott, and Todd Bradley.  Chris, acting as producer as well as sideman, played drums, keyboard, upright bass, and glockenspiel and sang background vocals.  He is also receiving songwriting credit for his invaluable contributions lyrically and musically to two songs.  Thank you, Chris! 

I’ve felt a great deal of support from the music community in Rochester, NY even during my sometimes lengthy absences from live performances.  My hope is to put out a CD worthy of your time, money, and attention.  Here’s hoping we can make this happen together!

What People are Saying About Scatterbed

"Scatterbed is a multifaceted masterpiece, a brilliant, deeply personal musical/lyrical kaleidoscope." ~Ken Frank, Songsmith, Musician, Producer

"It feels like [he is] singing it just for me"~Maureen McFee, Music Fan

"[T]he highest compliment that I can pay here is that I really can’t compare this to anything else; it’s a new category. And I want to hear it again and again... . It’s great songwriting and musicianship and I hope it finds its way to many ears. [Phil has] pursued a really distinct path here, and there’s beauty. Real, complex, beauty. "~David McIntire, Composer, Musician, Producer

"Phil’s compositions are locked into a deceptive ease. "~Scott Regan, Open Tunings (WRUR)/Watkins & the Rapiers

"Like that song you hear and love the very first time, it is new yet old, deep yet simple, dark yet lovely, universal yet personal, familiar yet completely original."~Brian Shafer, Musician (Nod/Fox Sisters)

Why $5,000?

Because it'll cost about that much to produce, distribute, and promote the CD.

Here's the breakdown:

  • Manufacturing/Packaging: $1,500.00 
  • Final Mastering: $1,500.00 
  • Distribution: $700.00 
  • Promotional Materials: $300.00
  • Website/Advertising: $350.00

Other Ways You Can Help

Just in case you're looking for other ways to help get Scatterbed onto a disc and into people's hands, it'd be wonderful if you felt like reposting a link to the campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Snapchat, office bulletin board, telephone pole, you get the picture. Thank you for your support!

story:
Riley McKinnon-New EP or Album 2016!

Hi there, I’m Riley McKinnon and this is my Indiegogo campaign. There are two main things I want to accomplish with this campaign:

1.  It’s been 8 years since I recorded my last album and I’m working on my new one. I want to record and promote my new EP or album.

2.  This will help me gain momentum with my business and turn my passion of song into a full time career.

So I am hoping you will help me accomplish this by supporting my musical art through this Indiegogo campaign! Check out the “Perks” to see the different ways you can contribute.


The Concept

I’ve decided to call the album “Visceral Transitions”. I rediscovered this word Visceral recently and I really love the sound of it and its meaning.  When I read the definition I instantly thought it would be the perfect title.

I’ve been attempting to let the music to flow from (or maybe even through me) when I’m writing a new song. Even just singing whatever comes to me while recording it quickly and then trying not to sway too far from what I just created.

The definition of Visceral I’m referring to is; Relating to deep inward feelings rather than to the intellect.

So in essence, I’m attempting to let the feeling come through the song  and not let my intellect take over and change it all because I think it needs to sound like the latest trend in music.

But for me this could mean different things at different times, and also different styles of music. It could also include something that just happens to sound "trendy" as well.

The main genre will be Rock Alternative but there will definitely be some hints of other genres seeping through because I love many styles of music. (Folk, Pop, Electronic, Country, RnB, Hip Hop…)

EP-There are 5 or 6 songs I will have recorded for sure for an EP, even if this campaign doesn’t reach the $5000 mark I will get this done!

Album-I have about twelve or thirteen songs that I have chosen to be on the album if we can go beyond the $5000. So that will take a good two or three months to finish.

I do all of the instrumentation singing recording and mixing. This is not to say that I won’t eventually work with a producer and other musicians for a future album.  But for now I’m keeping things truly independent.

(I also record and edit all of my videos, at least for now.  I actually enjoy the process)

The First Goal-EP

So my initial goal is to raise $5,000 and this will be going towards the costs associated with the recording production and promotion of my new EP which includes many things:

1.  Afford me more valuable time to record and produce the EP to the best of my abilities. I currently have a full time job, as I almost always have, and I am hoping to transition into music full time finally!

2.  Promotion and advertising. I’ve been educating myself on marketing and promotion for quite a few years now, but I’ve rarely had the money left over to really put what I’ve learned into action. So now with about 25 percent of the money raised I will be implementing different strategies to gain more exposure for my music career and business.


Stretch Goals

If we get to the $5000 mark within the 35 day campaign I will be introducing some stretch goals.

They will include things like:

$10,000- Record a full length album and put even more money towards promotion costs.

$13,000- Make a killer video for the first single released!

(If we make it this far I will be updating this page to show even more big ideas I have. Like hiring a professional producer, more music videos, T-shirts, setting up a tour etc.)


What Do You Get Out of This?

Besides the funny tingly feeling that you might get from just helping someone out, you may have noticed already on the right hand side of your screen, there are a few different ways you can help support my project and get something for yourself in return. Just check out the list of "perks" to find out how you can contribute.


Why I’ve Chosen Flexible Funding

Flexible funding allows me to keep whatever is raised even if we don’t reach the $5000 goal.

If for some reason I don’t reach this goal I do have some major flexibility and I plan to get the EP finished and released no matter what happens!


Other Ways You Can Help-Please Share

If you’ve read this far and you just can’t make a financial contribution right now but you still want to help, then feel free to share my campaign with friends that might be interested. Indiegogo makes it super easy to share the message with their share tools.


THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

(I will be updating info and adding videos on this page throughout the 35 day campaign)

story:
The Man of Leisure Story:

If you've lived around the Los Angeles/Orange County area, then you may have already heard of songwriters Joshua Hanson (Yellow Red Sparks) and Barrett Johnson. Separately, Joshua won the grand prize in the International Songwriting competition and Barrett's songs have been heard in several hit television shows, including Nashville, Private Practice and Parenthood.

A little over a year ago, the two began writing together. They both respected each others work and at first it was sort of a "let's see what happens" experiment. The first few songs came naturally and they quickly decided to write for a full length album. Soon after, Joshua's brother, John Hanson (Christina Perri/Melanoid) signed on as producer. After financially committing everything they had, Hanson and Johnson realized that they would need outside help in order to make this happen.
                                                                                                                      
As of right now, we are looking to raise $10,000, but in actuality the costs will go well beyond that number. Some of these expenses include:
  • Studio time
  • Producer and engineer fees
  • Session players
  • Mixing
  • Mastering

Our goal for these songs is to speak into people's lives about hope, love and the return of innocence. Our hope is that we can find people that value these messages and will help us deliver them effectively.

    Can you think of someone who would enjoy this music? Please share the link via social media and email or tag friends and family in a post. This goes a long way and we would appreciate your support!

story:
The Tigerlilies have been offered an amazing opportunity to tour Athens and Thessaloniki in Greece during Fall Break 2015.  After several years of touring only domestically and maintaining strict budgetary discipline, we are thrilled that Princeton's Department of Hellenic Studies has granted us partial funding for our plane tickets and secured free housing in Greece. However, we will still need an additional $12,000 to cover the remaining travel costs (plane tickets, train tickets, etc).

We already have performances lined up at the US Embassy, the famed Gennadius Library, and the Princeton Club of Greece. We are planning shows at various schools, colleges, and museums, and we also hope to sing for children at two non-profits in Athens.

We are sure you remember how important tours were to your experience as a Tigerlily and as a Princeton student--how much you grew both artistically and socially. We cannot wait for our generation of Lils to know the thrill of singing for an international audience--an audience who may not share our language, but who does share the universal language...of music. How moving it will be to bring "How High the Moon" from 1879 Arch to one of world's very first arches, the Arch of Galerius, in Thessaloniki.

If you prefer, you can also mail checks addressed to "The Princeton Tigerlilies" and send them to:

Lillian Xu

5289 Frist Campus Center

Princeton, NJ 08544


Our tour will begin on October 29th and conclude on November 8th. Please help us make this trip possible. Any amount you give, no matter how small, will make all the difference. Thank you in advance, and we look forward to seeing you at Reunions!

story:
Short Summary

For a decade I built and designed fuzz pedals under the Effector 13 and devi ever : fx moniker.  I've built pedals for everyone from Depeche Mode to Nine Inch Nails.... ZZ Top to My Bloody Valentine.  About two years ago I sold the rights to my name to another company, and now I'm back with a new-from-the-ground-up fuzz design called the Heart Mother.  I'm also available to do custom work and will be building my classic designs under new names.

I was on track to getting my new guitar pedal company, Fuzz Goddess, off the ground over the next two months, but my main investor bailed under extremely bad circumstances, and the company that I sold devi ever : fx too scaled back on production leaving me with practically no income from them.

The Heart Mother fuzz design is done, as well as the PCB, designed by Infanem, my long time friend who has done the incredible engineering work of the Silver Rose, Console, as well as the updated editions of the Circuit Breaker and Improbability Drive.

I have most of the equipment and space and time to start building guitar pedals.  I just need parts, which is why I am creating this campaign, to help get the word out that I am building pedals again, and to offer them for pre-order so I can get things moving.

What We Need & What You Get

It's simple really.  I am offering the new Heart Mother fuzz, along with my older two knob designs, rebranded, and custom work within the technical abilities I am capable of.  You let me know what you want, and I will make it for you.  I'm offering custom graphics as well on all of these, using my standard vinyl sticker paper, so full color art is 100% doable.

Below is a list of the pedals along with demo's of what they sound like.  Once again, I can also build whatever custom effect you would like as well, as long as it's within my capabilities.

Heart Mother
guitar - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VdVwxKFU6tQ
bass - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-Ein0XeSgZk

Bad Buffer - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s5NnAi4sMO0
Boo Kahki - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q7ZyZB3pxDw
Cat Fang - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FneVVSB-rm8
Cataclysm - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OnC9B7tQpoU
Crystal Ship - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TG75vAazeYQ
Dank Boost - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yOPkzRJvhFE
Death Button - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TQtq77bv7Z0
Dirt Shocker - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1N5sSjD631o
Eagle - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HfYVMuOdQ14
Enemy - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p0fSWTj0ln8
Exit - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BA7OustDCLI
Fuzz Chan - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ikz0otu71UQ
Gamera - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_esj68T9FTs
Gold Lever - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b50oSQqM3KA
Graveller - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nWtS9G-ZoTA
Harmonic Annihilator - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HWrqVoXTTos
Holy Screw - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0Gs6Z94Z5DY
Japanese Drive - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QJdbgPZ7cZg
Lust Bump - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZhxUTXLFPAo
Mouser - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VcK5UK44WP8
Nega Fuzz - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uEohb4iA9xA
Opal - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fa6ms-TVo-M
Saturn VII - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v4R4YMOp8Xw
Spite Bump - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D6K2uWbhLpE
Tear Clipper - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=splw1yBX-GU
Tri Force - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2N6gltL9NQc
Ziggurat - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j9iqceupRsE

The Impact

With my royalties from the sell of my business practically cut off, and my single investor bailing on me, I am quite literally at the end of my rope.  If I can't get the ball rolling on Fuzz Goddess and get the word out about building pedals again, I will be homeless, which wouldn't be so bad to be honest... I would figure out a way to survive, but I have three cats that need a place to live... and there's no reason why I shouldn't be able to get a sustainable income happening from building pedals other than I don't have the starting capital.

The impact is you would be saving me and my cat's lives.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk is that if I don't sell enough pedals and can sustain consistent sales over the course of the next few months, I'll still be in a position of having to find a place to live which would invariably delay my ability to continue to build pedals.

I also have a lot of debt I need to pay off, which I have been over time, including an old failed kickstarter which is about half way paid off.  Those are part of the reasons my monthly living expenses are as high as they are (areound $2.5k a month).

The thing is, I have interest from a UK distributor, and I am working with Pedaltronics (who has helped with Frantone and BJFE) to get more of my pedals into production, so things ARE moving forward... but without forward capital, I'll be homeless before I am off the ground.

Once I am off the ground though, my old brand was making well over $10k a month, even on a slow month... and I have no doubt I will get there with Fuzz Goddess.  It's only a matter of time, money to start production again, and getting the word out.

The final challenge and risk is that ordering parts and producing these pedals will take time.  Waiting for orders to come in and then buying parts in bulk can takes weeks, and then sorting out production on top of that, turn around with these first batch of pedals might be a month and a half or longer, and if only a few people buy pedals, then once again that still leaves me homeless and will make it hard to fulfill orders.

Other Ways You Can Help

I need people to know that I am no longer associated with the devi ever : fx brand and that Fuzz Goddess is now where I am creating effects.

I need retail and distributor support in the long term.

I need a place to live and work if this all fails.

story:
Here’s the big idea:  The people of the Central San Joaquin Valley rally behind a local band every six months.  The band gets their first album recorded and some CD’s pressed, plus some other stuff.  Bands feel supported by their community.  Bands get a boost in their career and their development.  Some of the bands will continue to grow and hopefully a few will hit it pretty big. When they accept their first Grammy award they can honestly say, “We couldn’t have done this without the support of our community.”

The first band we’ve selected is The Red Coats.  They are super talented and hardworking, incredibly sincere and have developed an authentic sound.  They are the type of band that you (and we) can feel good about supporting.  They’ve already invested their own money into recording their first album and now we can help them to get it finished more quickly.

The first time we saw them perform was last year at the Sudz in the City microbrew festival.  They started playing and we stopped to listen.  We noticed that everyone else stopped what they were doing too.  Everyone turned and listened and smiled. Everyone moved closer to the stage.  That's the kind of reaction they get every time they play.

Croptown Creative is a new marketing company which works exclusively with locally-owned enterprises from the Central San Joaquin Valley.  We will select a band, twice a year, through our affiliated downtown pub, Peeve’s Public House.  We hope that lots of bands will want your support and that you will want to support many of our local bands.  We can do this!

If this campaign is fully funded, The Red Coats will have:

·  A completed album (local WolfSound Audio Engineering)

·  2,000 CD’s

·  A music video (local videographer Punit Dhesi)

·  Merchandise for IndieGoGo rewards and to sell at future shows

·  Legal requirements like trademark and naming rights

·  Album cover art (local artist)

If we don’t raise all of the funds, we’ll have to prioritize, getting the CD and giving you your rewards are the highest priority.

Beyond your financial support, you can help by spreading the word to your friends who also value our local music scene.  Sharing on your social media platforms is a HUGE help.

· 
2,000 CD’s
· 
A music video (local videographer Punit Dhesi)
· 
Merchandise for IndieGoGo rewards and to sell at
future shows
· 
Legal requirements like trademark and naming rights
· 
Album cover art (local artist)
If we don’t raise all of the funds, we’ll have to
prioritize, getting the CD and giving you your rewards are the highest
priority.
Beyond your financial support, you can help by spreading the
word to your friends who also value our local music scene.  Sharing on your social media platforms is a
HUGE help.

story:
LULLABY CRASH needs YOU!

Hi everyone and thanks for checking out our Indiegogo campaign! The sole purpose is to fund a music video for our single "Come Alive", off our latest EP Restless available every where online November 24 2015. I'm Jason and I am the lead singer and main song writer of LULLABY CRASH. We are a Alternative rock band from Cincinnati Ohio that has been together for a little over a year now. I have had the greatest privilege to work with the super group of musicians we have put together for LULLABY CRASH. Mike, Kevin, Matt and myself have been playing in bands our whole lives. We have all been through bad record deals, vans breaking down and every band problem imaginable.  When we set out to become LULLABY CRASH we had the idea to take our music to the top and give the music business one heck of a ride. But, we need your HELP! Record labels aren't looking to sign starter bands, they want polished projects ready to release music and tour now. We have spent every last dollar into the recording our latest EP and now are trying to push our first single with as much power behind it as possible. That's where you, the donor can help. All funds raised through this campaign go to the production and tools needed to create a successful music video.  Add us on Facebook and get linked in to everything the band is doing!

https://www.facebook.com/lullabycrash 

What We Need 

What we need is approximately 4 to 5,000 dollars to make the best possible music video. All proceeds go to equipment used for the video(cameras,lights,etc), actors, editing, cinematographer, props, location and any additional costs that may appear during the process.  

Your Impact

Without your help our music could go unnoticed and swept under the YouTube rug. To get our band to the next level we need any contribution possible towards the music video. Great production only enforces all the hard work we have put into this EP as well as the band.  With your contribution we can rise above any financial problems and hurtles that appear during and after shooting of the music video. Anything and everything helps!

Incentives

We have included some great perks to anyone and everyone who can help make our dreams come true. Including options from a free download of the EP before it's release date to the band taking you out to Dinner! And we are not  talking about Arby's.

story:
Our Story

Hi my name is Ainz "Brainz" Prasad, better known as Brainz to my friends and family. I am the creator and co-founder of a startup company called Volume Mob. In the pictures below you can see my other amazing co-founders Nicole Sepe, Chris Washington, Jovan Dawkins and Orlando Rashid. I am Jamaican, Fijian, and Canadian. I grew up in Canada and now live in Los Angeles California

As a Music Producer I always struggled on how to make money selling my music. At the time my production partner and I spent hours upon hours trying to connect with artists (both independent and major) in hopes that they would purchase our tracks. There wasn't enough time in the week never mind the day to achieve this, and what was worse we only could afford to work locally so we were very limited. We became extremely persistent and we ended up getting some of our music in some pretty big movies, with some pretty big artists. I then realized this opportunity was rare and very difficult to come by. Like other music producers, when the opportunity presented its self we didn't have enough music. With that said, we missed out on several opportunities including money.

I started to detect a pattern that I couldn't fulfill. It was simply supply and demand and this was not going to pay the bills. I realized that every album, TV show, film, commercial, video game, and everything on YouTube needed music in some way shape or form. 

I had connections but didn't have enough music to satisfy this demand. Then it dawned on me. I could pay it forward by developing an online platform that would give the everyday music producers or artists a market place to distribute, sell, lease, or license their music. This would allow me to connect with other music producers and share the opportunity to get their music placed in movies, TV shows, video games, etc. There might be other stores out there but they don’t share our vision and they don't share our know how. We will help our community to stay connected with the professional and independent music world. I recognized that it was no longer about me it is about the next generation of me. We (Volume Mob) decided to create a solution that would not only help music producers, artists and musicians but a solution that would help put an end to cutbacks, and in some cases eliminating music programs in public schools across America. 


BUILD YOUR TEAM



INFLIX


BEAT REP


VOLUME MOB SCHOOL

By giving the next music generation the ability to show their talent and get paid in the process, we feel that in conjunction with the schools we can make a difference. Both the students and the schools will now benefit by adding Volume Mob to their curriculum. The Students will be handed an assignment to create a piece of music. Then they will be graded and proceed to upload their music to their schools Volume Mob profile. From here we encourage friends, family, and teachers to support the amazing music that these students have created.The lions share of the revenue generated goes to these young creators and the schools they represent. A small portion goes to Volume Mob to help keep the lights on and feed our amazing staff. 


MATCH MAKER

TEAM PLAYER

 


TASK MOB



INSTA MOB


MOB WRITER

MUSIC & SWAG


SHOW ME THE MONEY



THANK YOU

All of our the amazing people who donate to our campaign will get their names posted on our "Thank You" page on our finished website.  


TIME LINE



What We Need & What You Get

We are trying to raise $10,000.
By donating you would be helping us finish our platform and this includes:
- Hiring a web programming to aid in building the wire frame, developing the            structure, coding and testing the final product.
- Curating and creating content to help grow our music catalog.
- Internet marketing to reach young musician, artist, music producers, video content creators  and open conversations with local school districts.
- Hire an attorney to draft up our leasing and licensing agreements.
- Hiring an accountant to account for the money that is spent.
- Hire some part time help for everyday office needs.
Everyone in our staff is passionate about this project and has been simply donating their time and effort to make this happen. We feel that this campaign is just the beginning and we are on our way to something amazing.

Perks

We thought long and hard about our perks. We want to give back to all of the amazing people that helped make this possible. We are including a shout out page on our website for everyone that donates. Whether you donate $1 or $10,000 your name will forever be on our exclusive shout out page. 

The Impact

We feel that your contribution is going to have an impact on our campaign by allowing us to grow our business with our audience and help employ music entrepreneurs. By doing this we are circulating the economy and giving people jobs. Our platform will give multiple streams of income to all of our Volume Mob members.

It just happens that some of our Volume Mob team has seen success through their individual careers. Their leadership and experience has gained them the opportunity to work with some artists such as Jamie Foxx, Pink, Rick Ross, Travis Barker, Snoop Dogg, Miley Cyrus, Common, E-40, Lil Wayne and much more. Some of our Volume Mob members have also placed music in movies and television such as Django,  ESPN 30 for 30, Save the Last Dance, AOL original series, Under Armor Steph Curry Campaign, Bombay Saphire commercial, and much more. As a team we wanted to create a system that will help other Music producers, Artists, and Musicians. This is more than just being able to make money. All of our Volume Mob members want to share their experience and grow with you by giving a taste of what they went through as music producers. By partnering up with our members we are creating something bigger than our competitors. With your contribution we will be able to iterate, grow, and execute. We need your help to complete our goals within the Volume Mob platform.

Risks & Challenges

When we were designing the Volume Mob platform, we realized their would be a few challenges. Some of our obstacles that Volume Mob has faced has been growing a user base. We decided to combat this by doing it the grass roots way and reaching out to local talent. In order to grow our platform, we had to consider their issues and apply a working solution. Another one of our concerns was based on how we were going to build our music catalog. Some of the Volume Mob staff members happen to be amazing producers and writers. This helped overcome our question on how we would start our music library.  

Other Ways You Can Help

For those who want to be involved with Volume Mob please help by promoting us and getting the word out. We deeply appreciate any kind of help including spreading the word. We will provide you with links and other tools to make it easy for you to share our campaign with others. 

Thank you for your support!!!

story:
Mass Productions est une association et un label indépendant basé à Rennes qui vient de fêter ses 20 ans. Nous sommes spécialisés dans le punk-rock.

Pour le 200ème disque du label, nous préparons une compilation live avec les groupes qui ont joué au Fiesta La Mass, notre festival ska-punk, en octobre 2015.

Le budget du projet s'élève à 3000€

1500€ pour le pressage, 700€ pour la SDRM (droits d'auteurs), 800€ de studio mobile + mixage et mastering.

Tous les souscripteurs seront cités sur la compil...

     Nous comptons sur vous tous pour soutenir ce projet !

    Merci de faire tourner un max !

story:
Isn’t That Anyone

In our age of restless music consumption, what are the albums you hold closest to your heart? The records that have managed to rise above the white noise, demand your attention and encourage you to treat it as a singular product rather than a collection of mp3s? With Isn’t That Anyone, we’re hoping to add another album to your list.

Isn’t That Anyone is an ambitious leap for Eternals. Recorded throughout 2015 with Aaron Bastenelli at Q Division Studios (Somerville, MA), and Rubber Tracks (Boston/New York), we’ve assembled a group of songs that we hope will be well received as a cohesive unit, while also possessing unique and defining characteristics that help each song stand on its own.

Us

Eternals is the music of Stephen Konrads, Eric Bolton, Harrison Seiler, and Wayne Whittaker. Our self-titled album, recorded at the Soul Shop in Medford, MA and released in 2014, is a collection of songs that have served as the band’s foundation since its inception. With Isn’t That Anyone, we look to build off of that foundation and present new and exciting ideas which we’ve been working on for much of the past two years.

You

Self-releasing an album presents countless challenges for independent artists. With your help, we’re looking to press Isn’t That Anyone to vinyl, create band merchandise and subsidize some of the cost of recording, mixing, and mastering the record. 100% of the funds collected during this campaign will go to these efforts. 

Our Sincere Thanks

You’re taking a leap with us for this album.  We’d like to extend our sincere thanks to you for your trust and appreciation of our music. Along with your pre-order of Isn’t That Anyone, you’ll get to collect and enjoy a number of perks listed here. Every contribution helps and is deeply appreciated. 

Eternals

story:
"I am ready to receive, all the love that's given me

Knowing I am worthy, yes and more please."

When that first string of words came to me, I was sitting on the kitchen floor with my guitar. Suddenly I realized something very powerful was happening. As I sang and wrote them down, I was making a clear statement and commitment to myself and something greater about how I wished to live my life and how to treat myself.

Through creating and playing "Yes and more please", I have discovered new territory not only when it comes to songwriting, but in using music as a transformative and healing tool to expand as a human being. When sharing this song and others online, I discovered that the music impacts each person differently, and that it is time to get it out there. After receiving so many beautiful reflections from people reaching out and sharing how the music touched and inspired them, I knew it was time to share it.

So I'm here to ask you for your help in recording the album ”Made Of Stars" a collection of songs written with the intention to inspire, empower and heal people.

In a world that is yearning for more connection and happiness, these are songs to open our hearts and bring us closer to ourselves and each other. Music which invites us to love all that we are, both our shadow and light. These songs remind us that it is okay to show our true selves. That it is safe to take of the masks and to let go of trying to be something we're not. The lyrics are to remind us that we are nothing less than amazingly beautiful and perfect just as we are, and that we ARE worthy of all of life's gifts and treasures.

With your help, we will birth a new album of songs to remind us we are all "Made of Stars.


Budget

To make this possible, I need to raise $8000 The money you pledge for this campaign will go towards all of the production costs: 

  • Recording & producing
  • Mixing & mastering
  • Printing & duplication of the album

Release: 2016

You can help just by sharing this campaign!

Even if you are not in a position to donate, sharing this campaign with anyone you think might be interested or sharing the link on social media would be a HUGE help!

Thank you so much for all of your consideration and support!

story:
Short Summary

“Princesinha do Agreste” is a tour van from Tales For The Unspoken a Metal Band Based in Portugal (Coimbra).

Can you believe she has been with us for 5 years?! After all the struggle that she went through with us, which as been a lot, we have to let her go due to some issues with her heart (Engine).

So we decided to start raising money for the successor of this 6th element directly from the people who helped us to keep this band going on all over these years, people that like our music or people that feel sensitized to our challenge as a band.

Until now, we've released Two Full-length albums and One EP, which were very successful, this helped us realize that music is what we want to do for many years to come.

We have toured Portugal North to South, we went to Spain and we just opened new borders by playing in Grito Rock festival in Cape Verde, becoming the first European Metal Band to play in that Country. Can you imagine that?

Crowd-funding seems to be something that is working. Whether or not this is the next big thing in the music industry, it's a good way for supporters of a band to know exactly where their hard earned money is going. We really need your help!

What We Need & What You Get

Ok guys, it all comes down to this.

We need your support more than ever, we have some exclusive offers and we are very pleased to present them to you.

If you support us we will give something special in return, the best we can do as a band and individuals.

We are using Flex Funding, which means if we don't reach our goal we are still getting the money that is raised. So if we don't reach our goal, we will still be very greatful.

We will show you how every penny is spent and prove that it isn't easy to maintain a band in this kind of music industry.

With much effort and sacrifice here we are, 8 years later with the desire to do more and better.

We got "Princesinha do Agreste" thanks to the support of our fans. With her by our side we could finally focus on our mission, to take our music everywhere!

So here we are once again counting on you and offering you beyond our friendship and eternal gratitude the thing we know best… our music in a spot near you and the opportunity to make history with us!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have any funds to contribute but you still want to help please tell all your friends that this is going on and just spread the word all over the place! The "financial department" is always a big struggle for musicians, that's why we need your help.

With crowdfunding we will be allowed to spread our music and it'll be possible to fulfill our commitments!

We want to go ahead and thank every single person that will be contributing to our efforts.

Thanks for helping us, thank you so much!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
We are giving artist a great opportunity to be part of our live music event as a paid performance for unsigned artist. The event will be recorded for our on air programming and gives you a chance to perform in front music execs and managers in a great London venue.

Rarely will you get to hear something that stands out, blows your mind and has you reaching for the rewind button from an unsigned artist who is played on any of the UK commercial Top 40 radio stations. BUT Jam24Radio is about to change all that starting with the "JamFest2016" showcase.


We are looking for....

Singers, Songwriters, Producers, Bands and Fans of all shapes who need a boost of something new and fresh from the music industry.

The best way to think of  the JamFest2016 is as a music showcase  where unsigned artists can take part. As a spin off of our "Stage show" filmed at the Rehab Bar in Watford the acts that sign up to this campaign will be entered into various categories where the public can vote on acts to win a Jam24Radio award (watch this space for more details jam24radio.com) an ultimate Top category for a winning artist.

We plan to make this an annual event where the current winning band will have to defend their title the following year. The event will be recorded for TV, radio and broadcast via the Jam24Radio website and YouTube channel.


Now this is where YOU come in. We are offering a fresh alternative to the mainstream. Jam24Radio is currently on-line with an "App" to follow shortly giving artist an opportunity to promote their music, productions  and Fans priority access to Jam24Radio, events, new releases plus a say in our play list.


Word is spreading and we now have bands not only from the UK but also from the US, Spain, Japan, Canada and China.

Having spoken to our current Bands and Fans we believe we can:

  • Provide a unique and exceptional service
  • Become an easy point of reference for the artists.
  • Have a consistent entertainment atmosphere and Fan participation.
  • Provide flexibility and innovation in our programming output

With all of that in mind You are invited to be part of the success of this event. We are calling it a "Fest" because it is a celebration of talent but we couldn't find a muddy enough field to hold it so went for a normal venue instead (but watch this space). With your input we plan to grow this to be the biggest on-line event for new and unsigned music which will help enrich the UK music industry.

What We Need & What You Get

The funding required for the project is £16000 and will be used in the following ways.

  • Funding the Live Event (Contributor tickets will be Free)
  • Adding greater functionality and services to our  website
  • Upgrade our broadcasting equipment
  • Premises and Licensing
  • Marketing and Advertising

FOR THE BANDS

  • Radio Airplay on a service that has worldwide access
  • Instant promotion to record companies
  • Greater exposure through our Jam24Radio service
  • Be featured in our on-line TV show.

FOR THE FANS

  • Be the first to hear the latest releases
  • Priority tickets to gigs and events
  • Voting rights on our Jam24Radio Chart
  • Free entry to competitions for cash and other prizes
  • Discounts on all merchandise and tickets

MANAGEMENT and A&R

  • Priority access to our bands
  • Be the first to hear the latest releases
  • Priority access to gigs and events

As contributors to the success of "JamFest2016" showcase Jam24Radio VIP Membership is yours and as the service grows so do your benefits automatically making you a Platinum Member.

THE IMPACT

Jam24Radio is more than just about the new music as we will also be giving opportunities to up and coming presenters, writers and producers to contribute audio and video features to our programming, plus partnering up with other additional companies to provide educational support and career advice for those wishing to work within the world of Media.

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for taking the time to read this but you can also help us by

  • Following us on twitter @jam24radio
  • Like us on our very new face book page “Facebook/jam24radioTV”
  • Watch and like our TV show “New Music 5”
  • Send any bands you know our way
  • And use the indiegogo share tools!

This will make our Jam24Radio Showcase unique, brilliant and all of this will be thanks to you and your contribution. It's time to take Centre Stage and Rock the Airwaves with a new music revolution.

Additional Opportunity: Investment

Jam24Radio.com will be a competitive business allowing us to grow and develop new and innovative services to our clients which are currently in the pipeline. Outside of our packages we are offering an opportunity to be part of Jam24Radio’s Business Management. If you are interested in becoming an Investor and would like to know more please email us at controller@jam24radio.com. With a subject header of “Business”.

Thank you.

story:
Designed by Tabitha Abney to flatter and accentuate. Made with a soft cotton blend for comfort and durability, yet being fashionable for a multitude of settings. Drawstrings on the sides allow you to tweak how you wear your shirt to fit how you feel and compliment what ever you pair it with.  

Tabitha Abney Is a fashion designer currently residing in Columbus, Ohio. Her work extends from couture one offs to forward thinking ready to wear pieces. You can find more about her work at Designs By Tabi/Tamarie LLC.

Ian Powell is an Artist from Columbus, having been a way from the musical limelight for a number of years to focus on other artistic pursuits and figure out how to present his music. Ian has been heavily involved in the Columbus, Ohio Music Community since 2006, From being a song writer and performer to photographing other musicians for promotion and publication.

This really is about lighting fires to get things done. Its a mix of branding and wonderful design. Tying music and fashion together. The Hooded Shirt is a modern play on the Little Red Ridding Hood Mythos, as Ian has been playing with aspects of the Big Bad Wolf both lyrically and visually. Ian first came up with this concept in 2008, and it took a while to find a Fashion designer he really wanted to partner with. Ian and Tabi have refined the idea of the past 2 years with the the pieces finally coming together now with a Limited run of 175 pieces available Fall 2016.

What we are looking for

We are Looking to raise at least $6,000.00 to cover production costs for the Limited Run. Anything raised beyond that through this offer will be split, half going towards Tabi’s Couture collections and half going towards the production of “The Howling Preacherman” an 10 song effort by Ian Powell.

With each shirt you’ll get a copy of the finished album when it is released. We’re giving you 2 options, a digital download or a signed physically copy. Updates on the recording process will be sent to you along with fashion events where Tabi’s designs are being showcased.

Our Most Unique offering is limited to 6 where you’ll get a full photo session photographed by Ian and styled by Tabi, If you select this option and opt to wait for the Shirts release to schedule, we will deliver it at your session. 

Other ways you can help

While we’d love you to donate small amounts or preorder this unique Hooded Womens Shirt, there are other ways you can support our projects, If you know of a Boutique Store you think would be perfect to carry a few shirts, have them get in contact with us we’d love to partner with them. You can follow our social media accounts for updates and please use the Indiegogo Share Tools to help get the word out.

story:
Short Summary

Dan and his ever-evolving band, Field Tripp,  have stayed active in the Phoenix/Tempe music scene since its inception in 2007....  playing hundreds of shows, touring, and releasing four albums.  Field Tripp has established themselves as one of the best live bands to see in Phoenix and have received several awards and enjoyed status on many best-of lists.

Working in mental health by day and rock n' roll at night,  Dan has stayed devoted to  his music for many years and has no plans of quitting.  Despite this devotion, Dan and the band have never had the resources to record in a legitimate studio, mostly due to their refusal to use a Super PAC.

Dan has his sights set on Flying Blanket Recording in Mesa, AZ to record with producer/engineer, and living legend,  Bob Hoag.  


What We Need & What You Get

Money, money, money...  that thing that musicians don't have.  To be completely honest, the band needs more than the $3,333 it's asking for.  Recording a full length album could easily cost $10,000 - $20,000.  For this project, we feel we need a minimum of 10 days in the studio, which is around $5,000. After that, other costs will include mastering, promotion, distribution of our outstanding perks, merchandise, and a considerable amount of coffee. 
Frankly, we hate asking for money.  We feel that even the $5,000 for studio time is too much to ask for, so the band has been making bi-weekly field trips to the Plasma Donation Center in an effort to cover the remaining $1,667.
Rest assured that every last cent of every donation will be spent on recording and the subsequent release of the finished product which includes:  studio time, mastering, and CD production.
Perks? Yeah, we got em.  All kinds of perks, great perks, fantastic perks.  Recipe perks, music perks...  For instance, the perk for a $50 donation is Field Tripp's entire discography on compact discs and digital downloads.  This will include a copy of the new album signed by the band and entrance to the album release show.

Why don't we just keep making records at home?
In short, they just don't sound good enough. We love recording our songs ourselves, it allows us to develop ideas and get our music out to people using means we have at home. Field Tripp is not about settling though, we're going to keep moving forward, and we must elevate our recordings and make the great album we know we're capable of making.  This will enable to reach a broader audience and finally give fans and new listeners a chance to hear recordings true to Field Tripp's energetic live sound.
Field Tripp has done their homework on recording studios in Arizona, and we have identified Flying Blanket Recording with Mr. Bob Hoag behind the desk as the best fit for us.  This studio has produced some very fine records of some very fine bands with some very fine equipment, and it is worth every penny.
Field Tripp was named "Best Live Band of 2014," by Sounds Around Town, "Hardest Working Musician of 2014" by Yab Yum Music and Arts and  was on Arizona Republic's list for Best Albums by Local Artists in 2014 among other awards and honors. Field Tripp wants to keep the momentum going and produce their best, most professional effort yet. 

Risks & Challenges

Sometimes it so happens that bands get into a studio and realize they don't know what they're doing.   They say things like "I don't even know what I'm doing."  They don't know their parts, they don't know what they want their songs to sound like, and they realize they can't play to a metronome....  all of this results in a colossal waste of time and money.

This will not happen with Field Tripp. We got 99 problems but laying down the tracks ain't one.  Field Tripp knows their songs, they know how they want their songs to sound. Field Tripp has been rehearsing their songs to a metronome and are keeping super-natural time with no loss of that invaluable "feel."  Field Tripp is ready to make that studio ours... we're ready to take a field tripp on a Flying Blanket to Murgatroyd. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Being starving artists ourselves, we understand if you're not able to make a donation but, there is still a lot you can do to help us on our way!  You can share our story on social media, tell your Uber driver about us, or come out to a show (we play free shows all the time!)  We welcome whatever support we can get!  Thanks for reading!  Please share! 

Love,

Field Tripp

Love,
Field Tripp

story:
At last! The radio station Portsmouth deserves, right there on your phone, tablet, laptop or desktop (and with a very familiar name).

We're launching a truly local station for Portsmouth, broadcasting via Android and iOS apps, and streaming on a unique website. Radio Victory will serve the city and its people; and the business will be owned and operated as a not-for-profit social enterprise, with every penny re-invested in the service. But we can't do it without your help!

Our exciting station will target the 30+ audience, and harness the latest technologies. To have that essential appeal to our target age group, we have secured the trademarked name of the former local commercial station which is no longer on-air.

 Promotional videos for Radio Victory:


So here's the money bit: the provisional costings for the station comprise two distinct elements. The first is the cost of leasing, adapting and converting the premises to act as the main studio and office, and a special live performance facility.

We have identified the cost for the launch and ongoing operation of the station itself too.

Much like other radio stations, we will produce revenue via advertising - with one BIG difference. We propose to sell airtime at very low rates, specifically to attract local advertisers. Not only that, but we would sell advertising space on our website and apps, and once the station has become established it will also be possible to sell feature sponsorship during programming.

We are in the process of recruiting professional radio presenters from the Portsmouth area, with a good working knowledge of the city and ideally these presenters will include voices from the original station.


Throughout the test project we ran in 2011/2012 (Trent Sound), we were very successful in attracting local bands and musicians to perform live sessions for broadcast (including Jake Bugg). This will continue to be a very important part of Radio Victory; promoting and supporting talent in Portsmouth.

As you'd expect, social media will play a pivotal role in our services, it is a vital tool in keeping listeners informed and engaging with them. Not forgetting that Facebook and Twitter advertising and content generated by us, then organically shared by other users, is a dynamic way to generate interest in the station. 

Overall, this is a wonderful opportunity to use new technology to transform the broadcast landscape in Portsmouth by delivering something that has been missing for decades: truly local programming for a neglected audience.

Thank you.

Listen to our audio trailer here:

Radio Victory

story:
Stuck. Trapped. Imprisoned. These are the words that domestic violence victims would use to describe not just their nightmares but their daily lives. When you are living with your tormentor, there is no relief. There is no break. It is you and the pain, day in and day out. You wake up together. You fall asleep together. You never really know when the horror is coming, only that it is coming. Often these victims learn not to reach out for help. They have no idea where to go or what their options are. It’s a tough situation, to say the least, and anyone who has survived domestic violence will tell you: it may even take an outside hero to change things.

My name is Pastor Liz Pla. I am a domestic violence and sexual assault survivor. Now an advocate in the Christian community, and also beyond the church in the secular community. I know the horror first hand in order to reach out to people who are currently facing what I myself have faced in the past.  As a survivor of domestic violence and sexual abuse, I know the need for someone to talk with and help think through the process of getting out of these dangerous situations, and actually following through and getting out. Unfortunately, when you are in these situations, you are often ashamed and embarrassed and therefore avoid talking to those closest to you, for fear they will judge you and take the abuser's defense. It's worse when you are a part of the Christian community and no one believes that this can happen to you. That is how I, with the leading of the Lord developed Healing Heart Ministry. Healing Heart Ministry is aimed to help victims in the Christian community find safety from their abusive situations by offering counseling and resources for the victim by phone, via online chat, and occasionally in person. However, what I do has now gone beyond what I do through Healing Heart Ministry. I have been presented with a tremendous opportunity to expand my ministry to a broader outlet for these victims that has never been tapped into before, and this is where I need your help. I am now working to secure a weekly one hour spot on a Christian radio station in the NJ/NYC area which will serve as an advice and resource program for the people who are stuck, for the people who are trapped, for the people who are imprisoned. With that, I will also be setting up a physical office from which my team and I can help domestic violence and sexual assault victims in person.

Right now, I am turning to you, Indigogo, for help in raising a minimum of $75,000. This startup capital will cover the costs of launching a weekly radio program and the leasing of office space so that Healing Heart Ministry will be able to help these victims get the counsel and resources that they so desperately need in person.  As both a survivor and advocate I know that this is a much needed service. Their cries may not be getting any louder, but they are still there nonetheless. We need to do something. With your help, we can make this happen. No one should have to live in fear. With your help we can help save the lives of domestic violence and sexual assault victims one victim at a time.  Your contributions will mean a lot. Thank you.

Risks and Challenges:

As with everything in life, there are always challenges, and I am never one to back down from them, and have never been one to quit when the going gets tough. My biggest challenge right now is coming up with the startup capital needed to pull this project together. Yes it is challenging, but I am a survivor. I have lived it. I am an overcomer. I am a voice for the silent. I am an advocate. I am not new to this. This is a wonderful cause, and these victims need help. There are so many in these horrible situations and they don't know where to go, or whom to trust, or whom to talk to. Domestic Violence has been a silent problem for way too long and it is about time that we give these victims a voice and a chance to become survivors and victors. Together we can do this. Together we will make this happen.
