I am a domestic violence and sexual assault survivor. Now an advocate in the Christian community, and also beyond the church in the secular community. I know the horror first hand in order to reach out to people who are currently facing what I myself have faced in the past.  As a survivor of domestic violence and sexual abuse, I know the need for someone to talk with and help think through the process of getting out of these dangerous situations, and actually following through and getting out. Unfortunately, when you are in these situations, you are often ashamed and embarrassed and therefore avoid talking to those closest to you, for fear they will judge you and take the abuser's defense. It's worse when you are a part of the Christian community and no one believes that this can happen to you. That is how I, with the leading of the Lord developed Healing Heart Ministry. Healing Heart Ministry is aimed to help victims in the Christian community find safety from their abusive situations by offering counseling and resources for the victim by phone, via online chat, and occasionally in person. However, what I do has now gone beyond what I do through Healing Heart Ministry. I have been presented with a tremendous opportunity to expand my ministry to a broader outlet for these victims that has never been tapped into before, and this is where I need your help. I am now working to secure a weekly one hour spot on a Christian radio station in the NJ/NYC area which will serve as an advice and resource program for the people who are stuck, for the people who are trapped, for the people who are imprisoned. With that, I will also be setting up a physical office from which my team and I can help domestic violence and sexual assault victims in person.Right now, I am turning to you, Indigogo, for help in raising a minimum of $75,000. This startup capital will cover the costs of launching a weekly radio program and the leasing of office space so that Healing Heart Ministry will be able to help these victims get the counsel and resources that they so desperately need in person.  As both a survivor and advocate I know that this is a much needed service. Their cries may not be getting any louder, but they are still there nonetheless. We need to do something. With your help, we can make this happen. No one should have to live in fear. With your help we can help save the lives of domestic violence and sexual assault victims one victim at a time.  Your contributions will mean a lot. Thank you.Risks and Challenges:As with everything in life, there are always challenges, and I am never 
one to back down from them, and have never been one to quit when the 
going gets tough. My biggest challenge right now is coming up with the 
startup capital needed to pull this project together.  Yes it is 
challenging, but I am a survivor. I have lived it. I am an overcomer. I 
am a voice for the silent. I am an advocate. I am not new to this. This 
is a wonderful cause, and these victims need help. There are so many in 
these horrible situations and they don't know where to go, or whom to 
trust, or whom to talk to. Domestic Violence has been a silent problem 
for way too long and it is about time that we give these victims a voice
 and a chance to become survivors and victors. Together we can do this. 
Together we will make this happen.

story:
Last Chance...
... to Join Our Team!

Susanna Ogata and Ian Watson are joining forces to record the complete Sonatas for Fortepiano and Violin of Beethoven in four installments. By partnering with us on this Indiegogo project – The Beethoven Project – you will help us achieve the final phase of the journey: completing the set of four CDs, Volumes 3 and 4, recorded and produced by the brilliant, three-time Grammy winner, Jesse Lewis.


Revolution.  Revelation.

Beethoven stormed onto the musical stage in Vienna at the turn of the 19th century. His music and persona pushed the existing forms and instruments to their absolute limit. Beethoven would definitely recognize the sight and sound of Susanna’s classical violin and Ian’s fortepiano. By using the instruments for which the music was written, we are able to reveal not only the clarity of Beethoven’s extraordinary musical structure, but also an amazing palette of colors. Our aim is not to polish up relics in a museum, but to recreate the white-hot intensity of the moment they were written and first performed. We have been working hard in our rehearsals and performances to do just that!


Phase One and Two are Complete!

We are so grateful to all who have gotten us this far on our path to completing the whole set of these great works on period instruments! 

Volume 1 was released in June, 2015 and has received wonderful reviews from major publications worldwide.   Here are a few notable quotes:

"Common wisdom has it that period instruments pack a softer punch than modern ones.  But as these two players show in this highly promising first installment of their Beethoven perusal, temperament is not measured in volume.  Rather, the music's moody outbursts and vivacity come fully alive in elegant readings that are attentive to quicksilver changes in dynamics and articulation.  Their performance of the Sonata No. 4 in A minor is darkly playful, their 'Kreutzer' Sonata brilliant and stormy."

- The New York Times

"These are altogether compelling performances, with well-judged tempos (except, perhaps, for the curiously fast account of the 'pattering' second variation from the Kreutzer's middle movement), and the music always vividly characterised."

- BBC Music Magazine

"The performances are electrifying – vigorous, sharp and unstoppably energetic. This is an exciting addition to the considerable catalogue of famous recordings of these works"

- Limelight Magazine

"The fortepiano and violin duo of Ian Watson and Susanna Ogata kickstart their survey of Beethoven’s complete sonatas for that particular combo in virile, dramatic style...The fortepiano here is no fragile museum piece, but a sparring partner with attitude. That same assertiveness informs the remainder of this particular sonata, not least in the lyrical playfulness of the Andante scherzoso. It is paired with the deeper intellectualism of the “Kreutzer” sonata, Op 47, virtuosically delivered."

-The Scotsman

Volume 2 is now complete and is due for international release in June, 2016 also on  the CORO label. 



Volumes 3 and 4 – The Final Stage

Our next CD, to be recorded June 5-8, 2016, will feature the fantastic trilogy, Beethoven's Op. 30 set, Sonatas 6, 7, and 8 for Fortepiano and Violin.  These three works are full of color, contrast, and variety, showing Beethoven's growth and sophistication in writing for this genre.  Beethoven makes a brilliant, unique statement with each of these works.  

We have already booked Mechanics Hall and our production team to record this volume in June, 2016.

Our final volume to be recorded, Volume 4, will include the Op. 12 set of Sonatas for Fortepiano and Violin.  This was his first effort in composing for this set of instruments.  In these works, we already can hear the master pushing this genre to new heights.



Budget

CORO, our recording company, pays for the pressing, packaging, and marketing of the finished product.   We are personally responsible for all the other costs including recording, editing, hall and instrument rental. Here is a breakdown of costs per volume:

Budget (per CD)

Description

Budget

Rental, Mechanics Hall

$6,500.00

Fortepiano Expenses (Rental, Moving, Maintenance, Tuning) 

$1,800.00

Engineering

$5,200.00

Mixing

$5,200.00

Mastering

$1,200.00

TOTAL

$19,900.00 per CD



Our Instruments

We will continue to record this music on period instruments – those for which Beethoven had in mind and ear when he was composing this music. By using the tools upon which these pieces were intended to be played, we feel we are able to reveal not only the clarity of Beethoven’s extraordinary musical structure, but also an amazing palette of colors.

Paul McNulty, "Anton Walter" copy, circa 1803

Joseph Klotz violin, 1792 and period French bow,
complete with gut strings and historical set-up

As a "project stakeholder" and valued donor, you are not just a bystander – you become a crucial part of the creative process and the final creation itself.

Thank you so much for joining our project and for your support!

With gratitude,

Susanna and Ian

  • Video by James Doyle and John Stemel
  • Front Photo of Susanna and Ian by Tatiana Daubek 
  • Photo on Video of Susanna and Ian by Hana Asazuma-Cheng
  • Photo of violin by James Doyle
  • Photo of fortepiano by Paul McNulty
  • Music by Ludwig van Beethoven

Risks & Challenges

There is risk involved with any recording project.  Our period instruments demand the greatest care.  However, we feel we have assembled the finest team to make this an outstanding project.  We've already reached the midpoint, completing two of four volumes. Our world-class team is 100% committed to seeing this project through to the end.

Other Ways You Can Help!

If you are unable to make a contribution, please consider sharing our campaign with those whom you feel might be excited about our project.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
We are excited to present to the world, Meduchi's first music video as a solo artist!! We are thrilled to introduce to the world this talented singer-songwriter and entertainer, born in Brooklyn and raised in Long Island, New York. Meduchi grew up with music on his mind and it hasn’t left since. Raised by culture-loving, Haitian parents in the heart of culturally diverse Brooklyn, he grew up listening to a melting pot of sounds. He strives to bring his audience that same eclectic feel through his own music. “In my house, it would be a miracle to hear one genre of music for a long period of time because my parents loved music from different cultures.”

This music videos, brings everything Meduchi is about, back around full circle.  This smooth Caribbean influenced ballad produced by the talented and legendary, Electrik Dread, sound engineer for the late and great, Bob Marley, shoots the song in a Grammy award winning direction.  Song mixed by the 2X Grammy nominated recording and mix engineer, Lance Powell, whose worked with artist, such as Miguel, Macy Gray, Mali Music, Shakira, Ledisi, Tank, Gyptian, K Michelle, Raekwon, Melissa Etheridge, Akon, Melanie Fiona, Wyclef Jean and many more. 

In closing,  with your help, we can collectively push this song and this young man's career into a new stratosphere! In addition, you can't go wrong with the beautiful landscape that Belize has to offer in collaboration with the smooth and sexy music and vocals!  So, we hope to realize this project and for more details on where to hear the song and also purchase your copy, visit www.MeduchiLive.com.

Best of Wishes, from Meduchi and the Dynomyte Productions family! :)

story:
This December, I undertook a project of recording an original arrangement of a Christmas tune every day until Christmas and uploading them to YouTube. 

Now that I have 25 new arrangements, I want to record my favorites while they are fresh in my mind. My first solo piano album, Reawakening, has been well received (listen at www.NateHance.com), so I want to record a Christmas album for the next holiday season. This album will have a mix of relaxing and jazzed up Christmas tunes and will be a great listen at Christmas time!

In addition, I am going to record my 2nd solo piano album this spring. I have 4 tracks written and working on the rest! This will be released Summer 2016.
Even if you cannot donate to this campaign, please help me by spreading the word and sharing this campaign with others. You can also subscribe to my YouTube channel (YouTube.com/NateHance), where I have 50+ videos posted, and 'like' my Facebook musician page (Facebook.com/NathanHance)
I am excited to record these albums in the coming months and continue to share my music with the world! Thank you for your continued support as I follow my passion!
Note: If you selected the $10 Digital Download perk, you will receive and download of both CDs. I am unable to edit this on the campaign page.
Nate

story:
The Story

“Nothing Left to Say” is the current recording project in the works by 'Dangerous' Doug Harper. Harper, a musician for the last 23 years has been writing and recording, touring, promoting, teaching, and living music. Unlike many of the other projects Harper has produced, this one is said to be slightly different. Some of the differences fans may notice is that all of the tracks will be with a full band. Many of Harper’s recent recordings are just stripped down pieces with himself and a guitar or two guitars and two vocal tracks. “This album will be my best” Harper said of the work in progress. It is a concept album of sorts, though many of Harper’s works are intended that way, but he says “This one will make a lot more sense to everyone. And have a clearer message”. Although Harper said there would be a few unusual and less serious songs on the record such as a song called “We Must Clone Trevor,” most of the songs this time around are more serious and come with much passion.
The last few 'Dangerous' Doug Harper albums were more on the artistic, thought provoking, poetic — even darker, and angry. The new work will be more about arriving, forgiveness, finding the answers, and ends with a conclusion. Most of Harper’s past works have been more open ended, and less conclusive than this one will be. Though the project will be raw, it will feel more complete than the sessions of the last few titles.
The new record will be much more consistent. The last few projects have taken place in lots of locations. This project will be very consistent in production from track to track though the songs will be very turbulent from one to another. Staying consistent with the message of past productions such as “Number Eleven” from the project titled “Tips Appreciated” means there will be only 11 songs on the disc.
Among other differences from the recent projects by Harper, this one will include a number of guest musicians, and a band feel throughout, and song structure will be more like his earlier works in which he had a band mindset in play.
No word on how Harper plans to present this work live, but Harper even said himself “acoustic versions of the song will just not cut it” on this project.

The Funds

Can we make an album if the $2,600 is not completely reached? Yes, but really that is the bare minimum to make it right on. Harper will be putting in some additional funds here and there, and has already spent some money getting prepared for the project. Harper will put in the difference that is not raised to make the album, it will take longer to get it done if that happens. The $2,600 will cover the costs of some additional equipment needed, production space rental, transportation, and manufacturing of the finished product to a top quality standard.

The Release

Harper has a long track record of following through and reaching completion on his musical projects. This one will be no different, but with the assistance of funding, things will get done much faster, more consistently, and the finished product will be really delightful.

Why this could not be done before

The songs for this NEW recording project are just that, they are NEW. Never before in life was Harper able to have lived life and experienced its ups and downs enough to have written these kind of songs such as "The future is here". His musicianship is at a peak, and production equipment is at a pinnacle. NOW is the best time for distribution, NOW is the best time for indie-music, and NOW is the best time to make this record.

story:
Short Summary

Following in his Father’s footsteps, Chris Nice threw his hat in the ring in 1984 taking his first steps to become a Dj. The years that followed were spent developing his own style and one day turning the passion into a profession. That dream became a reality when Chris Nice entered the club circuit and music business in the city of Toronto, Canada and never looked back.

Since then he has played at a countless amount of legendary venues in Toronto, worked as a Mixshow Radio Dj, promoted concerts like the legendary LL Cool J, KC & JO JO, etc, became the CEO of Blazin Vinyl Record Pool (which became Blazin MP3 Pool) plus co-promoter and DJ for the legendary House of Blues and Live Nation for concerts such as The Black Eyed Peas, Mary J. Blige, Musiq Soul Child, Chaka Khan, Anita Baker, etc. Chris Nice was also instrumental in finding, marketing and getting Canadian artist Humble signed to his first record label. Humble then went on to become a 2009 Juno Award winner for Reggae Artist of the year (the Juno Awards is Canada’s version of the Grammy Awards). 

On Friday, July 29, 2016, DJ Chris Nice is pleased to present, the North American Soca Monarch festival. This event will take place outdoors in Toronto, Canada the weekend of the 2016 Toronto Carnival, the biggest Caribbean Festivities in North America with over one million annual visitors to the city. I am excited to bring this most important event to showcase our celebration of artistic talent and cultural diversity to residents of Toronto and tourist alike.

The theme of The North American Soca Monarch festival is to have some of the top International Caribbean/Soca Artists with a 2016 hit record in heavy rotation (on radio, with mobile Djs, high online viewership and followers) in North America, compete for the title of the number one Caribbean/Soca artist of North America, in front a large multicultural audience in attendance from across the globe. Participants will be competing for 1st, 2nd and 3rd place in the competition, as well as bragging rights for soca supremacy in North America.

The North American Soca Monarch will play a large role in showcasing the artists and art form of Caribbean/Soca Music across the globe. Bringing this most important event to North America can only assist in the growth of Caribbean music and serve as another avenue to further expose this musical art form that is expanding annually, making the multicultural city of Toronto the perfect city to host this event. This event will be advertised globally online through several media and marketing outlets.

There will also be a special segment during the event titled De Next Generation Competition that will highlight North America’s up and coming Caribbean/Soca artists. There will be 2 semi finals for De Next Generation competition a week before the North American Soca Monarch, in both Canada and the United States. The 2 winners emerging from each region will then compete for De Next Generation Competition finals, on the grand stage at the North American Soca Monarch, alongside the industry icons. This competition is a great opportunity for an up and coming artist to gain international exposure.

Born in the Caribbean and raised in Canada this event is most important to me because this event will be instrumental in not only the growth of the artists but also the art form. Caribbean/Soca Music a beautiful multicultural art form that deserves more exposure. It is also a part of my culture and I look forward in assisting with the international growth of one of the most dynamic musical art forms in the world.



What We Need & What You Get

the funding needed for the North American Soca Monarch Festival is $350,000.00..here is a list of the expense for the Festival.

1. expense for 16 Artist competing in the main event and 4 up and coming artist for De Next Generation event (Air, Hotel, per dium while in Toronto and a $3,000 artists appearance fee).

2. the 2 month Marketing package for the event will include Online media outlets, 2 major radio stations in the US and Canada, hard copy news paper and magazine in US and Canada, 5,000 hard copy event flyers & posters

3. Venue expense for over 3,000 people, construction of main stage, sound & lighting, back stage accommodations, cost of 100 staff members, etc.

4. event licenses (liquor license, waste management, zoning permits, etc)  


** Our amazing perks for this most important event will allow our supporters to join us at the event by offering admission passes into the venue the day of the event, free drink tickets, beautiful thank you gift bags along with an artist meet and greet during the festival. This will allow our supporters to enjoy this great event with us.

** If we don't reach our entire funding goal for the North American Soca Monarch Festival the funds accumulated will go towards booking the venue, artists expense and marketing package. We will then accumulate the remaining funds by ticket sales and bar revenues the night of the event.



The Impact

An event like this is so important to the Caribbean culture and growing community in North America. This art form and culture is growing annually in popularity and can only benefit by the exposure this event will give it. This most important event will not only assist in marketing the artist involved in the festival but also to the Caribbean/Soca artists world wide that may not be in the festival. This festival will put a spot light on the Caribbean culture for years to come. 

My 30 year track record in the music industry and a strong team will help in making this event a stapled event during the Toronto Carnival weekend. Working in the concert arena with the likes of House of Blues/Live Nation, LL Cool J, Black Eyed Peas, etc, has prepared me for an event like this where I can assist in showcasing my Caribbean culture and music to the world. 



Risks & Challenges

The number one obstacle for this festival is obtaining enough funds to make this most important event a reality. An event of this magnitude can be costly making funding the biggest obstacle. Proper funding ensures that all expenses are covered that is vital to ensure a successful event, for example the Marketing Package which in turns helps in ticket sales. 

Reaching out for assistance on Indiegogo is a great way for solving this issue. I've always believed that no man or woman is an island and that we need each other sometimes and should not be ashamed to say so. I have also reached out to some major companies in pursue of sponsorship for the event and got 3 replies telling me that they have already sent out their annual sponsorship funds but liked the concept of the festival and would like to speak with me next year.   

I sent out a few feelers in Toronto on social media and got a great response, people wanted to know when tickets would be released. We didn't even market the event yet and got a great buzz in the community. Our Marketing Package will play a major role in the success of this festival and we have put together an impressive package using social media, hard copy news papers/magazines, hard copy flyers/posters, radio adds and co-promotions by all the artists involved in the festival. We are more than ready to dedicate our summer to marketing this event to North America and the globe.



Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone may be in the position to contribute to this most important event and believe that we can use people's assistance in getting the word out about this festival to their family and friends. Using and directing people to the Indiegogo share tools can be a great help to our team and the success of this event. Your assistance is greatly appreciated by myself and team NASM (North American Soca Monarch).
story_txt:
Short Summary 
Following in his Father’s footsteps, Chris Nice threw his hat in the ring in 1984 taking his first steps to become a
Dj. The years that followed were spent developing his
own style and one day turning the passion into a profession. That dream became a reality when Chris Nice entered the club
circuit and music business in the city of Toronto, Canada and never looked back. 

Since then he has played at a countless
amount of legendary venues in Toronto, worked as a Mixshow Radio Dj, promoted concerts like the legendary LL
Cool J, KC & JO JO, etc, became the CEO of Blazin
Vinyl Record Pool (which became Blazin MP3 Pool) plus co-promoter and DJ for the legendary House of Blues and Live Nation for concerts such as The Black Eyed Peas,
Mary J. Blige, Musiq Soul Child, Chaka Khan,
Anita Baker, etc. Chris Nice was
also instrumental in finding, marketing and getting Canadian artist Humble signed to his first record
label. Humble then went on to become a 2009 Juno Award winner for Reggae Artist
of the year (the Juno Awards is Canada’s version of the Grammy Awards). 

On Friday,
July 29, 2016, DJ Chris Nice is pleased to present, the North American Soca Monarch festival. This event will take place
outdoors in Toronto, Canada the weekend of the 2016 Toronto Carnival, the biggest Caribbean Festivities in North America with over one million annual visitors to the city. I am excited to bring this most important event to
showcase our celebration of artistic talent and cultural diversity to residents of Toronto and tourist alike. 
The
theme of The North American Soca
Monarch festival is to have some of the top International Caribbean/Soca
Artists with a 2016 hit record in heavy
rotation (on radio, with mobile Djs, high online viewership and followers) in North America,
compete for the title of the number one Caribbean/Soca artist of North America, in
front a large multicultural audience in attendance from across the globe.
Participants will be competing for 1st, 2nd and 3rd
place in the competition, as well as bragging rights
for soca supremacy in North America. 
The
North American Soca Monarch will play a large role in showcasing the artists
and art form of Caribbean/Soca Music across the globe. Bringing this most important event to North America
can only assist in the growth of Caribbean music and serve as another avenue to
further expose this musical art form that is expanding annually, making the multicultural city of Toronto the perfect city to host this event. This event will be advertised globally
online through several media and marketing outlets.
There
will also be a special segment during the event titled De Next Generation Competition that will highlight North
America’s up and coming Caribbean/Soca artists. There will be 2 semi finals for De Next
Generation competition a week before the North American Soca Monarch, in both Canada
and the United States. The 2 winners emerging from each region will then
compete for De Next Generation Competition finals, on the grand stage at the
North American Soca Monarch, alongside the industry icons. This competition is a great opportunity for an up and coming artist to
gain international exposure.
Born in the Caribbean and raised in Canada this event is most important to me because this event will be instrumental in not only the growth of the artists but also the art form. Caribbean/Soca Music a beautiful multicultural art form that deserves more exposure. It is also a part of my culture and I look forward in
assisting with the international growth of one of the most dynamic musical art forms in the world.

   What We Need & What You Get the funding needed for the North American Soca Monarch Festival is $350,000.00..here is a list of the expense for the Festival.
1. expense for 16 Artist competing in the main event and 4 up and coming artist for De Next Generation event (Air, Hotel, per dium while in Toronto and a $3,000 artists appearance fee).
2. the 2 month Marketing package for the event will include Online media outlets, 2 major radio stations in the US and Canada, hard copy news paper and magazine in US and Canada, 5,000 hard copy event flyers & posters
3. Venue expense for over 3,000 people, construction of main stage, sound & lighting, back stage accommodations, cost of 100 staff members, etc.
4. event licenses (liquor license, waste management, zoning permits, etc)  

** Our amazing perks for this most important event will allow our supporters to join us at the event by offering admission passes into the venue the day of the event, free drink tickets, beautiful thank you gift bags along with an artist meet and greet during the festival. This will allow our supporters to enjoy this great event with us.
** If we don't reach our entire funding goal for the North American Soca Monarch Festival the funds accumulated will go towards booking the venue, artists expense and marketing package. We will then accumulate the remaining funds by ticket sales and bar revenues the night of the event.


    The Impact An event like this is so important to the Caribbean culture and growing community in North America. This art form and culture is growing annually in popularity and can only benefit by the exposure this event will give it. This most important event will not only assist in marketing the artist involved in the festival but also to the Caribbean/Soca artists world wide that may not be in the festival. This festival will put a spot light on the Caribbean culture for years to come. 
My 30 year track record in the music industry and a strong team will help in making this event a stapled event during the Toronto Carnival weekend. Working in the concert arena with the likes of House of Blues/Live Nation, LL Cool J, Black Eyed Peas, etc, has prepared me for an event like this where I can assist in showcasing my Caribbean culture and music to the world. 


    Risks & Challenges The number one obstacle for this festival is obtaining enough funds to make this most important event a reality. An event of this magnitude can be costly making funding the biggest obstacle. Proper funding ensures that all expenses are covered that is vital to ensure a successful event, for example the Marketing Package which in turns helps in ticket sales. 
Reaching out for assistance on Indiegogo is a great way for solving this issue. I've always believed that no man or woman is an island and that we need each other sometimes and should not be ashamed to say so. I have also reached out to some major companies in pursue of sponsorship for the event and got 3 replies telling me that they have already sent out their annual sponsorship funds but liked the concept of the festival and would like to speak with me next year.   
I sent out a few feelers in Toronto on social media and got a great response, people wanted to know when tickets would be released. We didn't even market the event yet and got a great buzz in the community. Our Marketing Package will play a major role in the success of this festival and we have put together an impressive package using social media, hard copy news papers/magazines, hard copy flyers/posters, radio adds and co-promotions by all the artists involved in the festival. We are more than ready to dedicate our summer to marketing this event to North America and the globe.


    Other Ways You Can Help We understand that not everyone may be in the position to contribute to this most important event and believe that we can use people's assistance in getting the word out about this festival to their family and friends. Using and directing people to the Indiegogo share tools can be a great help to our team and the success of this event. Your assistance is greatly appreciated by myself and team NASM (North American Soca Monarch).

story:
The 24th Annual Erie Art Museum Blues & Jazz Festival: August 6 - 7, 2016

“This is the best Festival ever. I mean, it’s a family thing, everybody can have a good time, kids, babies, adults, you see everything here, it’s a great time for anybody and everybody.”


“Every year it just seems to get better and better…. You know what I mean, every time you say, I don’t know if they can top last year, but still by the end of it, standing ovation all the way around, all around.”


The Erie Art Museum Blues & Jazz Festival, now in its 24th year, is the ONLY arts festival in Erie, PA, a beautifully sited city and tourist mecca on the shores of Lake Erie.  When the free Blues & Jazz Festival began in 1992, there was the Summer Festival of the Arts (1966-2014), the Greek Festival (in its third year), We Love Erie Days, and Discover Presque Isle (just one year old). Since then, thirteen (yes, 13!) new festivals have begun in Erie. The sponsorship dollars to support all these free festivals have been sliced thinner and thinner. Business and patron sponsorships pay for performers, stage rental, port-o-lets, sound system, electricians, and all the other costs.

Although the Erie Art Museum Blues & Jazz Festival wins frequent and enthusiastic accolades as the best event of the summer, funding has become challenging, even though the budget has hardly grown. The Museum festival budget is only $75,000! That’s less than a single act at some comparable festivals.


Part of the Erie Art Museum’s mission is to present art in all its forms, including music. The Festival attracts more than 20,000 people to hear musicians ranging from local talents to international superstars. There is the Museum’s kid craft area, and local food vendors serve everything from sausage hoagies and Pittsburgh-style sandwiches to vegetarian wraps, fresh squeezed lemonade and homemade ice cream, but the focus remains on the music.


Booking the Festival lineup is similar to curating an art exhibition. Selections must stand on their own while also complimenting the other choices. Museum Director and Festival curator John Vanco is passionate about blues and jazz. “I listen to music all the time. My library shelves groan with the weight of over 20,000 records. It’s crucial to present authentic music,” Vanco insists. “I favor artists who have a personal style, compose their own music, and are engaged in the tradition. An artist’s fame is not important to me; I will always choose quality over celebrity.”



The Blues & Jazz Festival is completely accessible to the community, with people of all walks of life enjoying great music together. You can see families hosting their annual reunions and picnics at the Festival, and watch the kids who dance in front of the main stage grow up through the years. Seeing the park packed shoulder-to-shoulder all the way to 8th Street is gratifying to anyone who loves great music and our beautiful city.


Join us in celebrating 24 years of great music in a beautiful, family-friendly setting by becoming a sponsor!


You can also support the Erie Art Museum’s Blues & Jazz Festival by volunteering. Our bare-bones budget relies on the help of over 140 volunteers. Please contact Ally Thomas at (814) 459-5477 or email ally@erieartmuseum.org for more information.

Please use the IndieGoGo tools to share our message with your family and friends across social media! Thank you so much for your support!

LINEUP FOR 2016 Erie Art Museum Blues & Jazz Festival:

Saturday, August 6:

Noon  YMCA Teen Center Collaborative

2 pm  Jeff Fetterman Blues Band

4 pm   Diablo Dimes and his Dixie Deacons (hokum and blues)

6 pm  Jontavious Willis (traditional blues)

8 pm  Bernard Allison Group  (electric blues)


Sunday, August 7:

Noon  Bruce Johnstone Quartet  (mainstream jazz)

2 pm  House of Rhythm  (traditional hot jazz)

4 pm  Tony Grey/Ian Maciak Galactic Duo featuring C. Brown (contemporary jazz)

6 pm  Paul McCandless with Charged Particles (straight ahead electric jazz)

8 pm  Red Baraat (bhangra/funk/jazz)


ARTISTS YOU HAVE ENJOYED AT PAST FESTIVALS INCLUDE*:

Blues greats Charles Brown, R.L. Burnside, Junior Kimbrough, Irma Thomas, Eddie “The Chief” Clearwater, Joe Louis Walker, Jimmy Johnson, Bobby Rush, Son Seals, Travis “Moonchild” Haddix, Otis Clay, Otis Taylor, Albert Castiglia, Lonnie Brooks, Byther Smith, Junior Brown, Lil’ Ed & the Blues Imperials, Mem Shannon, Ronnie Baker Brooks, Lurrie Bell, Sugar Blue, the Campbell Brothers, Super Chikan, Corey Harris, Kenny Neal, the Lee Boys, Rev. John Wilkins, Rory Block, W.C. Clark, and Deborah Coleman.

Jazz luminaries Kenny Garrett, Buster Williams, Chico Hamilton, Gary Bartz, Winard Harper, Dollar Brand (Abdullah Ibrahim), Jaki Byard, Olu Dara, Joanne Brackeen, Jane Bunnett, Oliver Lake, David “Fathead” Newman, Orrin Evans, René Marie, Rebecca Coupe Franks, Leni Stern, Lindsey Horner, Either/Orchestra, Chuchito Valdés, Rachel Z, Rashied Ali, Pucho & His Latin Soul Brothers, Sonny Fortune, Holly Hoffman, Amina Figarova, Lee Konitz, Dr. Eddie Henderson and Russell Gunn.  

Roots music including Cajun and Zydeco stars D.L. Menard and the Louisiana Aces, Sean Ardoin, Rosie Ledet, and Jude Taylor, Jamaican reggae Rastafarians The Meditations, Brooklyn Bhangra phenoms Red Baraat, and African superstars Sam Mangwana, Papa Noel Nedule, Djelimady Tounkara & the Super Rail Band, Issa Bagayogo, and Oliver Mtukudzi.


Regional favorites such as Mary Alice Brown, Charles Ventrello, and One World Tribe.

And literally hundreds of other great musicians.

*(not a complete list)

Click here for a more complete list of Blues & Jazz Festival performers.

story:
My name is Simon Chadwick and I am a musician based in St Andrews, Fife, Scotland, specialising in the ancient harp music of Scotland and Ireland.

Every year since 2007 I have played a monthly series of summer lunchtime harp concerts in St Andrews.

In 2014 we moved the concerts to the wonderful Arts & Crafts ambience of All Saints Church Hall - a wonderful venue with a superb acoustic for the harp. We also launched our first Crowdfunding campaign to support the concert series.

So here we are again! For 2016 we are planning four concerts:

Thursday 2nd June, Salve Splendor medieval sacred music
Wednesday 6th July, Cogadh no Sith an epic medieval ceremonial tune
Wednesday 3rd August, The Memoirs of Arthur O’Neill baroque Irish harp music
Thursday 8th September, Heroic music Tristram, Arthur, & Fionn mac Cumhail

As with the last two years, we have no institutional support or sponsorship at all - the entire series and its expenses are paid for by you, our supporters and concert attendees.

And, just like every year since 2007, the concerts are completely free admission.

So, do your bit to keep this St Andrews summer institution going, by helping us hit our goal of £500 raised by the day of the first concert in the series. 

Any contribution is welcome - you can contribute as little as £1 which will still make a difference to our work. And please do share this with your friends and contacts. Thanks so much for your help!

story:
I represent musical artists that suffer from non-payment of royalties and other royalty related issues. I started a company called Black Box Royalties in 2009 for the sole intent and purpose of helping artists and their heirs collect royalty money due to lack of payment from the label or publisher. BBR works on a complete contingency basis; if my clients do not make any money, neither do I; this I believe is one of the most honest and fair ways to have a relationship with an artist who is wary due to their past experiences with unfair accounting practices by their record label or publisher.

We need financial help for our clients due to the costs of audits and legal expertise. A true accounting and litigation to enforce that accounting to be upheld is crucial in our client's cases. Most of the issues of royalty matters are settled though contract law. The record labels and publishers that owe our clients’ money use this to their advantage; thus the audit and settlement/litigation is the formidable chink in their armor. Many times their final defense is hiding behind litigation, basically sue us if you want your money.

I would like to share with you two examples of our clients I am trying to raise money for.  Also I listed below is what the money will be used for and most importantly, I am giving everyone who donates at least $10 a minimum a voucher to be redeemed, if a settlement has been reached in the client's favor. The contributor can also op for 2 free digital downloads of the artists' music we represent in connection with this fundraiser.  Artist will be revealed once a settlement has been reached.  More information about this below.

Before I tell you about some of our client’s stories, please know that the vast majority of artists rely on royalty payments as their sole income. These people create the jingles for commercials, the song from your high school years that wasn't a smash hit but it was one of your favorites. They create scores for films and fill our homes both physically and digitally with countless hours of music.

Various things go wrong with someone's account or life (And sometimes their death) that can be a green light to greed for the very people that swear to account to them and don't. When an artist or an heir doesn't get paid properly or not at all, that is an electric bill, a car payment, food for their children or a medical bill that goes by the wayside. It is akin to working for someone and not getting paid on a perpetual basis. Please take the time to read these short stories and the relevant information below.

Client#1: An elderly person living alone. Spouse, all three children are deceased. One of these children wrote a hit song that was covered by a very well-known artist and made some descent money. This talented artist died suddenly and unexpectedly. Within a few short years of passing, the royalty payments went from thousands of dollars to less than $50. This person is one of the kindest truest people I have met but has had a hard time with the passing of her entire family. The song and music left behind is what drives this person to keep living and hoping that this wrong would be somehow righted. This person is living from one social security check to the next when there should be an ample yearly supply of music royalties to help supplement. This client did nothing wrong, just is simply being taken advantage of thanks to some clever accounting. Whole albums, territories and related royalties never appear on any statement. The albums exist, are bought and sold, yet there is nothing in a statement or in the form of a check to the client for these exploitations. A proper accounting through an audit and negotiating a better publishing deal is mandatory. We are highly confident that this can be achieved, due to the unpaid albums/territories as well as the nature of the song and the high profile artist that covered it.

Client#2: This case involves an artist that passed away and left everything to an heir. The heir lives very modestly and makes carpets for a living.  Again, with the passing of the artist, greed was given a green light and even though all the proper paperwork and documentation were available, instead of reaching out and contacting the heir at the exact same household in which the artist lived and died, they simply stopped sending royalty checks. Phone calls, faxes and other correspondence were never returned. Years pass, I discover the problem and get the royalty payments going again. After rendering an internal accounting, it was shockingly clear that thousands of royalties were not being reported or paid by either the label or the publisher. After further investigation, it was discovered that percentages of higher earning songs were being substituted with lower ones. Many other accounting and legal errors exist in this situation with potential fraud. 

What BBR Offers ALL Donors: Any donation that is in the amount of $10 or more will be reimbursed through a voucher, if and when we are successful in our reclamation efforts. The odds of being reimbursed are no less than 50% and in the cases mentioned above, much greater. If you would like the opportunity to be reimbursed per your donation, kindly leave some contact information.  We are also offering to those contributors who do not wish for a voucher, an opportunity for 2 free digital downloads of the artists' music we represent in connection with this fundraiser.

I would like to add in conclusion that our clients need your help to claim what is rightfully and legally theirs. In no way, in any manner, shape or form will the funds raised for the clients be used for personal purposes. The money is solely used for legal and audit expenses. To further the transparency of our business practices to the donors, we are willing to provide documentation regarding how the donors' funds were spent.

Artists and their heirs cannot be expected to create music for a living and continuously fight a company with deep pockets for what is owed to them. They need your help.

So, who would like to help us in being the Robin Hood of Royalties to artists with unpaid royalties?

Thank you for your time and consideration.

www.blackboxroyalties.com

 This case involves an artist that passed away and left everything to an
 heir. The heir lives very modestly and makes carpets for a living.  
Again, with the passing of the artist, greed was given a green light and
 even though all the proper paperwork and documentation were available, 
instead of reaching out and contacting the heir at the exact same 
household in which the artist lived and died, they simply stopped 
sending royalty checks. Phone calls, faxes and other correspondence were
 never returned. Years pass, I discover the problem and get the royalty 
payments going again. After rendering an internal accounting, it was 
shockingly clear that thousands of royalties were not being reported or 
paid by either the label or the publisher. After further investigation, 
it was discovered that percentages of higher earning songs were being 
substituted with lower ones. Many other accounting and legal errors 
exist in this situation with potential fraud.  What BBR Offers 
ALL Donors: Any donation that is in the amount of $10 or more will be 
reimbursed through a voucher, if and when we are successful in our reclamation efforts. The
 odds of being reimbursed are no less than 50% and in the cases 
mentioned above, much greater. If you would like the opportunity to be 
reimbursed per your donation, kindly leave some contact information.  We are also offering to those contributors who do not wish for a voucher, an opportunity for 2 free digital downloads of the artists' music we represent in connection with this fundraiser.I
 would like to add in conclusion that our clients need your help to 
claim what is rightfully and legally theirs. In no way, in any manner, 
shape or form will the funds raised for the clients be used for personal
 purposes. The money is solely used for legal and audit expenses. To 
further the transparency of our business practices to the donors, we are
 willing to provide documentation regarding how the donors' funds were 
spent. Artists and their heirs cannot be expected 
to create music for a living and continuously fight a company with deep 
pockets for what is owed to them. They need your help. So, who would like to help us in being the Robin Hood of Royalties to artists with unpaid royalties?Thank you for your time and consideration.www.blackboxroyalties.com

story:
(Please note: if you want the CD, but the $25 minimum perk level is more than you want to spend, you can always just purchase the CD for $15 directly from the record label at http://www.innova.mu/albums/mike-olson/six-proj....  You can also order the LP directly at http://www.innova.mu/albums/mike-olson/six-proj...)

My name is Mike Olson and I've been creating music for about 40 years. I started out as a self-taught musician, playing keyboards in various Rock and Jazz Fusion bands, and later went on to receive a formal education in music composition at the University of Minnesota, where I studied with Dominic Argento and Eric Stokes among others.

I've written a lot of music over the years, but only a relatively small proportion of
that music has ever been released as commercially available recordings. The primary barrier has been the cost. My thinking has always been, "why should I go to all the time and expense of creating physical CDs or LPs, seeing as so few people actually buy them?" A logical position, particularly now that so many people seem to think that all music should be available for free. So, I've just continued creating my music on my own. I decide on a project I'd like to pursue, immerse myself completely into the process of its creation and generate a perfect recording of the finished piece of music. Then, I move on to another piece. It's become something akin to a spiritual practice for me.

Now, I've decided to break that pattern by incorporating into my process the additional step of creating commercially available physical CDs and LPs. That's why I'm undertaking this crowd funding campaign via Indiegogo. It will cost something in excess of $9,000 for me to create and market the actual physical CDs and LPs for my "Six Projects" release. 

The vast majority of the costs associated with the creation of this recording have already been incurred. The music has been created. The musicians have been paid. It has all been recorded, mixed and mastered. Here's a specific breakdown of what's left for me to pay out-of-pocket. This is where the money I'm raising will be going:

LP Manufacturing  

      Full color gatefold tip-on jackets and inserts.
      180 gram translucent green vinyl.
      100 units – delivered.          
      $2,560

CD Manufacturing
      Full color digipacks with an 8-page full color booklet.
      1,000 units – delivered.          
      $1,840

Administrative and marketing budget for Innova Recordings, (record label).           
      $3,300

Artwork prepress tweaking.         
      $338

Miscellaneous shipping.           
      $600

Record release party and concert (promotional activity).   
      $900

Grand Total: $9,538

So, what's the point? Why do this? From a purely economic perspective, it makes no sense whatsoever. It does, however, make perfect sense from an artistic output perspective. Taking this action will put my music out into the world in a way that just posting things on Soundcloud never could. It will also help to establish a tangible legacy of my work, particularly if I am able to make this a regular part of my music making process.

What I've done for this record, is I've looked back at music I've created over the past decade or so and selected six pieces that form an aesthetically coherent grouping. Thus the name, "Six Projects". They run the gamut from purely acoustic to purely electronic, but they all share certain aesthetic attributes and, because of how they're sequenced, they flow together in a musically satisfying way.

The music on "Six Projects" comes directly from my heart and soul in a way that I cannot articulate with words. It is a deeply personal expression of who I am as a human being. This music is special, and therefore I want the packaging to be special as well. Seeing as I'm going beyond the creation of the music itself and creating an actual physical object, that object should be a work of art. It should be a thing of beauty – something the listener can enjoy exploring and reading while listening to the music. That's exactly what I'm striving for. I'm trying to think in terms of making this a true musical fetish object, for people who appreciate owning a tangible physical connection to the music.

I'm partnering with Innova Recordings for this record and their reputation and stature should ensure significant art music press coverage. They'll also handle all of the online and physical media distribution through their established channels.  The way it works with Innova is I will have to cover the manufacturing, administrative and marketing costs. Theoretically, I would then recoup those costs through sales. The break-even point (excluding the LPs) is equivalent to selling roughly 600 CDs. Of course it is an open question as to whether or not I can sell that many, and in my case it will be a tougher lift, seeing as I'm investing in high-end packaging and vinyl. I keep 100% of the profits realized from sales, and Innova takes nothing. I also retain ownership of my recordings.

This project will be accomplished one way or another. I am committed. The only question is just how broke and in debt I will be at the end of the day. That's why I need your help. I will gladly accept any level of contribution, and if you are unable to help out with money, you can contribute by helping with the record release party or just by spreading the word through your own social media network. Indiegogo provides specialized share tools that you can use as well.

Click on the "Gallery" tab above to access more videos and photos. There you will find videos about the making of each of the six music projects, the long version of the pitch video with a lot more information and detail, along with other videos and a bunch of photographs.

Thank you for taking the time to read through this proposal and for your help. For more information about my music in general, please visit http://www.mikeolsonmusic.com.

story:
Bio

"I want to conquer the world with rhythm and melody."

Bella is a Los Angeles based singer and songwriter. She describes her genre as Alternative Disco/Indie/90s Soul Pop. Her music is a mix of heart pumping beats, poisonous melody, and psychedelic lyrics. One of her original songs that she wrote at age 16, "My Way", was featured in a dance film, Make It Happen, and on a reality television series, Kimora: Life in the Fab Lane, which aired on E! Channel and Style Network. Her self-released debut single, "I'm Addicted", was featured on Leave It to Niecy on TLC. 

Bella was trained to play classical piano and harp at an early age, along with ballet, jazz, and tap dance classes, but she was heavily influenced by Pop Music in her early teens, so she started taking voice lessons and hip-hop dance classes. She started singing and writing songs at age 10, and collaborated with numerous songwriters and producers. She has performed at the The Bitter End (NYC), BMI Acoustic Lounge (LA), AMPLYFi, Celebrity Centre, House of Blues (Main Stage, Sunset Blvd., LA), Whisky A Go Go, and her most recent performance was at the Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum, where she performed her original song, "Saturday Night", in front of a 60,000 crowd. 

In 2015, she established her own independent record label and music publishing company, 90sKid Music, where she keeps a small number of employees in Los Angeles.

Short Summary

We are trying to raise money for our second self-release music video. 
If a company would like to sponsor us, please contact us directly at bellaofficialwebsite@gmail.com

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are trying to raise up to $10,000, which is the total cost to shoot the music video.
  • Travis Payne (Michael Jackson's choreographer) is our creative director/choreographer.
  • If we raise more than $10,000, we will donate for a good cause with proof.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Help spread the word out by sharing our campaign on social media.
  • Buy tickets for Bella's upcoming shows. http://www.eventbrite.com/e/bella-acousticnight-hob-parish-room-411-saturday-730pm-tickets-16375117417

story:
The Chicago-based  Werewheels consists of two dark cosmic forces: Plastic Crimewave aka Steve Krakow (Plastic Crimewave Syndicate/Sound, Secret History of Chicago Music, Galactic Zoo Dossier magazine, Guitarkestra, etc) and Dawn Aquarius (Herbcraft, Cursillistas, Brainshadows, Acid Ankh comics, etc). The duo opens clogged mind passages using guitars, keys, treated voices, and machines, creating a unique transcendent wall of sci-fried sounds--inspired by gnarly biker and horror film soundtracks, bad vibes krautrock, psychedelic synth-punk, and musical idols like Chrome, Suicide, Gong, 39 Clocks, La Dusseldorf and Cabaret Voltaire.
     Werewheels played a dream gig in London last summer with the god of hellfire, Arthur Brown, and legendary 70s pagan-folkers Comus--and in the windy city they have played at the Museum of Contemporary Art and at the University of Chicago). Also locally, WW has opened for a diverse array of artists like seasoned weirdos Ono and Vyto B, plus contemporary avant acts like Wrekmeister Harmonies and Pisspisspissmoanmoanmoan. After an appearance on the 2LP UK compilation "Death, Decay and Renewal" alongside luminaries like Edgar Broughton, Kawabata Makoto of Acid Mothers Temple, Mark Fry, Nick Garrie, Cherrystones, Alexander Tucker, etc, Werewheels recorded their 1st full-length LP, "Arcane Dimensions", this past winter at Hands of Hydra Studios, featuring a guest appearance from Jon Seagroatt of Comus/Red Square/Psychedelic Raiders.

      Plastic Crimewave and Dawn Aquarius will be doing a mixture of Werewheels musical performances to support the new album, and DJ sets of rare psych 45s for this Japan tour, which is June 13-29:
13. Tokyo with Electric Yeti (Tabata of Acid Mothers/Zeni Geva)
14. Yokohama--Werewheels set
19. Tokyo with DJ Yo Ishihara (White Heaven) DJ Masaya Nakahara (Violent Onsen Geisha)
20. Tokyo--DJ party
21. Kitakyushu--Werewheels and DJ set
22. Hiroshima--Werewheels and DJ set
23. Fukuoka--DJ set
24. Okayama--Werewheels and DJ set
25. Kobe with Acid Mothers Temple and The Silence, DJ set
26. Osaka with Acid Mothers Temple and The Silence , DJ set
27. Kobe--Werewheels set
28. Osaka--Werewheels set
      Also on this voyage, interviews have been secured with Takada Kiyohiro, the longest-running bassist of legendary underground band Les Rallizes Dénudés; Munehiro Narita, guitarist of punk-psych gods High Rise; You Ishihara of White Heaven, and if all goes well, Morgan Fisher of Mott The Hoople/British Lions (who knew he lived in Tokyo?) which will run in Plastic Crimewave's Galactic Zoo Dossier magazine, published by Drag City since 2001.
      Needless to say, this is going to be an costly endeavor. Werewheels is seeking just enough to cover basic travel costs, as payment for the gigs should take care of food, lodging, and additional transport to the interviews. $3700 will only be for the expenses of plane tickets and rail passes to get from show to show.

story:
We are an Afro-Carib band out of Toronto, Ontario raising money to complete our first full length album

WHAT WE DO

We hope to create an album that is unique, fresh, new and exciting for both listeners and musicians alike. We are planning on recording and releasing our first full-length album and need YOUR help to get it ready and into the hands and ears of our audiences. Of course, YOURS will be the first! This music will definitely grab ahold of you and keep you listening with its eclectic and engaging sounds.

After honing our musicality and creativity over the past two years, MoZayic is finally ready to share some of what we've worked so hard on for with you! Our first full-length album, Pelopidas Rhythms is a unique blend of Afro-Caribbean grooves mixed together with the soulful and intriguing melodies and harmonies created in part by each member of the band. How we got that title was a perfect story, one exclusively for our liner notes..

WHAT YOUR CONTRIBUTION MEANS

Your contributions will help us to share our music with as many ears as we can and bring our music closer to the world stage! Be a part of the journey and help us reach our goal! We are very grateful for your contributions and want you to know that every dollar means a whole lot to us!

With every dollar raised we will be closer to offsetting the cost of our pre-production and post-production expenses:

Studio time: $800

Producer fee: $350

Mixing fee: $400

Mastering fee: $400

CD creation and duplication: $400

Collaboration Fees for local artisans (album artwork, hand-crafted customized MoZayic merch items): Priceless....but probably somewhere around $400

Your contributions not only mean that you've helped in a vital way to create our debut album but you also get to take home a piece of MoZayic!

Nonetheless, we THANK YOU for your support.

story:
Who we are

We are, Rio & the Rockabilly Revival! An original spitfire roots rock and soul band from Detroit, known for our raw, old school sound, chock-full of sweat, guts and soul. Our live shows have been dubbed "The church of Rock & Roll" by critics and fans alike, steeped in the furor of an old southern "revival" tent where the "spirit" comes right up on you with all the sin, sweat and swagger of gritty rock & roll! 

We draw right from the early genres that came together to create what is known today as Rock & Roll: Swing, Country, Jump Blues, Gospel and Blues. It is our mission to honor the legacy built by early rock pioneers who relied solely on their skills and showmanship to whip a crowd into a frenzy. No lip-sync. No smoke and mirrors.  Just legit, from-the-gut music that satisfies both Americana purists as well as modern day rock & roll junkies! 

Our fearless front woman is Rio Scafone, niece of Rock & Roll pioneer, Jack Scott. Coming up under his musical wing, she was taught to respect real music played by real musicians along with the hard work that goes into a dynamic stage show. She learned those lessons well. It's part of her musical DNA. She runs a tight ship and makes no apology. That means, raw, pure vocals and tight harmonies free of auto tune and layers of effects. It means hands-on musicians who play every note and do not rely on programming, processing and samples. It means giving a full tilt, live show with rich vocals, choreography and pure rock & soul energy.  To us, that also means staying independent and not letting a record label dictate who or what we should be in some attempt to capitalize on the latest trends.  

We stand for real music for true music lovers who want more than the saccharine "product" of the day. 

And it works!

By working hard and staying true to our vision we have built a tight knit fan base and enjoy a wide cross section of fans who connect with our authentic approach. As a result we've struck a chord with music lovers and critics alike. We have three nominations this year for the upcoming Detroit Music Awards, in categories of Outstanding Live Performance, Outstanding Americana Artist/Group, and Rio Scafone as Outstanding Americana Vocalist. We won the title of Hour Detroit Magazine's Best Original Band for 2014, were in the Top 100 Live Unsigned Artists of 2014 by iconic Music Connection Magazine (Los Angeles), have been featured headline artists in music festivals, as well as the only musical act ever tapped for the Emmy Award winning Woodward Dream Cruise Television Special (ABC Television) - twice! Our list of outstanding reviews by the press is to long to list here (see more at our website www.rioandtherockabillyrevival.com). We've performed live on countless radio and television shows, have performed many sold out shows, and our music is played by DJs and fans around the world! 


We Need Your Help!

We've just wrapped recording on our much-anticipated third album, 'Testify,' and are chomping at the bit to share our new music with you! We are also booked on a mini European tour this summer which kicks off in Dublin, Ireland on July 4th in support of the album. 

This is where you come in! Our fans, deserve to have everything they ask for, including CD's and the option to own us on vinyl for the first time!  They also deserve to be able to see us live in quality venues as we tour to support the album! Even on a shoe-string budget, making all that a reality can be expensive for any indie band.  Part of belonging to the tribe of independent musicians is the challenge of covering the costs of delivering the music to the fans.  So, we are turning to you, the music lovers, to help us fund the completion of this album as well as off-set the costs of the tour in support of the album. We need to rally our "Revival Nation" of music lovers to help us make it all happen!   

Please, help fund our efforts.  Not only will you be allowing us to put out the best album we can, but you'll also assist us in bringing the RRR Crusade to new fans around the world; while making a statement about your commitment to authentic music!
THANK YOU!

2015 is a year that will be filled with big challenges for Rio and the Rockabilly Revival, but also a year of amazing opportunities and amazing music! Thank you for taking the time to check out our IndieGoGo campaign, and thank you so much for any way you can be a partner with us. We look forward to making music for you, and hopefully meeting each and every one of you in the near future!
story_txt:
Who we are
We are, Rio & the Rockabilly Revival! An original spitfire roots rock and soul band from Detroit, known for our raw, old school sound, chock-full of sweat, guts and soul. Our live shows have been dubbed "The church of Rock & Roll" by critics and fans alike, steeped in the furor of an old southern "revival" tent where the "spirit" comes right up on you with all the sin, sweat and swagger of gritty rock & roll! 
We draw right from the early genres that came together to create what is known today as Rock & Roll: Swing, Country, Jump Blues, Gospel and Blues. It is our mission to honor the legacy built by early rock pioneers who relied solely on their skills and showmanship to whip a crowd into a frenzy. No lip-sync. No smoke and mirrors.  Just legit, from-the-gut music that satisfies both Americana purists as well as modern day rock & roll junkies! 
Our fearless front woman is Rio Scafone, niece of Rock & Roll pioneer, Jack Scott. Coming up under his musical wing, she was taught to respect real music played by real musicians along with the hard work that goes into a dynamic stage show. She learned those lessons well. It's part of her musical DNA. She runs a tight ship and makes no apology. That means, raw, pure vocals and tight harmonies free of auto tune and layers of effects. It means hands-on musicians who play every note and do not rely on programming, processing and samples. It means giving a full tilt, live show with rich vocals, choreography and pure rock & soul energy.  To us, that also means staying independent and not letting a record label dictate who or what we should be in some attempt to capitalize on the latest trends.  
We stand for real music for true music lovers who want more than the saccharine "product" of the day. 


And it works!

By working hard and staying true to our vision we have built a tight knit fan base and enjoy a wide cross section of fans who connect with our authentic approach. As a result we've struck a chord with music lovers and critics alike. We have three nominations this year for the upcoming Detroit Music Awards, in categories of Outstanding Live Performance, Outstanding Americana Artist/Group, and Rio Scafone as Outstanding Americana Vocalist. We won the title of Hour Detroit Magazine's Best Original Band for 2014, were in the Top 100 Live Unsigned Artists of 2014 by iconic Music Connection Magazine (Los Angeles), have been featured headline artists in music festivals, as well as the only musical act ever tapped for the Emmy Award winning Woodward Dream Cruise Television Special (ABC Television) - twice! Our list of outstanding reviews by the press is to long to list here (see more at our website www.rioandtherockabillyrevival.com). We've performed live on countless radio and television shows, have performed many sold out shows, and our music is played by DJs and fans around the world! 

We Need Your Help!

We've just wrapped recording on our much-anticipated third album, 'Testify,' and are chomping at the bit to share our new music with you! We are also booked on a mini European tour this summer which kicks off in Dublin, Ireland on July 4th in support of the album. 
This is where you come in! Our fans, deserve to have everything they ask for, including CD's and the option to own us on vinyl for the first time!  They also deserve to be able to see us live in quality venues as we tour to support the album! Even on a shoe-string budget, making all that a reality can be expensive for any indie band.  Part of belonging to the tribe of independent musicians is the challenge of covering the costs of delivering the music to the fans.  So, we are turning to you, the music lovers, to help us fund the completion of this album as well as off-set the costs of the tour in support of the album. We need to rally our "Revival Nation" of music lovers to help us make it all happen!   
Please, help fund our efforts.  Not only will you be allowing us to put out the best album we can, but you'll also assist us in bringing the RRR Crusade to new fans around the world; while making a statement about your commitment to authentic music!

THANK YOU!


2015 is a year that will be filled with big challenges for Rio and the Rockabilly Revival, but also a year of amazing opportunities and amazing music! Thank you for taking the time to check out our IndieGoGo campaign, and thank you so much for any way you can be a partner with us. We look forward to making music for you, and hopefully meeting each and every one of you in the near future!

story:
THE PROJECT:

In 2013 I launched my EP "Nalithemba". It has been two years since that project, and since I took the leap and fully immersed myself in music as a full time singer/songwriter. The journey has been incredible, and so much growth has come since and from that EP, that I feel the time is right to share with you a full-length studio offering. I invite you to be a part of Zaneliza: How The Water Moves. 


WHAT HAS ALREADY BEEN DONE: 

The making of this album is almost complete and the music exists! Musicians, who are also dear friends of mine, joined me in my home town from different parts of the country to record the bulk of the album at the Miriam Makeba Performing Arts Centre (ECAVC), a place which has shown me much support and is very close to my heart. In December 2014, I began the recording process with a session at Peter Aurets studio. Three months later, we now have one more Joburg session left in order to add the last layer of flute, harp and cello. This campaign is mainly to bring to fruition what has been created, and to ensure great post- production takes place to honour the creativity that has already been shown. 

I have had the pleasure of working with a wonderful production team consting of Nduduzo Makhathini (Standard Bank Young Artist of the Year for Music 2015) and Cobus Van Dyk, who co-produced my EP "Nal'ithemba" with me. The amazing Gavan Eckhart of Soulfire studios will be mixing and mastering this album. He has worked with artists like Ray Phiri, Miriam Makeba, Lady Smith Black Mambazo, Marcus Wyatt, Freshly Ground and Bongeziwe Mabandla, to name a few, and has had projects that he has worked on be nominated for SAMAS and Grammies. This project is in good hands. 

This is a BIG vision,  and big visions require big funding. Recording an album is expensive. I have spent just over three beautiful years sharing my music and developing an audience for my sound. It seems that you are here, listening and responding, so I thought I would ask YOU to help me fund this dream which we have planned to launch on  25 September 2015.   


WHAT STILL NEEDS TO HAPPEN

All  money   raised   will   go   towards:   

* Mixing and Mastering

*  Print  and   Packaging of   albums  

*  Delivery of Albums and Art

* Marketing and PR support

* Most importantly paying the rest of the session fees

* Exhibition and Launch


THE MUSIC


The deluxe version of this album was recorded with emphasis on capturing the energy of multiple musicians in one room. We were more interested in the organic movement and development of the music than the perfect take. I have approached this album as a piece of art, allowing room for imperfection to ultimately add to the feel of the music and fearlessly and unapologetically capture my 'Now' sound. It is really a snapshot in time. 

We were not bound  by any conventional idea of what an album should sound like and instead approached it thematically as the unfolding of sonic art.The songs are vessels for messages and motifs, and the chords and melodies are the colours and textures. The sound is both old and new, symphonic and 'folky', soulful and simple, African and universal. 

I hope everyone can find their own unique ripple through it. This deluxe album is only available to the people that pre-order now and help finance the existence of this album. You are my Golden circle. I will be releasing a skinnier version of the album later in the year. 

 

THE DEAL 

Take a look at some examples of the beautiful offerings we have for you, in return for your contribution to bringing this vision to life. These artists are not short of bravery, sensitivity and honesty in the least. I have been moved by their work and they have spoken such kind encouragement into me at different times when I really needed some perspective and staying power. More importantly I believe there is synergy between our work and some space to play between the visual and the audio planes.  

One Shushu Day Handmade Dream Journals in assorted colours 


Kate  Arthur   (CPT)   painting  

  Original Watercolour on Canvas by Kate Arthur

Kate wants to engage you. She makes miniature works, usually portraits. Her references are usually taken from public spaces like social media. Allow her to stalk you and surprise you with an image of yourself. She has been part of several successful shows in Cape Town this year, including 'THAT ART FAIR' quite recently. She was also one of the first visual artist to have a city soiree event. Look out for her work in and around Cape Town. 


Emalie  Bingham   (CPT)   mixed   media  

  Original Oil on Canvas by Emalie Bingham 

Emalie is an Artist living and working in Cape Town, South Africa. She will be reacting-  to songs, to  feeling, to sound,  a word, a theme - anything triggered by the album and the making thereof, or conversation about and around it. A most intuitive worker whose work will be in all stages of this project. She made these three works to a song called 'Catalyst' on the project.  They are each available for $150.


Aiah Fodo (JHB) digital art

.Original Digitial Painting by Aiah Fodo 

 Aiah's main desire is to capture colour and experiment with varied forms of patterning and shading on the human facial matrix.  Her work is, within itself, an expression of human facial appreciation. She is member of Pretoria's Capital Arts Revolution and she is also contributing to the album art and her work will also be featured in the exhibition. These three works are available to anyone who contributes $150 to the album. 


Laduma Ngxokolo (Maxhosa by Laduma)

Laduma saw me in perfoming at the Opera house in PE and gravitated towards one of my songs called 'Imfama Ziyabona'. He said: " When you shoot that video, I want you to be wearing my clothes". Laduma Ngxokolo is a South African textile and knitwear designer, best known for his men's knitwear range inspired by traditional Xhosa beadwork, who beat out 10 other African designers to win the inaugural Vogue Scouting for Africa prize and will get a chance to present his designs at the international showcase of Palazzo Morando in Milan, Italy, in September and at the Africa International Fashion Week in Lagos, Nigeria in December.

He is offering one of his signature jerseys to anyone who pledges $250 towards my project. 


Andile Dyalvane (IMISO Ceramics)

Andile Dyalvane is the founder of Imiso Ceramics. He is a well traveled designer who prides himself in being South African, and presents that pride through his work at every opportunity. Clay gives him the ability to create something beautiful, valuable and usable with four elements of life: earth, water, and fire. He is creating two brand new pieces inspired and guided by two songs on the project, Golden and Selah. One of the works will be auctioned on the evening of the Zaneliza Launch Event, with another available to you as a perk for  $400.


OTHER   ARTISTS   CONTRIBUTING   TO  THIS   PROJECT 

INVOLVED MUSICALLY:


  • Nduduzo   Makhathini   (EL/ JB)  Producer 
  •  Cobus   Van   Dyk  (EL)   Producer  
  • Daniel   Hutchinson   (JHB)   Orchestration | piano     
  • Germaine  Gamiet   (EL)   keys   |   vocals   
  • David   Manchip   (EL)   electric   bass   
  • Asher   Gamedze   (CPT)   drums   
  • Tim   Hutchinson   (Zithulele)   saxophone   |  guitar   
  • Ella   Roselt  (CPT)   violin,   ukulele   |  vocals       
  • Sisa  Sopazi   (EL)   drums   
  • Thembinkosi  Mavimbela   (JHB)   upright   bass   
  • Gontse   Makhene  (JHB)  percussion   
  • Ilke Alexandra (JHB) flutes
  • Tsepo Pooe (JHB) Cello
  • Sophie Ribstein ( JHB) Harp 
  • Vuyo   Manyike   (JHB)   electric   bass   
  • Xolani   Faku   (PE)   trumpet,   |   vocals   
  • Joel  Karabo   Elliot   (SA|   USA)   trombone,   guitar,   vocals   
  • Cameron   Ward   (JHB)   guitars   
  • Nduduzo   Makhathini   (EL|   JHB)   piano   |  keyboards 
  • Feat  Umle   sounds   (PE)   vocals  | collabo   
  • East London mixed choir 
  • Keiskamma  music   academy   (HAMBURG   SA)  recorders
  • Msaki   (EL)   Vocals,   Guitars  


INVOLVED VISUALLY:

  

There is so much ugliness in the world and beauty is justice! We need to see beautiful, meaningful art. More than we think. We need it to poke us and stare us down and change the atmosphere in the spaces we occupy. I have long been searching for a meaningful and organic space between my visual and audio world. Learning to allow songs to begin as paintings and end up as songs: ideas which fail as a piece of street art, but thrive as a digital experiment. The song inspired by a knitted shawl, a pot that takes shape to the rhythm of an udu drum.  A piano solo dancing on the cusp of a single word. What a magical world! Could it be that we are all connected and drinking deep from the same well?   

The work of these artists will also be featured in the Zaneliza Exhibition | Launch.   

  • Tseliso   Monaheng     (JHB)   videography   |   photography     
  • Francios   Knoetze     (CPT)   sculpture   |   digital   art   
  • Khanyisa   Puwani   (EL)   clothing design  
  • Bunti Qina (EL) painting   
  • Ronny Asepang Walter Sisulu University Fashion Students (EL) clothing design
  • Tabiso  Njamela  (EL)   graphics  |   illustration    
  • Breeze   Yoko   (JHB)   videography     
  • Hayden  Plath   (JHB)   single  video   
  • Gabriel  Masango   (DBN)   dance   
  • Ababhemu Collective (DBN) various 
  • Asanda   Mvana  (EL)   curator   |  mixed   media     

   

"I  dream about being part of an artist community that avails resources, time and creativity to each other, to ensure that people can put work out when the time has come for them  to share. Your support affords us the freedom to express in unhindered ways, and for artists to navigate their careers organically, in healthy creative rhythms - what a  gift to be able to give to each other! Whatever you do for me on this project, I ask that you also please do it again for another." 

- Msaki
