story:
Short Summary

I would like help to design an app that upon the death of the user would send their loved ones the user's last wishes and information.

More Details

I have patented my app, but I need the funds to help create it!

My app would function as a notification service that upon the user’s death would send a message to the person’s loved ones.  The notification would have detailed and customized instructions for each recipient (for instance:  names and phone numbers of attorneys, life insurance companies, insurance policy numbers, location of important documents (wills, trusts, etc.), what assets each loved one should receive, burial instructions and the location of any boxes of stuff that should be thrown away before other loved ones might find them!, etc.). 

The app would function by sending periodic notifications to the user and when the user fails to respond after a preselected period of time, the app can send out a blast of emails and text messages to the user’s loved ones.  The app could also be linked to the user’s social media accounts (Facebook, Twitter, email, etc.) and could be triggered after the user fails to log into these accounts for a set period of time.  The app could also be programmed to sense the lack of motion of the phone for a certain period of time and then send out a message blast (useful if the user has a medical emergency or is lost or stranded somewhere).  Either a one-time fee or a monthly service fee could be charged to the customer for use of the app.

story:
Tres cosas que esta bueno saber: (These are the 3 things you need to know:) 

1. Nichi esta grabando su primer disco y empezando su carrera musical (Nichi is recording her first album of original songs!)

2. Lo va a grabar en Buenos Aires y va a estar producido por Emily Kate Boyd de Estados Unidos. (It will be recorded in Buenos Aires and produced by Emily Kate Boyd from USA)

3. Nichi necesita tu ayuda para poder hacer esto y solo tiene 21 días para juntar la plata para la producción y el diseño (She needs your support to make this happen and has only 21 days to raise the money for production and design.)

Si queres saber mas detalles, por favor fijate abajo: (If you'd like to know more of the details, please see below)

Resumido por Nichi

  • Tengo 22 años y vivo en Hurlingham, Buenos Aires. Desde muy chiquita me empecé a relacionar con la música tocando distintos instrumentos y cantando, pero hace muy poco que empecé a mostrarlo.  
  • Dos oportunidades increíbles aparecieron este año: Grabar mi primer disco e irme a tocar a Estados Unidos. Sería muchísimo más que muy lindo para mi poder contar con la ayuda de ustedes para concretar lo que se me presentó. 
  • La magnitud de poder hacer esto es sinceramente increíble. Es nada menos que cumplir mi sueño.

Lo que necesito para cumplirlo:

  • Necesito que me ayuden a conseguir 2000 dólares para grabar, producir, diseñar e imprimir los discos. 
  • Además de hacerme feliz ayudándome a concretar mi proyecto, está bueno que yo de algo a cambio asi que estuve pensando en retribuir su ayuda y dar a cambio distintas cosas.
  • Si no logro el objetivo, cosa que felizmente dudo porque ustedes son lo más, lo recaudado va a ir a poder hacer mi pagina web.

Desafios

  • Muchos de ustedes saben lo que significa para mi la música. No pasa un día en el que no toque por lo menos un acorde. Mi objetivo más importante es poder llevar a cabo este proyecto. 

Otras formas que tienen de ayudarme

  • Seguramente no todos puedan ayudarme de una forma económica, pero eso no quiere decir que no tengan formas de darme una mano. Por ejemplo pueden ayudarme a compartir este proyecto! :)
story_txt:
Tres cosas que esta bueno saber: (These are the 3 things you need to know:) 
1. Nichi esta grabando su primer disco y empezando su carrera musical (Nichi is recording her first album of original songs!)
2. Lo va a grabar en Buenos Aires y va a estar producido por Emily Kate Boyd de Estados Unidos. (It will be recorded in Buenos Aires and produced by Emily Kate Boyd from USA)
3. Nichi necesita tu ayuda para poder hacer esto y solo tiene 21 días para juntar la plata para la producción y el diseño (She needs your support to make this happen and has only 21 days to raise the money for production and design.)
Si queres saber mas detalles, por favor fijate abajo: (If you'd like to know more of the details, please see below)

story:
LET METAL DO THE TALKING!
Thank you for stopping by. Before we launched this page we wanted you to hear one of our songs from our upcoming album "Chariots of Fire". We think that if you like this single you will be eager to hear the other songs and help us.

So, here is a sneak peek. We are very excited to share this title song with you!  "Chariots of Fire".

Kyle, Tim,  Josh, and I (Loic) hope you liked our single and think that our music is worth your donation. Give what you can, no amount is too small! If you can't give, you can still help! Get the word out! Share our songs, photos, videos, make comments, send out a link to this campaign page to your friends, invite people to like our Facebook page, on Instagram, Twitter, and other social media. Come to our next Lord Marshall show, bring a friend! Come say 'Hi'. We want to meet you! The people who matter the most. The true metal fans that keeps bands alive!

WHAT WE HAVE DONE.    
Lord Marshall is a Progressive Thrash Metal band that has been around the Los Angeles Metal scene since 2009. The band released an EP titled "Event Horizon" and a music video for the song "Custom Fast Fire" in 2010. Lord Marshall has been playing countless shows and sharing the stage with local and international acts, testing the songs to different crowds while writing new material. 

"Lord Marshall is a stellar guitar player, one of the best I’ve ever had the privilege of seeing live. I remember going wide eyed as he shredded solo after solo and thinking that he could easily stand his ground with some of the truly great guitar players.”

                                                                  Show review   Tyler Griffith, SRO Magazine inc.

"I witnessed Lord Marshall live a few weeks ago and was absolutely floored. They were aggressive yet never lost touch of melody."                                                                                                                                                                   Bruce Forest, Braigell Radio.    

HORNS UP TO OUR GOAL.                                                                                                   We are trying to raise $10,000 which will cover all final cost of recording, mixing, mastering, CD hard case production and, the perks we offer. Everyone who donates a minimum of a $100 will have their name on the album which will be released in 2016.

WHY SHOULD YOU HELP US?                                                                                             As we speak we are finishing another single called "Krampus". We are trying to release the song before Christmas to scare all the children...   


Don't you want to scare all the children?

ANOTHER REASON FOR HELPING.                                                                                  "Chariots of Fire" is going to be a great album! You and your friends can look back and say, "Yeah, I was part of that project from the start!"                                           And there will be your name on the album to prove it!

HOW MUCH HAVE WE SPENT?                                                                                               So far we have spent close to $9000.00. Hiring good, experienced producers and engineers is not free! All the fire in hell burned our cash. The 11 songs were recorded and will be mixed by Chris Rakestraw and mastered by Matt Hyde. Two big names in the Heavy Metal industry who have previously worked with Megadeth, Slayer, Soulfly, Deftone, and more...

YOUR DONATION.                                                                                                                Here is how the money will be spent. We may be updating this as we go along just to keep things current.

COSTS:

Mixing $4,000

Mastering $1,100

1500 Hard Case CD  $1,800

Artwork $500

Advertising campaign $500

Perks for fans(T-Shirts, Hat) $1,300

Indiegogo fee (4%) from $376

Paypal (5%) from $470

                                                                                                                           Net $10,000

We can't wait to finish "Chariots of Fire" and mail you the CD along with many other perks!

Lord Marshall/Loic, Kyle, Josh, and Tim hope you will choose to be part of this project.

\M/ \M/

story:
Who are we and why we're here?

Evil Genius represents the unlikely fusion of three musicians (two from Los Angeles and one from Brooklyn) who met while attending California Institute of the Arts. The group assembled during the winter of 2012. We are Max Kutner (The Grandmothers of Invention, Bubbeleh, The Royal US, The Magic Band), Stefan Kac (Ingo Bethke, Milo Fine Free Jazz Ensemble, Hammerstein Musik Bavaria) and Michael "Bonepocket" Lockwood (Stupid Man Suit, Teebs, Atomic Ape, Michael Mull 8tet).

That's right. Guitar, drums and tuba. But not just any guitar. Not just any drums. And definitely not just any tuba.

The intention of the group is explore the farthest flung musical liberties within the restrictions of both sparse instrumentation and minimally structured compositions written by any of its members. At the same time, this music can and should be approached by anyone.

After 2 years of gestation, the band has recorded its debut album entitled "Bitter Human". There are ten completely original tracks for your listening pleasure on this album. Orenda Records will be our most gracious host for the project as well and this document will provide the basis for tours to follow later this year. We've been fortunate enough to make it through the tracking and post-production process totally on our own.

We're here to ask for your support in funding the final stage of this process: printing. Your contributions will help fund the design of our album packaging and also provide for the printing of 500 copies of "Bitter Human" which will go to listeners, reviewers, promoters and our families. We feel very strongly about the quality of music presented here and feel that the album deserves a proper pressing and presentation to compliment those songs. This is where you guys come in and there are some absurdly awesome perks for your donations.

Baby, baby breakdown.

The amount we are asking for is $3,000 and breaks down thus:

  • $1900 - Pressing of 500 CDs of "Bitter Human" in a 6-panel digipak with art by Vanessa Himeles and designs by Eron Rauch.
  • $700 - Mailing and promotional costs to worldwide radio, print and other media outlets.
  • $200 - Eron Rauch's design.
  • $200 - IndieGogo processing fees.

As I mentioned in the beginning, we have a bevy of assorted perks and rewards for your contributions to this process. Stuff ranging from downloads to physical cds, cds/dvds from any of our other projects, cooked goods, scrabble/golf/html lessons, production credits and even a miniature piece of midi music written by a member of your choice and dedicated to you!

Absolutely none of the funds will go toward superfluous use. We use all of the animal.

Giant thumbprint.

This music is completely original, written especially for Evil Genius by members of the band. It does not cater to the needs of a movement, style clique or higher authority. It operates based from the fractured logic and particular tastes of its members. In other words, it is kinda like orange chicken sauteed with pizza sauce covered in honey and served over rocky road ice cream. Why not?

Recordings and projects from each member of the band have been heard and liked all over the world by an enormous swath of people listening from all sorts of backgrounds and bases. By donating to our cause, you will in turn be supporting the creation and documentation of new music. From 1 dollar and up, you will be an invaluable part of this process.

    A game of risk.

    Evil Genius fully acknowledges the possibility that it may take awhile for "Bitter Human" to reach the people it needs to and that the world is certainly not short on musicians looking for support.

    What is guaranteed is our end of the deal. The CDs will be pressed and mailed with this money and on time as well. The perks will be executed --- that sounds funny, right --- in a timely fashion. 

    Also, we're never let time or odds deter us from our path. This WILL be happening. The push will occur from all sides regardless.

      If you can't lend a hand, lend a tongue.

      Evil Genius fully acknowledges that even though millions of people will doubtlessly be intrigued by our campaign, many will be unable to donate in the form of crispy monies...BUT...

      Anyone can tell their friends, family, co-worker, parole officer, mistress, waitress, local congressmen (and women), fire brigade, nursing home, community rec center, church youth organization, mid-day class, pet, sporting team, themselves, stuffed animal, union, physician, mechanic or administrative assistant to check out this page and either donate or share using the Indiegogo share tools and other social media sites

        And that's all there is to it.

story:
Teşekkürler...

Düzenlediğimiz kampanyayla internet üzerinden ve yüz yüze ulaştığımız yüzlerce insan destek verdi. İstanbul'da düzenlenen resital ve İndiegogo'daki kampanya ile arp için gereken tutarın 2/5'ini toplamayı başardık. Aydın Doğan Vakfı ise kalan tutarı karşıladı. Ve Merve arpına kavuştu!

Destek veren herkese teşekkür ederiz.

http://www.hurriyet.com.tr/kelebek/keyif/28747870.asp

https://www.kanald.com.tr/ana-haber-bulteni/ozel-klipler/arpist-merve-kocabeylerin-basari-oykusu


Thanks...

Hundreds of people whom we reached online and face-to-face responded respectfully. With the recital in Istanbul and this Indiegogo campaign, we gathered 2/5 of the amount we needed. Aydın Doğan Foundation covered the rest. And Merve met her harp!

Thanks to all supporters.


(Click here for English version)

Kampanya Hakkında

Merve Kocabeyler henüz 24 yaşında ve çok önemli başarılara imza atmış bir arpist. Bugüne dek katıldığı yarışmalara kendine ait bir arpı olmadan, okullardaki kısıtlı çalışma sürelerini kullanarak hazırlandı ve üç kez birincilik kazandı!

Gurur kaynağımız olan Merve, Amsterdam Konservatuvarı'nda burslu olarak sürdürdüğü yüksek lisans çalışmalarını tamamlamak üzere. Profesyonel yaşama atıldığı bu önemli dönemde kendine ait bir enstrümana ihtiyacı var.

Merve'nin artık kendi arpı olsun istiyoruz!



Hedefimiz

Merve'nin ihtiyacı olan Lyon&Healy yapımı arpı satın almak ve Türkiye'ye getirmek için €35.600 gerekli. Internet üzerinden başlattığımız destek kampanyası bu miktarı toplamak için giriştiğimiz çabanın bir parçası.

Genç arpistimizin 23 Şubat akşamı Caddebostan Kültür Merkezi'nde verdiği arp resitalinde ona destek olmak isteyen sanatseverler 5.600TL bağışta bulundu. Bu resitalle ilgili CNN Türk'te yayınlanan haber için tıklayın.

Merve'nin daha çok konser verebilmesi, yurtdışında ülkemizi temsil etmeye devam edebilmesi için sevenleri olarak onu çok hak ettiği enstrümanına kavuşturmak istiyoruz. Sizin de desteğinizi bekliyoruz.




Nasıl Destek Olabilirsiniz

İnternet üzerinden düzenlenen bu kampanyaya çok basit birkaç adımda siz de destek verebilirsiniz. Bunun için kredi kartınızı veya Paypal hesabınızı kullanabilirsiniz.

  • Sağ sütundaki küçük hediyelerimizden birisine tıklayın,
  • Veya yine sağ sütundaki "Contribute Now" butonuna tıklayın, açılan sayfadaki kutucuğa destekte bulunmak istediğiniz miktarı yazın (elbette istediğiniz tutarı yazmakta özgürsünüz),
  • "Continue To Payment" butonuna tıklayın ve açılan sayfada kredi kartı veya Paypal'la bilgilerinizi girin,
  • Hediyenizi size ulaştırabilmemiz için iletişim bilgilerinizi yazdıktan sonra işlemi tamamlayın.

Kampanya hakkında daha fazla bilgi almak ve başka yollardan destekte bulunmak için 0 544 411 80 69 numaralı telefondan bize ulaşabilirsiniz.

Bu kampanyayı daha fazla insana ulaştırabilmemiz için Twitter, Facebook, email vb. üzerinden www.igg.me/at/genc-arpist adresini arkadaşlarınızla paylaşırsanız çok seviniriz.


Merve Hakkında

2012 Donizetti Klasik Müzik Ödülleri’nde “Yılın Çıkış Yapan Genç Müzisyeni” seçilen ve bir çok uluslararası yarışmada birincilikler kazanan Merve Kocabeyler, Türkiye’nin gelecek vaad eden genç arpistleri arasında yer almaktadır.

4 Kasım 1990’da İstanbul’da doğan Kocabeyler, arp çalışmalarına 11 yaşında Yonca Özkan Bilenoğlu ile başladı ve lise eğitimini İstanbul Üniversitesi Devlet Konservatuvarı’nda tamamladı. 2009’da tam burslu olarak kabul edildiği Salzburg Mozarteum Üniversitesi’nde Prof. Helga Storck ve Prof. Stephen Fitzpatrick ile çalışarak lisans diplomasını aldı. 

Avrupa’da sürdürdüğü eğitimi boyunca layık görüldüğü uluslararası ödüller arasında, 2012’de “Citta di Cagliari Uluslararası Arp Yarışması”nda birincilik, 2011’de “Petar Konjovic Uluslararası Arp Yarışması”nda birincilik, 2010’da “Szeged Uluslararası Arp Yarışması”nda birincilik, Viyana’da “Franz Josef Reinl Uluslararası Arp Yarışması”nda üçüncülük, 2009’da “Uluslararası Genç Virtüözler Yarışması”nda ikincilik ödülleri bulunmaktadır.

Isabelle Moretti, Marisa Robles, Elisabeth Fontan-Binoche, Elinor Bennett, Fabrice Pierre, Benoit Wery, Marie-Pierre Langlamet gibi dünyaca ünlü arpistlerle, uluslararası müzik akademilerinde burslu olarak çalışma imkanı bulan Kocabeyler, ayrıca Salzburg’da değerli lavta sanatçısı Hans Brüderl ile barok repertuvar üzerine çalışmalarda bulunmuştur.

Orkestra ile ilk konserini 17 yaşında, İstanbul Üniversitesi Senfoni Orkestrası eşliğinde, Mozart’ın Flüt Arp Konçertosu ile veren sanatçı, daha sonra Türkiye’de Antalya Devlet Senfoni Orkestrası, Bursa Bölge Devlet Senfoni Orkestrası ve Kanada’da Vancouver Senfoni Orkestrası gibi orkestralar eşliğinde solist olarak konserler vermiştir.  

Avrupa’nın bir çok ülkesinde olduğu gibi, Asya, Kuzey ve Latin Amerika’da da konserler veren genç arpist, 2011’de Vancouver’da düzenlenen Dünya Arp Kongresi’nin “Focus on Youth” adlı konser serisine seçilerek Türkiye’yi temsil etmiştir. Hemen ardından ise genç yıldız başlığı altında Belgrad Uluslararası Arp Festivali’nde resital vermiştir.

Çağdaş Eğitim Vakfı tarafından desteklenen sanatçı, bugüne dek Doğuş Çocuk Senfoni Orkestrası, Ulusal Gençlik Senfoni Orkestrası, Kanada’da Pasifik Senfoni Orkestrası, Brezilya’da Santa Catarina Müzik Festivali Senfoni Orkestrası gibi orkestraların arp grup şefliğini yapmıştır. Ayrıca Salzburg Filarmoni Orkestrası’nın konserlerinde düzenli olarak yer almaktadır.

2009’dan beri Yehudi Menuhin Live Music Now Derneği aracılığıyla, Salzburg’da düzenli olarak solo konserler vermekte olan Merve Kocabeyler, 2013’te tam burslu olarak kabul edildiği Amsterdam Konservatuvarı’nda master çalışmalarını Prof. Erika Waardenburg ile sürdürmekte olup, Eczacıbaşı Vakfı Müzik Bursu ile desteklenmektedir.

Merve'nin bugüne dek kazandığı ödüller:

  • 2012’de Citta di Cagliari Uluslararası Arp Yarışması’nda birincilik,
  • 2011’de Petar Konjovic Uluslararası Arp Yarışması’nda birincilik,
  • 2010’da Szeged Uluslararası Arp Yarışması’nda birincilik,
  • 2010'da Viyana F. J. Reinl Uluslararası Arp Yarışması’nda üçüncülük,
  • 2009’da Uluslararası Genç Virtüözler Yarışması’nda ikincilik



About the Campaign


We would like to help Merve to buy a harp!

Merve Kocabeyler, who is only 24, is a young and highly promising harpist with many accomplishments. In the competitions she has participated so far, she achieved amazing results and got the 1st place in three different organizations despite not having a harp and preparing for competitions in schools that provided her with limited sources and practice hours. Merve is currently finishing her Master’s in Amsterdam Conservatory and she needs an instrument of her own in this crucial phase of her life where she is transitioning into a professional career. And we want to make her dream come true!

Our Goal

Our aim is to raise €35.600 to buy a Lyon & Healy brand harp and ship it to Turkey for Merve. The crowdfunding project we started online is a way to accomplish this goal. In our young harpist’s recital in Caddebostan Cultural Center on February 23rd, art lovers donated an amount of 5.600TL (2200$) for her cause. You can click here for more information about this recital that was broadcast on CNN Turk.
 

For Merve to be able to give more concerts, and represent Turkey abroad, we would like to help her by raising enough funds to buy her the well-deserved instrument. We would very much appreciate your help as well. Please help us spread the word by sharing this crowdfunding project (www.igg.me/at/genc-arpist) on Twitter, Facebook, or via email. Thank you!


From the recital in Caddebostan Cultural Center on February 23rd


About Merve

Hailed as “Young Musician of the Year” in 2012 by Andante Magazine’s “Donizetti Classical Music Awards” and the first prize winner of many international harp competitions, Merve Kocabeyler, is one of the young and promising harpists of Turkey.

Born November 4th, 1990, in Istanbul, Merve began studying harp at the age of 11 with Yonca Ozkan Bilenoglu and completed her pre-college studies with her at the State Conservatory of Istanbul University. In 2009, she was admitted into the class of Prof. Helga Storck at the Mozarteum University of Salzburg in Austria and completed her bachelor’s degree studies there with Prof. Stephen Fitzpatrick.

During her studies in Europe she won awards in several international competitions, including the first prize in the “Citta di Cagliari International Harp Competition” in Italy in 2012, the first prize in the “Petar Konjovic International Harp Competition” in Serbia in 2011, the first prize in the “International Harp Competition of Szeged” in Hungary in 2010, the third prize in the “Franz Josef Reinl International Harp Competition” in Vienna in 2010, and the second prize in the “International Young Virtuosos Competition” in Sofia in 2009.

Having studied baroque repertoire with lute player Hans Brüderl in Salzburg, Merve has participated in masterclasses with distinguished harpists such as Isabelle Moretti, Marisa Robles, Elisabeth Fontan-Binoche, Elinor Bennett, Fabrice Pierre, Benoit Wery, Marie-Pierre Langlamet, and Rita Costanzi at several international music academies with scholarships.

After her solo debut at the age of 17, playing Mozart’s Concerto for Flute and Harp with the Symphony Orchestra of Istanbul University, she has performed as a soloist with the orchestras such as Antalya State Symphony Orchestra, Bursa State Symphony Orchestra and Vancouver Symphony Orchestra.

She has given concerts all over the Europe, as well as in Asia, North and Latin America. In 2011, Merve was chosen to perform in the “Focus on Youth” concerts at the World Harp Congress in Vancouver. In 2012, she gave a recital as a “young star” at the Belgrade International Harp Festival.

She was the principal harpist of the National Youth Symphony Orchestra of Turkey, Symphony Orchestra Academy of the Pacific of Canada, Santa Catarina Music Festival Orchestra of Brazil and has regularly been invited to play with Salzburg Philharmonic Orchestra.

A scholar of Modern Education Foundation, Yehudi Menuhin Live Music Now Foundation and Eczacibasi Foundation, Merve Kocabeyler is currently studying with Erika Waardenburg for master’s degree at the Amsterdam Conservatory.
story_txt:
Teşekkürler...
Düzenlediğimiz kampanyayla internet üzerinden ve yüz yüze ulaştığımız yüzlerce insan destek verdi. İstanbul'da düzenlenen resital ve İndiegogo'daki kampanya ile arp için gereken tutarın 2/5'ini toplamayı başardık. Aydın Doğan Vakfı ise kalan tutarı karşıladı. Ve Merve arpına kavuştu!Destek veren herkese teşekkür ederiz.http://www.hurriyet.com.tr/kelebek/keyif/28747870.asphttps://www.kanald.com.tr/ana-haber-bulteni/ozel-klipler/arpist-merve-kocabeylerin-basari-oykusuThanks...
Hundreds of people whom we reached online and face-to-face responded respectfully. With the recital in Istanbul and this Indiegogo campaign, we gathered 2/5 of the amount we needed. Aydın Doğan Foundation covered the rest. And Merve met her harp!Thanks to all supporters.(Click here for English version)
Kampanya Hakkında
Merve Kocabeyler henüz 24 yaşında ve çok önemli başarılara imza atmış bir arpist. Bugüne dek katıldığı yarışmalara kendine ait bir arpı olmadan, okullardaki kısıtlı çalışma sürelerini kullanarak hazırlandı ve üç kez birincilik kazandı!
Gurur kaynağımız olan Merve, Amsterdam Konservatuvarı'nda burslu olarak sürdürdüğü yüksek lisans çalışmalarını tamamlamak üzere. Profesyonel yaşama atıldığı bu önemli dönemde kendine ait bir enstrümana ihtiyacı var. 
Merve'nin artık kendi arpı olsun istiyoruz! 

Hedefimiz
Merve'nin ihtiyacı olan Lyon&Healy yapımı arpı satın almak ve Türkiye'ye getirmek için €35.600 gerekli. Internet üzerinden başlattığımız destek kampanyası bu miktarı toplamak için giriştiğimiz çabanın bir parçası.
Genç arpistimizin 23 Şubat akşamı Caddebostan Kültür Merkezi'nde verdiği arp resitalinde ona destek olmak isteyen sanatseverler 5.600TL bağışta bulundu. Bu resitalle ilgili CNN Türk'te yayınlanan haber için tıklayın.
Merve'nin daha çok konser verebilmesi, yurtdışında ülkemizi temsil etmeye devam edebilmesi için sevenleri olarak onu çok hak ettiği enstrümanına kavuşturmak istiyoruz. Sizin de desteğinizi bekliyoruz.




Nasıl Destek Olabilirsiniz
İnternet üzerinden düzenlenen bu kampanyaya çok basit birkaç adımda siz de destek verebilirsiniz. Bunun için kredi kartınızı veya Paypal hesabınızı kullanabilirsiniz.

Sağ sütundaki küçük hediyelerimizden birisine tıklayın,
Veya yine sağ sütundaki "Contribute Now" butonuna tıklayın, açılan sayfadaki kutucuğa destekte bulunmak istediğiniz miktarı yazın (elbette istediğiniz tutarı yazmakta özgürsünüz),
"Continue To Payment" butonuna tıklayın ve açılan sayfada kredi kartı veya Paypal'la bilgilerinizi girin,
Hediyenizi size ulaştırabilmemiz için iletişim bilgilerinizi yazdıktan sonra işlemi tamamlayın.

Kampanya hakkında daha fazla bilgi almak ve başka yollardan destekte bulunmak için 0 544 411 80 69 numaralı telefondan bize ulaşabilirsiniz.
Bu kampanyayı daha fazla insana ulaştırabilmemiz için Twitter, Facebook, email vb. üzerinden www.igg.me/at/genc-arpist adresini arkadaşlarınızla paylaşırsanız çok seviniriz.

Merve Hakkında

2012
Donizetti Klasik Müzik Ödülleri’nde “Yılın Çıkış Yapan Genç Müzisyeni” seçilen
ve bir çok uluslararası yarışmada birincilikler kazanan Merve Kocabeyler,
Türkiye’nin gelecek vaad eden genç arpistleri arasında yer almaktadır.
4
Kasım 1990’da İstanbul’da doğan Kocabeyler, arp çalışmalarına 11 yaşında Yonca
Özkan Bilenoğlu ile başladı ve lise eğitimini İstanbul Üniversitesi Devlet
Konservatuvarı’nda tamamladı. 2009’da tam burslu olarak kabul edildiği Salzburg
Mozarteum Üniversitesi’nde Prof. Helga Storck ve Prof. Stephen Fitzpatrick ile
çalışarak lisans diplomasını aldı.  
Avrupa’da
sürdürdüğü eğitimi boyunca layık görüldüğü uluslararası ödüller arasında,
2012’de “Citta di Cagliari Uluslararası Arp Yarışması”nda birincilik, 2011’de “Petar
Konjovic Uluslararası Arp Yarışması”nda birincilik, 2010’da “Szeged
Uluslararası Arp Yarışması”nda birincilik, Viyana’da “Franz Josef Reinl
Uluslararası Arp Yarışması”nda üçüncülük, 2009’da “Uluslararası Genç Virtüözler
Yarışması”nda ikincilik ödülleri bulunmaktadır.
Isabelle
Moretti, Marisa Robles, Elisabeth Fontan-Binoche, Elinor Bennett, Fabrice
Pierre, Benoit Wery, Marie-Pierre Langlamet gibi dünyaca ünlü arpistlerle,
uluslararası müzik akademilerinde burslu olarak çalışma imkanı bulan Kocabeyler,
ayrıca Salzburg’da değerli lavta sanatçısı Hans Brüderl ile barok repertuvar üzerine
çalışmalarda bulunmuştur.
Orkestra
ile ilk konserini 17 yaşında, İstanbul Üniversitesi Senfoni Orkestrası
eşliğinde, Mozart’ın Flüt Arp Konçertosu ile veren sanatçı, daha sonra Türkiye’de
Antalya Devlet Senfoni Orkestrası, Bursa Bölge Devlet Senfoni Orkestrası ve Kanada’da
Vancouver Senfoni Orkestrası gibi orkestralar eşliğinde solist olarak konserler
vermiştir.  
Avrupa’nın
bir çok ülkesinde olduğu gibi, Asya, Kuzey ve Latin Amerika’da da konserler
veren genç arpist, 2011’de Vancouver’da düzenlenen Dünya Arp Kongresi’nin “Focus
on Youth” adlı konser serisine seçilerek Türkiye’yi temsil etmiştir. Hemen ardından
ise genç yıldız başlığı altında Belgrad Uluslararası Arp Festivali’nde resital
vermiştir.
Çağdaş
Eğitim Vakfı tarafından desteklenen sanatçı, bugüne dek Doğuş Çocuk Senfoni
Orkestrası, Ulusal Gençlik Senfoni Orkestrası, Kanada’da Pasifik Senfoni
Orkestrası, Brezilya’da Santa Catarina Müzik Festivali Senfoni Orkestrası gibi
orkestraların arp grup şefliğini yapmıştır. Ayrıca Salzburg Filarmoni
Orkestrası’nın konserlerinde düzenli olarak yer almaktadır.
2009’dan
beri Yehudi Menuhin Live Music Now Derneği aracılığıyla, Salzburg’da düzenli
olarak solo konserler vermekte olan Merve Kocabeyler, 2013’te tam burslu olarak
kabul edildiği Amsterdam Konservatuvarı’nda master çalışmalarını Prof. Erika
Waardenburg ile sürdürmekte olup, Eczacıbaşı Vakfı Müzik Bursu ile
desteklenmektedir.


Merve'nin bugüne dek kazandığı ödüller:

2012’de Citta di Cagliari Uluslararası Arp Yarışması’nda birincilik,
2011’de Petar Konjovic Uluslararası Arp Yarışması’nda birincilik,
2010’da Szeged Uluslararası Arp Yarışması’nda birincilik,
2010'da Viyana F. J. Reinl Uluslararası Arp Yarışması’nda üçüncülük,
2009’da Uluslararası Genç Virtüözler Yarışması’nda ikincilik

story:
Hi, my name is Desovia and I am a worship leader at Christ Community Church in Camp Hill, PA and I also travel with Power and Love Ministries.
I am so thrilled to be on this journey to record these songs that God has put on my heart. Most of these songs were birthed out of hardship and unpredictable circumstances yet the common thread throughout will be HIS worth and sovereignty.  All of the situations and details of life must pale in comparison to Jesus and the way to a victorious life is to simply look into his face. This is what these songs will echo.... Looking at life through the eyes of Jesus instead of the eyes of our circumstances. Hope is alive. Hope is Jesus. Hope is NOW.
Your contributions will help me to get this CD project from a dream into a reality. 
Thank you in advance for your generosity and support.

story:
Performance

Indonesian Kids Performing Arts (IKPA) is presenting The Colors of Indonesia 2015 - Mudik Yuukk!!, a musical drama performance played mostly by Indonesian youths. 

The story is about an Indonesian family who  travels to Java, Madura and Sumatra Islands of Indonesia for summer vacation. The parents would like to show their son and daughter the cultural richness of people living in those  islands.

Background

IKPA is a nonprofit organization established in January 2010 by members of the Indonesian community residing in the Washington D.C. metropolitan area. It is a cultural orchestra that has a mission of supporting the character development and musical education of Indonesian children. The organization is open to those who were born in the United States, as well as those who have moved here. The musicians of IKPA consist of students ranging from elementary school to high school. By participating in IKPA's musical activities, it is expected that the children will have a positive experience and will be taught discipline and manners which is a key character during training sessions.

From its beginnings until today as a musical ensemble, the Indonesian Kids Performing Arts (IKPA) has moved within the artistic circles of Washington D.C., giving performances with the goal of raising awareness of the beauty of Indonesia. As a result of devoting their time and talent to practices every weekend, the musicians of IKPA actively contribute to the success of many cultural programs presented by the Indonesian community and by the Embassy of Indonesia in Washington, DC. These programs include performing for diplomatic receptions within the embassy, the annual August 17 Independence Day ceremony at the ambassador's residence, and cultural productions for the general public. 

IKPA has also been engaged in many activities connected with humanitarian programs. Proceeds beyond its expenditures were donated to the nonprofit organizations of "Hope 4 Our Children" and "Indonesian Relief"*. In this performance, 1$ from each ticket sale will be donated to "Hope 4 Our Children". IKPA will continue supporting nonprofit organizations and developments through these donations.

In order for IKPA to further its mission, we need the support of the community now more than ever to reach our goal.  With your help, IKPA will ensure that the next generation of Indonesian children within the DC metro area are knowledgeable and proud of their roots. We want IKPA to continue running for years to come and serve as a space for Indonesian children to showcase their talents, while also sharing their heritage with the DC community. Your contribution will go towards production and venue costs for future performances. Any amount is greatly appreciated.

Thank you.

story:
AxeFxTutorials.com can help you with your AX8

Fractal Audio will soon be releasing a brand new product, the AX8. If you are familiar with the Axe-Fx, the AX8 will be an all-in-one amp modeler with effects within a pedalboard, like merging the Axe-Fx II and MFC-101 into a single unit.  

Chris of AxeFxTutorials.com has been helping people for years with their Axe-Fx IIs and other Fractal Audio products.  All current gear (music gear, cameras, computers, websites, etc.) has been personally financed.  This time Chris needs your help to get his hands on the AX8 when it is released.   

AxeFxTutorials.com features a website with articles, FAQs and videos on product specifics, as well as a live text chat and live video stream available for teaching or troubleshooting.  We recently launched our own forum for personalized attention to questions of any experience level. 

What We Need

The AX8 is certain to be a very popular product, bringing many new customers coming to the Fractal Audio "family." There has been no release date set and also no price announced at this time.  A similar product, the FX8, is currently on waiting list and priced at $1349.95.

Fractal Audio has stated the AX8 will be "priced aggressively," and many familiar with Fractal products have estimated the price to be somewhere between $999 and $1999.  

This campaign is set for $2000, just in case the price is at the upper end of the estimate. I want to be clear: this campaign is set so that any funds raised will be kept, even if the goal is not met.  Other fundraising sites return the funds if the goal is not met. Again, AxeFxTutorials.com will be keeping any funds raised.

Any and all funds gathered during this campaign will be used specifically for the purpose of purchasing an AX8 unit once it becomes available.  If the campaign happens to raise more than the $2000 goal, all funds will be put toward development of AxeFxTutorials.com in general.  We would also like to get an FX8, Axe-Fx II XL+ and MFC-101 MK III in the future, in addition to any other new products from Fractal Audio Systems.  

Funds raised over the $2000 goal will also help Chris and other possible future team members to dedicate more time to the website and helping people with their gear.  

Funds can be contributed via Credit Card and PayPal.

Help Us Help You (and others)

The concept of AxeFxTutorials.com was formerly a small section of Chris' company, Katsu Kuri Media.  Initially just helping people on the FAS Official Forum, Chris started creating tutorial videos which became very popular.  This led to doing private consultations and building a live web chat as well as a live video/audio stream on his website. AxeFxTutorials.com has recently launched their own forum as well to help keep the focus on troubleshooting and problem solving rather than general discussion.

Majority of the current funding for the site is via ads posted on the site.  As much as possible, we'd like for our services to be free and available to as many people as possible. Ads on the site help us keep the site running without charging any membership fees or similar to our site visitors. A large purchase like the AX8 though needs a bit of help :)

We are committed to helping people get the best out of their Fractal Audio gear.  Chris is a guitarist and drummer in Honolulu, Hawaii, gigging regularly and always testing the latest Firmware and updates with his Axe-Fx II. 

AxeFxTutorials.com wants to continue this service with the AX8. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If contributing monetarily is not for you, no problem. Thank you for reading this campaign and considering helping us out.  Please share this campaign with other musicians/guitarists you know to help get the word out.  The AX8 is going to be an amazing product and many people will be starting out with Fractal Audio products for the first time.  The FAS forum is great, but sometimes individual attention and live chat/video can help out much more quickly. 


Thank you very much! 

-Chris Luke
Founder, AxeFxTutorials.com

We are committed to helping people get the best out of their Fractal Audio gear.  Chris is a guitarist and drummer in Honolulu, Hawaii, gigging regularly and always testing the latest Firmware and updates with his Axe-Fx II. 
AxeFxTutorials.com wants to continue this service with the AX8. 

    Other Ways You Can Help If contributing monetarily is not for you, no problem. Thank you for reading this campaign and considering helping us out.  Please share this campaign with other musicians/guitarists you know to help get the word out.  The AX8 is going to be an amazing product and many people will be starting out with Fractal Audio products for the first time.  The FAS forum is great, but sometimes individual attention and live chat/video can help out much more quickly. 
Thank you very much! 
-Chris LukeFounder, AxeFxTutorials.com

story:
HEY ROOMIES! 

As a group, we kept our ears to the ground, watched other people use this method and actually succeed. We've noticed that there have been many different approaches and fans of music are starting to take control, but it's lacking something. Labels, bands and artists don't show you how the money gets spent. We however, want to launch our career with integrity and transparency so WE will account to you to show you how every penny is spent and prove that making a top notch record comes at a price. Who knows, if we exceed our goal we may be able to do things we may have only dreamed about to give back to those who matter most. Essentially, the success of this campaign will determine how amazing this record will become. We are set up for Flex Funding which means if we don't reach our goal, we are still getting the money that is raised. So, if we don't reach our goal, obviously we will have to reevaluate how we are planning to do this record. Regardless, we are ready to deliver this thing however our campaign plays out.

Remember, anything that is available through the perks is exclusive to the campaign. The Limited Edition EP, Sweatshirts, and T-shirts are all one time offers. None of them will ever be printed again in this way.****

The Impact

By taking part in this campaign you yourself are taking charge and helping to change how we make music. You are putting faith in us and our management team to show you what we can really do.

With that in mind, we give you our word that we will not settle for “good enough” - we wont take any shortcuts, and above all – the money we raise in this thing will be reflected in the final product. We've been fortunate enough to work with amazing producers, and engineers but also some Grammy-Nominated mixers.

Here's to making our best album yet.



Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't know what to think about this idea and aren't sure you can commit – there are other ways you can help out. Spread the word! Tell your family and friends and let them know what's going on. We don't expect everyone who's listened to and enjoyed our music to jump on board, just let people know this is happening. With all the social networking and ways we now connect with one another, by posting links to this page you are reaching places we would never be able to reach.

The Budget BreakDown 

Recording Budget
Expenses
Pre Production ($200 a song) $1,400.00
Launch Video $1,500.00
Studio Fees
Studio Time $4,000.00
Producer Fees $4,000.00

After Recording
Mixing Fees $3,000.00
Mastering $2,500.00
Album Artwork $750.00
Exclusive Album Artwork & Packaging $500.00
Other Expenses
Advertising & Promotional Material  $1,500.00


Distribution & Packaging    $750.00
Total $19,900
Perks  $200.00
Indie GoGo Fees (4%) -$800.00
Credit Card fees (3%) -$600.00
GRAND TOTAL $21,500.00

story:
Overview

It's been about 2 years since my last album "Postcards From Berlin". In that time I've been super busy, playing keyboards on tour with electronic music legend, Gary Numan, producing music for films and TV shows and helping other artists with their projects.

But now it's time to do something for YOU once again and so I'm producing a special, new, double EP of [debut] music.

 

The Plan

As you know,  I'm always trying to reinvent myself when I put out new work and this time is no different and I have to say that I'm super excited about what's coming your way. Here's what's in the pipeline:

EP#1 : "Hello" // This is upbeat and intense, still with my trademark darkness but I think you will like the almost exclusively electronic sound on this. It's tight, punchy and gets your feet moving and it's just me on vocals. There will be at least 5 tracks with 1 or 2 bonus, unreleased tracks thrown in for people who back me on Indiegogo.

EP#2 : "The Battle" // This is a super intense and hard-hitting instrumental piece. It's essentially 6-tracks all rolled in to one long DJ style mega-mix. If you like Deadmau5 and The Chemical Brothers then you will love this.

[debut] ARTBOOK // This is a limited edition collection of black and white photos that I've gathered over the past 4 years. Most have never been seen before and they cover the period from "Starting to Love it" through "Postcards From Berlin", touring with Gary Numan and the making of "Hello".

Live in 2017 // Once the EP's are finished I want to get on the road and bring them to you through some special live events. I'll be using a combination of live performance and film projections to give you a great concert experience in an intimate party setting.

 

Your Help

As you know, all of this takes $$$.

To release the EP's I have to record the music, mix it, master it then get the limited edition items made, get covers and books designed, photos done, music videos produced, T-shirts printed, etc, etc.

To play it all live I have to invest in new equipment, lights, custom films, projection screens, venues, travel, hotels, etc, etc

This is where YOU come in.

In return for supporting me now, you will be the first to get your hands on the new music plus special backer-only merchandise, experiences and one-off items that won't be available anywhere else. You'll be helping me to stay fully independent, cutting out the middle-man so I can bring you my work faster, better and at a lower price. You'll also be on the VIP list for the live shows!

 

What I Need & What You Get

I'm setting TWO targets that I hope you will help me meet

Target #1 // $10,000 total

For this I can produce both EP's of music plus the art and merchandise that goes with it. This is my minimum target goal.

Target #2 // $20,000 total

For this I can also produce at least 3 special live events, one each in Los Angeles, New York and London. I'll play both EP's live and also do other [debut] songs with hopefully some special guest appearances. If i get to $20k EVERYONE who has backed me will get an invite to any or all of the shows! (I can even get to Berlin if we break $22k)

 

Timeline

The plan is to run this Indiegogo campaign for 30 days

At the end of that 30 days, everyone who has backed me will get an instant download of "The Battle".

I will then focus on completing the "Hello" EP and aim to get it to you (along with the other one-off's and merchandise) by late Summer.

Then, if we've hit $20k goal I will play the live shows around September time.

 

The "What-Ifs"

Ok, we can all be positive here but what happens if we don't hit the $ targets? The reality is that without the funding I simply won't be able do everything I set out to do. Only when I see the final $# will I be able to tell you what I can deliver and what I can't deliver. If what I can offer simply doesn't cut it for you at that stage then you can get your $ back if you so wish.

But that's not going to happen right!!! Together we all did an amazing crowdfunder for the "Postcards From Berlin" album and everything turned out better than expected, so we have a history of doing this and getting it right!

story:
If you are reading this, you probably already know that we are Tree Tops, a progressive groove rock band based in Knoxville, Tennessee. It has been our absolute pleasure to play for you all over the Southeast in the recent past, and we're excited to finally share our first full length studio recording with you! We have been able to fund the project ourselves so far, but the bank has run dry and we aren't nearly finished with all of our plans. We need your help!

Right now, we have finished tracking, and our incredible producer Chris Pope is in Boone, NC, finishing things up for us and getting these songs sounding real good for ya! Meanwhile in Nashville, TN, the amazing Kyle Kelly is hard at work on some amazing designs that will become the album art, a fresh look on our website and the latest Tree Tops T-shirt design. Thanks to your support over the past year on the road, we have enough money to pay these gentlemen to perform their magic, but this is where the money runs out.

We've put together a little budget to show you guys exactly why we are asking you to give us your hard-earned money and to give you a taste of all the cool stuff we are attempting to pull off with your help!

- Music Video (we'll tell you what song it's for later ;) don't worry)

- Digital Distribution of LP

- Digital Distribution of Singles

- CD Printing

- Advertising

- Merchandise

As you can see, we've got our work cut out for us!

The awesome thing about IndieGoGo is we get to offer you "perks" in exchange for your donations. You can pre-order the record and gain access to an advanced digital copy, get invited to a special listening party, have a private music lesson with one of the members of Tree Tops, or even shave David's head on stage at one of our shows. We've dreamed up some great ways to thank you for your contributions! We've set our budget high enough to accommodate absolutely everything we'd like to do for this album, but don't worry too much. If we don't make it quite there, we'll still receive the donations you have made and put them to good use!

The opportunity to create and release this record has made us infinitely closer as a band and friends. We are incredibly proud of what we have created here and believe that we have quite the story to tell. We all love music more than we could possibly describe to you, and our main ambition is to share this thing we love with as many people as possible. We are going to do WHATEVER it takes to make that happen, and we greatly appreciate your help! If you can't donate but would still like to help, or if you wish to help in addition to donating, please share this campaign with your friends and family and encourage them to donate as well! Thank you!

We love you very much,

Cory, David and Jon

story:
SYSTEMATICALLY MANUFACTURED TOUR

 

Gas Station Mentality's second album SYSTEMATICALLY MANUFACTURED has been recorded and is waiting to be hand-delivered to you by the band itself. That's right, HAND-DELIVERED. You're wondering, how this is possible? It is only possible with YOUR help of course. All of the money raised through this campaign goes directly into funding the GAS STATION MENTALITY NORTH AMERICAN TOUR 2017. 

 

bringing you more mentality

It's been 18 months since the first GSM album was released. 18 months that we have been working tirelessly to bring you what we feel is the most compelling collection of songs that you will hear in 2017 (LITERALLY). But why? Systematically Manufactured is our way of articulating the idea that destiny is real. And, it was chosen to remind ourselves that these songs were written long before we began the arduous task of discovering them. In short, we may not know what the future holds, but we can rest assured knowing it has already been decided. 

But now that the album is ready to be heard, we don't want to just post it on Bandcamp and call it a day. We want to bring each and every one of you the entire Gas Station Mentality experience, leaving you with the album as a keepsake. This will, of course, be a financially demanding undertaking and will require your support to make happen. 

 

perks -------------> 

Our campaign goal is set at $8,000. And while a number of dates are already lined up, the more money we raise, the larger the tour will be. With that in mind, we set our sights on making this campaign unlike any other by offering you some truly monumental perks.  For instance, we'll play a show in your hometown* (in your basement or garage or at any venue you'd like) for $300. Want a guitar lesson or jam session with Blake, get it for $160.  

 

the tour

The tour will begin in July and will last through the fall. A list of cities in which GSM will be playing will be released during this campaign. Keep in mind that we are prepared to add dates ANYWHERE IN NORTH AMERICA so don't worry if you don't see your hometown on the list, YOU HAVE THE POWER TO ADD IT. It all kicks off at ShapeShifter Lab in Brooklyn, New York on May 31 and will continue until EACH AND EVERY ONE OF YOU HAS A COPY OF THE ALBUM/ARE WEARING GSM T-SHIRTS. 

 

 

*Within Canada or the Contiguous U.S.

story:
WHY DO WE NEED BLACK MAGIC LAB???

In a world where we wake up to the news of police killings of black and brown people, where queer and trans* individuals are under constant threat of assault, and where the wage gap between men and women still exists; programs and initiatives that work to uplift those communities are essential.

Black Magic Lab wants to be apart of this process by creating a real platform to promote the work of artists who are otherwise keep out, while simultaneously creating content that will work to challenge the conditions that make it necessary - transphobia, sexism, racism, etc.

The vision is simple

  • uplift marginalized voices
  • provide infrastructure and resources to the community
  • create art 

You could be funding the next great thing, so lets do what we can to nourish and cherish living artists. 

How will your $$ be used?

  • Paying artists for their contributions to the project ( interviews, visual arts, editing, etc.)
  • Paying artists who volunteer skills for the show's production
  • Renting space to host a future Black Magic Showcase 
  • Creating a small studio for the broadcast and as a recording studio for DIY artists
  • Creating self-sufficient show

The Impact

  • Queer and Trans* affirming music and art
  • Material Resources for aspiring artists
  • A more inclusive world

Risks & Challenges

The goal is to create something that can be enjoyed by lots of people. There is always a risk in speaking out and uplifting groups that are traditionally shut out - that risk is backlash and rejection. It is a challenge that is daily faced by qtpoc. Instead of turning away we want to take the risk for the opportunity to overcome it.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the funds to spare that's ok, there are other ways you can help make this project grow :

  • Share this link on your social media/ to your friends/ through any means possible
  • Follow Black Magic Lab on Twitter and Instagram
  • Tune and enjoy the show!

story:
*SEE OUR UPDATES TAB FOR A CHANCE TO WIN A UE Boom 2 Bluetooth Speaker, and a free concert!!!*

 

Keeping Tradition Alive

My previous album, The Navajo Piano, began as a project to preserve the music of the Navajo people. Traditional songs and chants are passed down orally, and were never written down. My hope was to record my grandfather singing, and write the music down for preservation. However, the project was not so simple, and I ended up with a full album of piano pieces based on the traditional chants my grandfather recorded.

Now, I want to to take the project to the next level. My goal is to create piano pieces based on Navajo musical practices, while also including my grandfather singing on several tracks with the piano. I'm hoping to merge tradition with new music, as a way to promote the culture and inspire other Native Americans to reach into their background and preserve their music.

 

What We Need & What You Get

As you may or may not know, producing an album is very costly! We need to raise funds to make this a reality. Here are just a few of the major costs involved:

  • Recording, mixing, and mastering
  • Album artwork
  • Video production
  • Travel Costs
  • Distribution
  • CD Production
  • Promotion and Marketing
  • Shipping Costs
  • Fulfilling the perks of this campaign

In exchange for your contribution, you will receive a variety of perks! Based on your level of support, you can get:

  • A download of the finished album
  • Autographed copy of the album
  • T-shirts
  • Autographed posters
  • Artwork
  • Behind the Scenes Booklet
  • Invites to exclusive release parties
  • Private concerts at your home or event
  • Recognition in the album liner notes
  • You could even get my first piano!
 

Unique Challenges

Since my grandpa Keith lives on the reservation, recording him is difficult. He either has to make a long trip to Phoenix (about 5 hours each way), or I have to bring all of the recording equipment to him (and he has limited electrical outlets and power). I also do not currently have professional-quality recording equipment. We'll either need money to pay for his transportation and studio time, or we'll need to upgrade my equipment so we can get clean recordings at his hogan. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you can still help! Just share this campaign with your friends and family. The indiegogo campaign has a share feature that allows you to post it on your social media, which helps us get the momentum we need to make this project a reality!

My previous album, The Navajo Piano, began as a project to preserve the music of the Navajo people. Traditional songs and chants are passed down orally, and were never written down. My hope was to record my grandfather singing, and write the music down for preservation. However, the project was not so simple, and I ended up with a full album of piano pieces based on the traditional chants my grandfather recorded.
Now, I want to to take the project to the next level. My goal is to create piano pieces based on Navajo musical practices, while also including my grandfather singing on several tracks with the piano. I'm hoping to merge tradition with new music, as a way to promote the culture and inspire other Native Americans to reach into their background and preserve their music.
 

What We Need & What You Get
As you may or may not know, producing an album is very costly! We need to raise funds to make this a reality. Here are just a few of the major costs involved:

Recording, mixing, and mastering
Album artwork
Video production
Travel Costs
Distribution
CD Production
Promotion and Marketing
Shipping Costs
Fulfilling the perks of this campaign

In exchange for your contribution, you will receive a variety of perks! Based on your level of support, you can get:

A download of the finished album
Autographed copy of the album
T-shirts
Autographed posters
Artwork
Behind the Scenes Booklet
Invites to exclusive release parties
Private concerts at your home or event
Recognition in the album liner notes
You could even get my first piano!

 
Unique Challenges
Since my grandpa Keith lives on the reservation, recording him is difficult. He either has to make a long trip to Phoenix (about 5 hours each way), or I have to bring all of the recording equipment to him (and he has limited electrical outlets and power). I also do not currently have professional-quality recording equipment. We'll either need money to pay for his transportation and studio time, or we'll need to upgrade my equipment so we can get clean recordings at his hogan. 

Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can't contribute, you can still help! Just share this campaign with your friends and family. The indiegogo campaign has a share feature that allows you to post it on your social media, which helps us get the momentum we need to make this project a reality!

story:
How it all started

beißpony is based in the midst of a buzzing collective of artists. It all started at the Kafe Kult. It’s one of the oldest DIY venues in Munich, founded in the ‘80s. Allison Wolfe from Bratmobile played there, The Notwist, AIDS Wolf, Chain And The Gang, Des Ark, Mika Miko, Lightning Bolt, Kickballl, The Good Good, Lydia Lunch and Jeffrey Lewis.

beißpony's percussionist Stephanie Müller used to be part of the booking collective for a couple of years and all these different musicians inspired her a lot. The Kafe Kult is also the place where she met Laura Melis Theis for the very first time. It was during a Kimya Dawson concert in 2006. It didn’t take long and they startet their own music project – beißpony. Meanwhile Laura is based in Oxford (UK). In the years since they started, they’ve always been trying to bring together artists from all over the world.

BEASTS AND LONERS is their upcoming album. With your help Laura and Stephanie can make it happen.

Feel free to preorder their LP via indiegogo or to choose one of their unique pieces of artwork.

You don't have a credit card?

Please don't hesitate and contact beißpony via rag_treasure@gmx.de. For everybody without credit cards, Laura and Stephanie also offer bank transfer or PayPal. Just drop them an Email and tell them what you'd love to get > rag_treasure@gmx.de.

Vinyl Production

First of all Laura and Stephanie want to finance the vinyl production. The pressing of 500 albums on vinyls costs around 1.800 Euros.

Stefan Dorner and Fabian Zweck are the ones who never ever stopped supporting them since the very beginning of beißpony in 2006. They also recorded and produced BEASTS AND LONERS together with Laura and Stephanie. Both of them spent innumerable hours on the album production. If beißpony's crowdfunding campaign makes it possible, Laura and Stephanie would also love to support them for their incredible work.

Artwork

Each LP comes with a download code and a unique piece of cover and poster artwork.

beißpony's artwork is based on an exciting collaboration. Klaus Erich Dietl who supports beißpony with a whole variety of music videos and visuals for their live performances, contributed a hand drawn picture puzzle with lots of love for the tiny details. In addition to his cover, BEASTS AND LONERS’ striking and unique poster artwork was produced by Deidra Mesayu from the queer-feminist collective Royal Family Club (Yogjakarta, Indonesia). Stephanie met her during her tour in Indonesia last April. With your help beißpony can finance the printing costs (around 700 Euros) and they have the chance to support Klaus and Deidra a little bit.

Further collaborations

Besides Deidra, Fabian, Klaus and Stefan a couple of other inspiring artists and musicians supported BEAST AND LONERS. They contributed as guest musicians or producers. beißpony might not be able to raise money for all of them. Nevertheless, lots of hugs and love go out to all of them!

The songs feature Michael Krogmann’s double bass, Martin Majewski’s trumpet, Josip Pavlov’s guitar, Wolfi Schlick’s tuba, Neil Vaggers’ trombone, Herbert Schneider ‘s drums, sitar and tabla, Mirjam Stutzmann’s accordion, and Martina Taubenberger’s clarinet, German flute, and sax - and a whole host of choir singers (including Max Amling, Florian a. Betz, Klaus Erich Dietl, Moni Kliche, Katharina Wilczek, Tobias Wullert ) on the album closer Up In Arms. All songs were produced by Fabian Zweck and Stefan Dorner, except RAIN IS OVERRATED. Colin Djukic who already contributed to beißpony's debut album, produced this song.

Your support

Feel free to choose from our selection of perks and rewards. There are special album editions waiting for you, textile treasures and lots more. Don't hesitate! Even the tiniest donation helps beißpony to finance BEASTS AND LONERS and to support their friends, who put so much love and effort into the album. 

And if you are not so much into donating, feel free to spread the word and tell your friends about beißpony's  project.

THANK YOU SO MUCH

More detailled information about beißpony and BEASTS AND LONERS

Four years after their celebrated debut BRUSH YOUR TEETH on Chicks On Speed Records, beißpony are now releasing their follow-up album BEASTS AND LONERS.

Those intervening years have seen numerous new developments for the band – from their invitation to SXSW in Austin (TX, USA), to the INTERNATIONAL SHORTFILM FESTIVAL in Oberhausen, to exciting solo ventures such as Stephanie Müller’s A DUET OF AMPLIFIED SEWING MACHINES tour with Lisa S. Caneiro in Indonesia, or Laura Theis’ solo release BADASS SNOW WHITE in the UK. Further highlights include music compositions for a collaboration with Wolfgang Müller (DIE TÖDLICHE DORIS) and for a radio play written by nobel prize winner Elfriede Jelinek. Thanks to the Munich based artist and cinematographer Klaus Erich Dietl, they also had the chance to become part of a feature film production. For OUR MOUTH – THE ULTIMATE PRISON they composed music and developed the set and costume design. Recently the feature was premiered at the Munich based LENBACHAUS. The follow-up is already in the making.

In the midst of all these exciting new adventures, beißpony started their own label RAGREC. It was in 2016 during a vibrant exchange with artists from all over the globe. About 35 artists located in Germany, Hawaii, Japan, South Africa, UK and the Ukraine shared their ideas on ALLIGATOR GOZAIMASU. It is an intriguing, multi-facetted piece of work. Most of the songs are based on a public recording session at the IMPORT EXPORT, an underground venue located in the heart of Munich. People of all ages and different backgrounds - queer activists, young refugees and artists such as German filmmaker Doris Dörrie - took part.

ALLIGATOR GOZAIMASU definitely left it's mark on the upcoming beißpony album. BEASTS AND LONERS is crossing all separators with a fierce love for complexity and no fear of life's dissonances.

BEASTS AND LONERS is an album showcasing exciting collaborations and international exchange, which is not surprising considering its fascinating genesis:

In 2014, Munich-based Stephanie Müller and Oxford-based Laura Theis were invited to develop an experimental piece of musical theatre during the walpurgis theater’s Feniks Festival Artist Residency in Mortsel, Belgium.

Their performance was originally based on a pamphlet of Theis’ poems and short stories entitled ‘Beasts and Loners’, yet from this it grew and morphed into a mixed media composition that incorporated a whole array of local influences including an encounter with the SPACE LADY (La Junta, Colorado, USA) and a trip to a spoken word theatre adaptation of the famous RUMBLE IN THE JUNGLE boxing match. The exchange with fellow artist-in-residence Mikio Saito (Sapporo, Japan) even led to an extensive cultural exchange between the underground scenes in Munich and Sapporo.

From this, the songs developed further. BEASTS AND LONERS is an album that has its unique strength in collaboration and beißpony have managed to assemble a very exciting array of guest musicians and performers.

Musically, it is even more versatile than its predecessor: The songs feature Michael Krogmann’s double bass, Martin Majewski’s trumpet, Josip Pavlov’s guitar, Wolfi Schlick’s tuba, Neil Vaggers’ trombone, Herbert Schneider ‘s drums, sitar and tabla, Mirjam Stutzmann’s accordion, and Martina Taubenberger’s clarinet, German flute, and sax - and a whole host of choir singers (including Max Amling, Florian a. Betz, Klaus Erich Dietl, Moni Kliche, Katharina Wilczek, Tobias Wullert ) on the album closer Up In Arms.

And with every new track the listener can tell that beißpony and their producers Fabian Zweck and Stefan Dorner (Rain Is Overrated is guest produced by Colin Djukic) are not afraid to experiment. Most of the songs were recorded at the MEDIENDIENST LEISTUNGSHÖLLE and at the KAFE KULT in Munich. They feature an eclectic variety of styles ranging from spoken word (e.g. the psychedelic Kraut piece Shadow Companion or the jazzy Japanese Oto-Hime) to the heavy My Abstraction Capability Equals Zero to the 60ies pop of the album’s opener Lord of the Wings to name but a few. Some songs are stripped down, lo-fi and rough, some are opulent, there is a-capella singing and animal noises generated by human voices.

BEASTS AND LONERS rewards the listener for paying close attention because there is a lot going on between the lines. In a delicate and humorous way the album addresses and communicates the rough and uncanny aspects of life.

Songs like Ambroxol, Malt & Heavy Beats, More Excuse than Escape may appear in the deceptive guise of a jaunty tune, only to reveal bitingly sharp lyrics that question society’s double standards, growing up in an alienating, bigoted social environment full of petit bourgeois reservations, or offer a disenchanted look at what drives people to futile workaholism.

Lord of the Wings, written from the point of view of a ruthless wing man, takes an ironic dig at the misogynist world views inherent in the Pick Up Artist community. Identities are not fixed, they can be played with - Never Seen A Movie That Doesn’t Star Bruce Willis recounts the unlikely love affair between a wrestler and a librarian, and the gender-bent Rumble is completely made up from original quotes by the boxers Muhammad Ali and George Foreman.

BEASTS AND LONERS is an album unafraid of complexity and in-between spaces, of looking behind facades. And especially the words to Shadow Companion, based on a poem by Jewish German language poet Mascha Kaléko who managed to emigrate to the US in 1938, seem very apt and poignant for the experience many refugees have to go through in our current times: “Do not say mine, everything is on loan … make your home but keep the suitcase on hand … take your own shadow for a companion”.

Like Shadow Companion also the album's closer is based on poetry. Up In Arms derives from a tanka (Japanese poem consisting of 31 syllables) Stephanie found at the Sapporo based RETRO SPACE. It was written by the owner of the space, Kazutaka Saka. Back in his early twenties he was involved in the 1960ies protest movement. In his poem he is questioning whether he and his fellows will have any chance to inspire further generations. Saka was a friend of Etsuko Takano, a Japanese activist who committed suicide in the late 1960ies. Based on Saka's poem and on excerpts from Etsuko Takano’s suicide note, beißpony wrote a a very quiet, delicate resistance song: “Tomorrow is another day / because I believe it / I set up the barricades /How much I'm passionate / to whom should I tell?”

BEASTS AND LONERS is an album for everyone who is ready to take off the blinkers and to explore new boulevards of thoughts. It is impossible to reduce the richness of this album to a single theme. Nobody is just one thing (just a beast, just a loner). The songs encourage the listeners to have a closer look and to dig deeper into complex questions. The album is a work under construction and therefore doesn’t offer any ready-made solutions, but rather encourages independent thought and a share in the wonderings of beißpony’s minds.

 

*****UPDATE********

Trouble with Card Payment? Please don't hesitate&contact us!

Dear Friends & Supporters,

it has come to our attention that some of you had trouble  with debit card payments - we are so sorry and would like to apologise for this! We have found out that Indiegogo does not accept debit cards without the Visa or MasterCard logos. If that's you then please don't hesitate to get in touch with us and let us know which perk you would like, and we'll arrange a way for you to pay via bank transfer or PayPal - sorry for the extra hassle!! 

To get in touch please email rag_treasure@gmx.de (Steffi) and lauramusik@gmail.com (Laura).

story:
Short Summary

I am Bregje Sanne Lacourt

A singer/songwriter from the beautiful city Rotterdam in the Netherlands, recently added to the lonely planet city guide. Whoohoo!

Born in the South of the Netherlands I moved up to study at the School of musical arts. I make a living as a vocalcoach, a booker, a singer doing live performances and I knit stuff (le chat rouge knittings and such). I live together with my grumpy cat Queen Mo von Pluysch.

. 

 

Life goal: Recording the most depressing album of 2017!


In 2014 I recorded my first album 'The Keeper of Changing Winds' funded with crowdfunding.

This was an unexpected success and after many wonderfull gigs (opening act for Eric Taylor and Frazey Ford, Songbird festival, a small tour in London, 2 x a wintersongs tour in theaters) and being a semi finalist in several contests, I took a break to write the 2nd album 'HURRICANE'.

The first single 'Letter to Romance' is already released as a teaser.

 


Why? Lets be honest: 2016 was a terrible year, 2017 is going to be awesome and we need to keep things in balance, right? If you like pure music please support me.

If you support me I'll be able to:

- Record this album with my wonderfull band and producers Michel Ebben and Roderick          Schussel
-  To release this album online
-  Hire a press promoter to get my music out in the world
-  Play more, bigger stages and theaters
-  Make more music for those who love my sound
 

What I Need & What You Get

 

What I need  is € 11.000 euro's for:

- studio time
- musicians
- press promoter
- mixing
- mastering
- marketing
- artwork
- percentage of the crowdfunding platform *wink*

 

What you get?

- Being the first one  to receive the download code of this album (before the official release) plus all the extra's depending on what package you choose 
- A short film 'making of'  exclusively for you
- A bucket with love
- A kitten drawn by me
- A happy woman!

 

What happens if I don't reach the 100%?

I am a positive and hardworking person and I always seek for solutions. Therefor I have a  huge amount of trust in this project and the great people working with me.
There are many ways to get the missing euros like applying for funding at SENA Music Support.

I promise you dearly I will sing my heart out on stage and knit my fingers till they bleed to sell those items and use the money earned for this album.

What happens if I go over the 100%?

Then I'll be able to make a cd or vinyl version of 'HURRICANE'!!!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out to your friends and family and make some noise about my campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools!

Love Bregje Sanne Lacourt

story:
[ENGLISH VERSION BELOW]

 

¿Por qué un container?
Un container es transportado durante kilómetros lleno de materias y energías desconocidas hasta su apertura, y esto es lo que va a ocurrir con los conciertos a desarrollar por el Ensemble Container. Una nueva experiencia para el público de la ciudad, con repertorio nunca escuchado y por jóvenes extremeños (o relacionados con la región) que regresan a casa para traer esta propuesta.

Esta campaña al micromecenazgo está enfocada al pago de materiales técnicos para la realización de los conciertos, tales como luces, cables, micrófonos. 

El ensemble Container es un nuevo proyecto englobado dentro de la programación de la VIII Edición del Ciclo de Música Actual de Badajoz, organizado por la Sociedad Filarmónica de la ciudad y el CNDM. Este proyecto está patrocinado por la Junta de Extremadura.

[Concierto 1] - 9. Enero. 2017
los dos lados de la moneda

En este primer concierto planteamos un programa que combine dos estéticas completamente distintas. La primera de ellas, la escuela centro europea de la segunda mitad del siglo XX, representada por Franco Donatoni y Karlheinz Stockhausen (Italia y Alemania). En contraposición a estos “clásicos” del siglo pasado, combinaremos estas obras con dos estrenos absolutos a dos jóvenes compositores extremeños. Con esto pretendemos que muestren las diferencias entre la asentada escuela europea del pasado siglo y la revolución que se está gestando. Sólo una premisa, el uso acústico de los instrumentos.


[Concierto 2] - 12. Enero. 2017
todos los defectos del hombre

Pararnos a pensar y ver donde se encuentran todos los problemas de nuestra sociedad es uno de los objetivos que persigue este programa. El ser humano tiene la capacidad de destruir a la par que construye, y muy probablemente es lo que está ocurriendo hoy en día. Esto unido a la falta, en algunos casos, de valores en nuestro tiempo, nos facilita la realización de una lista interminable de problemas a los que enfrentarnos. A esta idiosincrasia problemática hay que unirle la presencia de la tecnología en nuestro día a día, un hecho sin el que no se entendería la sociedad actual. Ejemplo de esto es la obra del compositor belga Stefan Prins: “Generation Kill”; una obra a camino entre el sonido, lo visual y lo políticamente incorrecto.

 

ENTRADA LIBRE

                                                                        -----------------------------

Why a container?
A container is carried milles away full of unknown energies and stuff until its opening. Container Ensemble will exemplify this idea in the concerts. A new experience for the regular audience in Badajoz with repertoire never heard it there before. All of this is performed by young musicians from Extremadura, the ones who come back home.

We ask you to support us through this crowdfunding with the aim to cover the expenses of the technical materials for the realization of the concerts, such as lights, cables or microphones.

The Container Ensemble is a new project included in the 8th Edition of the New Music Festival of Badajoz, organized by the Philharmonic Society of Badajoz and the CNDM. This project is sponsored by Extremadura’s Government.

[Concert 1] - January 9th. 2017
two sides: head or tail

The first concert combines two different aesthetics. On one hand we have Franco Donatoni and Karlheinz Stockhausen (Italy and Germany), representative musical figures of the second half  of 20th century. On the other hand we have two new pieces composed by two youth composers from our region. Our goal is showing the revolution we are suffering right now musically talking. Only acustic instruments allowed. 


[Concert 2] - January 12th, 2017
all men imperfections

Our goal: stop and think, where are society´s problems? We, as human beings, have the capacity of create and destroy, such a capacity is used right now as a recipe. Creating + destroying without principles = troubles just growing between people (while technology just melt all of it). “Generation Kill”, piece by the Belgian composer Stefan Prins brings us the perfect example. Not politically correct.

 

FREE ENTRANCE
