story:
Welcome to "Transformative Music For The 21st Century"

A full mix of our third epic track!
'(On The) Edge Of Memory'
A short edit from the initial mix
https://soundcloud.com/davidnathan0215/david-n-...
                                                                             Links to our music!
'(Echoes Of) Shambhala' - now available for download at iTunes and Amazon!
http://itunes.apple.com/album/id1228309269?ls=1&app=itunes
http://amzn.to/2pELKRy (UK)
http://amzn.to/2qJY9kE (US)
 

and to stream at:

https://open.spotify.com/album/25Lte54eyTaHfzAf...
 
Hear the FULL track on SoundCloud:
'(Echoes Of) Shambhala':  https://goo.gl/LJh89U
and our latest track
I See You In My Dreams: https://goo.gl/LJh89U
ALL donations/contributions of £5 UK/$6.50 US receive download links for all the music we make by the end of the campaign (including these two)
 
Quote from multi-Grammy-award-winning global music legend CHAKA KHAN, April 26, 2017:
"'Shambhala...is one of the most BEAUTIFUL songs I've EVER HEARD!!!!!!  I'm profoundly impressed and it moved me in such a way that I'm changed (for lack of a better word) so now I'm needing more!! "
 
As of May 7, 2017, 10% of all donations/contributions made to the campaign will be donated to The Hunger Project!
 
Some of the quotes on our track '(Echoes Of) Shambhala'...
 
Ruby James - "You have no idea how that piece affected me. Tears rolled down my face within first few bars then my body wanted me to go mediation mode. So I did. The imagery used touched me so much. I thank you for your music. I felt a strong healing from this and look forward to hearing and experiencing more" 
Yogi Bowie Blackmon - "Just a thought: What about tracking a few people's blood pressure before, during, and after listening to this music ... just to see. I swear, I feel mine change, dropping, leveling out nicely! I feel it in my body, in my bones, the chakras, in my aura, my spirit."
Freda Payne (recording artist) - "Very lovely, very pleasant and meditative nice music to do yoga by. I like the violin and your voice blends in so well."
Linda Clifford (recording artist): - "What a lovely song! So melodic, and haunting. Congratulations on a great project!"
Gary Hines of The Sounds Of Blackness (recording artist): "Echoes of Shambhala" is a classic. Mesmerizing, beautiful track that stimulates your Mind, opens your Heart and touches your Soul! Treat yourself to this Masterpiece!"
Sandra St. Victor (recording artist) - "This song is so hypnotic. The tone on this line, 'waterfall of tears as I yearn for you' gets me each time I hear it. Deeply moving. I love it and looking forward to more in this vein!"
Dexter Wansel (recording artist and producer)- "This is beautiful David and Aritra B. The beginnings of a spiritual journey I think."
 

In March 2017, UK singer/songwriter David Nathan teamed up with the production team of songwriters and musicians, Aritra B and Rajesh Ranjan Singh to create two tracks for a planned EP.  The first session was magical and led to the creation of (Echoes Of) Shambhala, inspired by David's writing about a 12th century Nepalese Buddhist monk as part of a works-in-progress book on past lives... 

The vivid soundscape that Aritra created completely reflected David's musical vision for the song.  What started out as a possibility for one or two tracks has now blossomed into the creation of an EP as a result of the initial response to (Echoes Of )Shambhala, described as 'soothing,' 'calming,' 'beautiful' and with a meditative effect...

Now a unique and distinctive recording and performing unit, David N & Aritra B are committed to making transformative music for the heart and soul, music that touches and moves people on every level.  We're asking for your support in making an EP (physical and digital)  of another (3) tracks along with at least one great video for the track '(Echoes Of) Shambhala...

If you like our first two tracks, we invite you to donate or contribute - no amount too large or too small - so we can finish an entire EP  and hit the road to perform the world over!  

We've set a figure of £6000 UK (approx. $7500 US) to complete more tracks and at least one video; from any money we raise beyond our target, we'll donate 10% to The Hunger Project.  All funds we raise will go towards recording and the video and we will honour all rewards we're offering regardless of how much funding we actually get.  

Note...if you live outside the UK, you have the option of using PayPal so you can still contribute to our campaign by sending payments to PayPal account for nefermusic0215@gmail.com

And the rewards?  

Well, they include...

  • A personalized finished recording for you based on a special occasion or a lyric title that you provide to us 
  • Advance free password-protected download for each new track as it's completed, starting with Echoes Of Shambhala 
  • In the UK, free violin lessons from Aritra for you, a member of your family or friend 

And if you're not interested in ANY of the rewards, we invite you to donate any amount you'd like to assist us with our mission of creating more heartfelt music!   

We'll be posting clips from the writing and recording sessions we'll doing in the next month or so... You'll be able to watch David and Aritra at different stages of the creative process with video clips we'll be posting here...

Finally, please feel free to share our campaign with like-minded friends, family members, colleagues and associates!  

With respect, appreciation and gratitude,

David N. & Aritra B.

story:
Short Summary

Crispus Attucks High School in Indianapolis, Indiana does not have enough money for band uniforms. They play their concerts in T-shirts and hand me downs.

  • We are a class at Indiana University crowdfunding so that these kids can hopefully get uniforms and new instruments.
  • The band class, directed by David Ebersole, can only have 70 members because they only have that many instruments. Many hopeful musicians were turned away.
  • Crispus Attucks HS is a historical school, a place where once whites sent only blacks to.
  • Help give them a sense of pride. They sound great and want to look great too! You have a chance to make a tangible impact.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • 100 uniforms. Roughly $500 a piece (for quality uniforms) = $50,000. Once we pass 50K we want another 50K for new instruments in addition to the uniforms. A total of $100,000. We have to make sure we get enough uniforms for high school students of different sizes.
  • When we reach our goal we will film a thank you show that you can attend in-person or watch online.
  • If we don't reach our goal we will use the money to get as many uniforms as possible, possibly getting lower quality jackets, pants, hats, etc. or new instruments

The Impact

Your donation will give the kids a chance to look as good as some of the other high school bands in the state, but more importantly it will show these kids that someone cares.

  • They will look as great as they sound.
  • They will preform better at competitions because they will look as professional as their competition.
  • The band can expand and let in others who were denied because of a lack of resources.

Risks & Challenges

The only obstacle is awareness. We will pursue a heavy social media campaign and reach out to local news stations to run stories.

  • We already have verbal commitment from some potential big donors.
  • This school has faced hardship in its existence, the median family income is very low. Let's do something about it.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!

  • Tell your friends and their friends and their friends!
  • Post the link on your social media and cause some buzz!

Crispus Attucks High School band deserves more than T-shirts for uniforms. Let's break down the walls and give these kids the same opportunities as other more financially-secure individuals and families.

You have a chance to make a change in someone's life. Because of band, some of these kids have a chance to pursue their passions and stay out of trouble. Let us let them do it in style!

story:
Short Summary

I'm Matt Shorraw, a 24-year-old, Commercial Music Technology graduate from Monessen, PA. I sing and play piano, and among other things, I volunteer in my hometown and I would like to see it improve. I have a love of music, community involvement, and youth. I enjoy seeing positive, beneficial action happening on a small, local scale.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • In order to obtain the building and get started on stabilizing, I will need $50,000 to start.
  • This will be phase 1 of 3, for this project.
  • If I don't reach my entire goal, you can choose to have your money refunded, or choose for it to go into a music scholarship for a Monessen High School student.

The Impact

In the middle of Southwestern Pennsylvania, lies Monessen, a former steel town, on the rust belt. It was founded to be an industrial hub, which it succeeded to do for much of the 20th century. Like many towns similar to it, Monessen fell when its industry left, leaving a lot of the town vacant. It's population, once around 25,000, now sits at 7,000. Much of the historic architecture in the downtown area has been demolished, or is falling apart. There is a building in the heart of the downtown district that is crying out to be saved. This building known as '500 Donner Ave.' was a former bank, in Beaux Arts style. It was converted into offices and retail, with an auditorium on the third floor. It has been vacant for nearly 30 years, along with the majority of the once bustling street that it stands on.
The building is being threatened, as certain city politicians want to see it demolished for another vacant lot (the city has innumerable vacant lots, more than it can take care of, or afford). I would like to acquire the building from the city with the funds raised for this campaign. Once the building is acquired, I would like to begin to renovate it and restore it.
After the renovation is complete, I would like to convert the first floor into a café, where live, original music can be played, the second floor into offices and a music center, that would offer lessons and classes, and the third floor into an auditorium, which is the use that it once served. 
Students from the music center could perform in the auditorium, as well as other local musicians.
Since there is not much business in the downtown area, there is not a venture like this one in the city of Monessen, nor are there any places in the immediate area that hold all of these things in one building.
It is my hope that something like this will inspire the youth of Monessen and the surrounding communities. I hope to get them involved in music and their community, and to keep them off the streets. The music lessons would be structured so that children and their families that can afford to pay, do so, and those who cannot afford to pay, as long as they put in the work, will be offered free lessons. The youth in the city desperately need somewhere like this to go, and I hope to provide that for them. 
It is also my hope that this building will become a centerpiece for the city and for its downtown, and that it will spark business and inspiration in the community.
I hope you can help me make this a reality, before this beautiful structure is lost forever!

Thank you!
Musically Yours,

Matt Shorraw

Risks & Challenges

After the project is funded, city council could still deny a bid, although that is highly unlikely. I am determined to see that this building is saved and that this music center will come to fruition. I believe in it and I believe in the power of community and collaborative effort. This campaign will be phase 1 of 3 for the project, making it difficult to fund. This phase will fund acquisition of the property, phase 2 will fund renovation, phase 3 will fund furniture, supplies, and such to get the music center off the ground.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't contribute, please share this with as many people as possible! Help get the word out, and together we can make this happen!

It has been vacant for nearly 30 years, along with the majority of the once bustling street that it stands on.The building is being threatened, as certain city politicians want to see it demolished for another vacant lot (the city has innumerable vacant lots, more than it can take care of, or afford). I would like to acquire the building from the city with the funds raised for this campaign. Once the building is acquired, I would like to begin to renovate it and restore it.After the renovation is complete, I would like to convert the first floor into a café, where live, original music can be played, the second floor into offices and a music center, that would offer lessons and classes, and the third floor into an auditorium, which is the use that it once served. Students from the music center could perform in the auditorium, as well as other local musicians.Since there is not much business in the downtown area, there is not a venture like this one in the city of Monessen, nor are there any places in the immediate area that hold all of these things in one building.It is my hope that something like this will inspire the youth of Monessen and the surrounding communities. I hope to get them involved in music and their community, and to keep them off the streets. The music lessons would be structured so that children and their families that can afford to pay, do so, and those who cannot afford to pay, as long as they put in the work, will be offered free lessons. The youth in the city desperately need somewhere like this to go, and I hope to provide that for them. It is also my hope that this building will become a centerpiece for the city and for its downtown, and that it will spark business and inspiration in the community.I hope you can help me make this a reality, before this beautiful structure is lost forever!Thank you!Musically Yours,Matt Shorraw   Risks & Challenges  After the project is funded, city council could still deny a bid, although that is highly unlikely. I am determined to see that this building is saved and that this music center will come to fruition. I believe in it and I believe in the power of community and collaborative effort. This campaign will be phase 1 of 3 for the project, making it difficult to fund. This phase will fund acquisition of the property, phase 2 will fund renovation, phase 3 will fund furniture, supplies, and such to get the music center off the ground.   Other Ways You Can Help  If you can't contribute, please share this with as many people as possible! Help get the word out, and together we can make this happen!

story:
Thank you for stopping by! My name is Lauren Lakis and I am an actress & musician living in Los Angeles.  

I am in the process of finishing my EP album, and need your help. I am not backed by a record label and am funding this entirely on my own. The upside to this is that I have complete creative control; the downside is that, well...I'm not a millionaire! 

These songs that I want to share with you are deeply personal to me. They are a true reflection of my spirit. After spending time in a band that was creatively stifling, I was ecstatic to finally make music from my heart. I'm extremely proud of this work, and hope for it to sound as professional as possible. As a truly independent artist, I need people like YOU to help make my dream a reality!

What I Need & What You Get

My goal is to raise $1,500 in 30 days. The money will go toward mixing, mastering, tracking, backing tracks for live shows, promotional outreach, album photography & artwork, packaging, and cd production.

The perks include:

$20 - physical copy of the album enclosed in a handmade DIY sleeve

$100 - Special Thanks credit on the album! (+ physical album + digital download)

$500 - I will learn a Cover Song of your choice! It can be ANYTHING. (+physical album + digital download + Special Thanks)

If I don't reach my entire goal, the money will still go toward everything listed above. Every little bit helps lesson the financial pressure! If I go beyond my goal, I will put that extra money toward making a music video.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute monetarily, please help me out by spreading the word and sharing this page. Post on your favorite social media account! xoxo

story:
Short Summary

Hey guys! My name is Zachary Thomas and I am the one and only member of Colors of Closure, an acoustic project I started over 5 years ago. Since the start Colors of Closure has become something that I not only love doing but its become a way of life. However, being an independent artist can be very hard to accomplish financially, I've put in as much as i possibly can but I need help. That's where you guys come in! I have tons of amazing perks that you can grab to show your support! 

What We Need & What You Get

I've been given the opportunity to record with one of the top producers in my area, Aaron Goforth, and I am extremely excited! However, it is incredibly expensive!

Between recording, mixing, mastering, and distribution the total comes to $4,000. This is a small sum with the right amount of support.

I have tons of amazing perks from getting a signed copy of the album to t-shirts and posters, to having a personal concert, to having a front row seat in the studio!

The Impact

This record is impossible without every single persons support. 

I've waited my whole life to have an opportunity like this and I need you guys to help me make it a reality.

With the release of this album more exciting content will emerge such as: music videos, contest, giveaways and even a tour!

Risks & Challenges

This record will not be easy for me to complete. I'll be working harder than i ever have before and challenged in ways i cannot even imagine. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can'f afford to contribute at all please make sure to hit one of the share buttons and get the word to all your friends and family.


Thank you all for every bit of support you have shown me and continue to show me through all these years. I'm not nearly finished, and this is just the beginning.

-Zachary Thomas

story:
Hello, my name is Ron Inkenbrandt

I was born in Indiana into a family of musicians. I picked up the guitar at the age of ten, and songwriting followed soon after. I've been in full time ministry for thirty years with my beautiful wife Patricia and our two children Aubrey and Joshua. For the last thirteen years I have been a pastor and worship leader and feel a distinct call to move back into full time music ministry.

As we move into this new season, I believe that it is time to record the songs that were birthed in the presence of the Lord during worship. Jesus Higher is my new album with ten original songs, plus a song co-written with my daughter Aubrey. Our prayer is that this album will release joy, and the presence of the Lord into your life and the nations of the earth.

Songwriting, recording and releasing those songs has been a mandate I received from the Lord thirty years ago. I feel like I am recapturing Gods original vision for my life and I would like to invite you to be a part of this journey. We are raising funds for the recording, mixing, mastering, artwork, physical copies, distribution, publishing, marketing, plane tickets and travel, etc. that will total 21,500 dollars. If your heart resonates with our desire to reach the nations through the song of the Lord, we would ask you to partner with us.

Blessings,

Ron and Patricia Inkenbrandt

story:
Hello friends - Please join me on a journey to connect people in a positive way through music,art,and live performance.

As many of you may know, I have been playing music since I was a small child. My father was a talented blues guitarist and vocalist,my mother a absolute lover of music, and a talented dancer, my stepfather a drummer, and my step brother a bassist. These four people were a big influence on my love of music and my desire to perform. My bliss led me to San Francisco at age 19, where I joined my step-brother Seth, and continued to study music, playing and performing with many different original projects. At the age of 24 I was invited by a Czech composer/bassist to travel with him back to Prague, where I stayed for five years. While living in Prague, I recorded with many different artists/singer songwriters, and started a movement tied to the Hip Hop, Funk, and Jazz sounds that I grew up with, leading to the formation of a very successful group named Plazma. Plazma was offered a record deal from Faust Records in Prague. The album featured some of Czech's best musicians and producers, as well as a very special American guest, Gary Lucas (of Captain Beefheart Fame). This group was featured on Radio 1 Praha, as well as on live TV. I also did quite bit of touring with a reggae group called Hermakuti led by French African bassist Djei Gogo (United Flavor). While in Europe, I toured Czech, Slovakia, Amsterdam, France, Spain, Germany, and Poland. I came back to NY in 2001, and have been playing and recording with groups and other artists ever since.

For the past six months I have been working on an EP made up of four songs that I feel strongly are a true representation of my abilities, and will lead to a major shift for me as an artist to make more substantial connections to the world of music and to those people who respect, work and contribute to that world.  So far pre-production (arrangements and bare bones) is complete, and I have completed my drum tracks, bass and keyboard parts for all 4 songs. Our projected release date is the Spring of 2016.Unfortunately, I have been unable to continue this project due to lack of funds- and this is where I need your help!

This particular project needs backers - people who can contribute monetarily to "the Big Picture" and also see themselves as part of a movement. My goal is to raise $5,500 which will cover the costs of paying for studio time and the musicians needed to finish recording, my lead vocal and backup vocals, guitar parts, string and horn section, and more percussion on my part. Most of the musicians who are playing on this recording are friends who will accept a small but respectable amount of money for each track, however, some of these musicians are hired hands and may need more to accept the challenge. Once we have what we need as far as recorded tracks, we have to mix the tracks and then the EP must be mastered. The mastering and production of approximately 500 CDs with jackets alone will cost between $1,000 to $1,500. I also have included the cost of paying the musicians to do two EP release performances.  The price of promotion and paying a publicist has not been factored in to my monetary goal as of yet.

Please give whatever you feel comfortable giving. No donation is too small. Regardless of whether I reach my goal or not, I will be able to use whatever you have contributed towards the completion of the EP. And don’t forget - your donations and input will be rewarded! You will receive perks such as free CD's, special performances, free concert tickets, special thank you’ s on CD jackets and more.  There will be videos/updates to all contributors no matter the amount, who wish to be kept current on progress of this project. The music being made with your donation will resonate with everyone who gets involved.

This project is meant to be a bridge for me to establish myself as a viable artist, one who is able to sustain myself as a full time musician. I believe that music is the "Great Connector” - connecting people of all ethnicities, creeds, colors, ages, sexual orientations,religions and cultures. I feel that isolation from the proper love, affection, and guidance, are the reasons for most of the killing and heartache that happen here and abroad. That is why I feel that connecting through any art form (especially now!) is the key to minimizing so much of the suffering that we go through as part of the human race. I truly believe that there is no one that can deny the power of a beautiful piece of art including music, dance, photography, writing, film, architecture, or any other artistic discipline for that matter. My medium is music. This is the way I feel I can give the most to others and connect to them in a very special and deep way.

Thank you for giving me the opportunity to reach out to you and hope you will help me by being part of what I feel I am meant to share with this world. Your contribution will help me meet these goals, and I will be forever grateful.

Peace,Love & Music ,  Lee F.

story:
WHY I AM MAKING AN ALBUM

I am excited because I’ve been telling stories with my music for a while, and the new songs I’m writing are getting great responses from audiences.  I have also been using my music to speak to the challenges presented by the tumult of the times we live in.  It's been heartening to find audiences responding to this as well.

At many performances I am asked if these new compositions are recorded.  I want to be able to answer yes.  But recording projects require resources and support.  That is why I'm here.

 

WHO I AM

I am an active performing vocalist and songwriter with 4 albums to my credit.  I have written original music that has appeared in feature films and on network television.  I have licensed my albums for release on labels in Japan and Poland.  I perform regularly in New York City and also tour in Europe.  I love making music and sharing it.  This video above is just a sample of what I do - I also sing in a few other languages, and include jazz standards in my repertoire.

 

WHAT I NEED TO MAKE IT HAPPEN

To record an album, an artist needs, first and foremost, the material.  I've got that: watch the short video above (only about 3 minutes!), and you'll hear some of the new music I'll be recording. 

Next, you need the musical partners, i.e. musicians, a recording studio, sound engineers, etc.  Well, my incredible musicians can be seen and heard above.  And I've got superb studio owners and sound technicians lined up to help me make this album.  They're excited to get started!

NOW, all I need is YOU, to help to put the wheels in motion.  Your contribution will pay for the studio time, and compensate all the pros for their blood, sweat, and tears in service of my vision.

ANY amount you give will be deeply, deeply appreciated.  

 

YOUR REWARDS

Seeing a creative vision come to fruition is one of the biggest thrills in life.  Well, I want to share this thrill with YOU. 

Every contributor who gives even at the lowest level will get insightful and intimate regular updates on the creative process, with photos and short videos.  Some contributors will get an extra exclusive level of access, a bird's eye view in the studio and personal impressions from me.

But every little bit helps, so there are gifts for EVERYONE who gives from $5 all the way up to $1000 including signed CDs, copies of my previous CD, even a limited edition vinyl.  You can also give any old amount you want, odd or even, listed or not.

If you dig really deep and make a contribution over $1000, we will talk.  :)    

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you cannot contribute monetarily, but you still want to help, I encourage you to use your voice to  talk and post about this project to your network of friends and colleagues, or anyone who you think might be interested, via word-of-mouth, social media, or any other medium you choose.  PLEASE SHARE this campaign with your friends; here's a link for cutting and pasting:  https://igg.me/at/aimeeallen

Because finding new fans, new friends, and new partners is also great support.

 

THANK YOU!!!!!!!!

 

 

 

 

 

[Photo credits: Laurence Navarro, Marina Lins, David A. Powell & Claudia Hehr]

story:
FULL STORY

NOTE:  PART 1  IS CLOSED NOW;  PLEASE GO TO PART 2  OF THIS CAMPAIGN TO CONTRIBUTE:     https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/pay-it-forwa...

 

My name is Patricia Creighton.  I'm Principal Flautist with Symphony Nova Scotia https://symphonynovascotia.ca/about/who-we-are/our-musicians/patricia-creighton/    and I teach flute at Dalhousie University's Fountain School of Performing Arts  here in Halifax, Nova Scotia, Canada.  https://www.dal.ca/faculty/arts/school-of-perfo...  I am passionate about helping young people achieve their goals, especially those with talent who are willing to work hard.  I had no idea this might connect me with a student from half way around the world.

Ogo-Oluwa's March 2017 video audition was very strong, and he was awarded a substantial one-time scholarship -  enough tuition money for 1st term and part of 2nd term.  This triggered a Canadian Student Visa and he arrived in Halifax, Canada  on September 7.  LISTEN TO HIS CARNIVAL OF VENICE HERE https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eEhp_TxGewI AND HIS CHAMINADE CONCERTINO HERE:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ud7dlIDMPPo&nbs... Check out his other videos which are just below the main video above.  I'm sure you will hear the potential I heard.  He is now also Principal Flutist of the Nova Scotia Youth Orchestra.

A powerful motivator for him to work hard is eligibility for grants, scholarships and bursaries in his 2nd, 3rd and 4th years of university, if his marks are high enough.  But for this first year, he simply needs a great deal of money for his tuition and basic expenses.  

Ogo-Oluwa's goals?

He wants to become one of Nigeria's best classical flutists and have an international performance career.

What He Needs 

  • $4,800 - remainder of tuition for first year after scholarship
  • $4,000 - towards accommodation (monthly rent is $400)
  • $4,000 - for food from September to April 
  • $1,500 - for text books and sheet music
  • $1,700 - summer expenses;  he can't afford to return to Nigeria during the summer
  • Perks include, but are not limited to, the satisfaction of becoming an integral part of this young man's future success.  These are not typical 'perks'; they aren't 'physical' - he has no means of rewarding your contribution other than being intensely grateful and also working hard to honour your contribution. 
  • If the goal isn't reached, the money raised will go towards as many of his expenses  as possible for the first year, firstly, tuition.
  • If more than the goal is raised, the surplus will go towards his future tuition costs.

The Impact

  • Your contribution will have a huge impact for Ogo-Oluwa and you will be a part of rewarding his excellence and talent when you donate.  
  • "Paying it forward" is a way of making small miracles happen on a daily basis, thanks to your personal donation, you could be a part of this miracle too.

Risks & Challenges

Challenge:  For Ogo-Oluwa to excel in his studies with this once-in-a-lifetime opportunity so that he honours your donation.

Your Risk:  Minimal;  helping a very talented young person achieve their goals and dreams 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask your contacts to get the word out and please advertise this campaign on your Twitter, Facebook and other social media sites.
  • Please pass the link on to as many people as possible.
  • Tell your friends and family.  Support excellence and education by spreading the word.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools provided!
story_txt:
FULL STORY
NOTE:  PART 1  IS CLOSED NOW;  PLEASE GO TO PART 2  OF THIS CAMPAIGN TO CONTRIBUTE:     https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/pay-it-forwa...
 
My name is Patricia Creighton.  I'm Principal Flautist with Symphony Nova Scotia https://symphonynovascotia.ca/about/who-we-are/our-musicians/patricia-creighton/    and I teach flute at Dalhousie University's Fountain School of Performing Arts  here in Halifax, Nova Scotia, Canada.  https://www.dal.ca/faculty/arts/school-of-perfo...  I am passionate about helping young people achieve their goals, especially those with talent who are willing to work hard.  I had no idea this might connect me with a student from half way around the world.
Ogo-Oluwa's March 2017 video audition was very strong, and he was awarded a substantial one-time scholarship -  enough tuition money for 1st term and part of 2nd term.  This triggered a Canadian Student Visa and he arrived in Halifax, Canada  on September 7.  LISTEN TO HIS CARNIVAL OF VENICE HERE https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eEhp_TxGewI AND HIS CHAMINADE CONCERTINO HERE:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ud7dlIDMPPo&nbs... Check out his other videos which are just below the main video above.  I'm sure you will hear the potential I heard.  He is now also Principal Flutist of the Nova Scotia Youth Orchestra.
A powerful motivator for him to work hard is eligibility for grants, scholarships and bursaries in his 2nd, 3rd and 4th years of university, if his marks are high enough.  But for this first year, he simply needs a great deal of money for his tuition and basic expenses.  
Ogo-Oluwa's goals?
He wants to become one of Nigeria's best classical flutists and have an international performance career.

What He Needs 

$4,800 - remainder of tuition for first year after scholarship
$4,000 - towards accommodation (monthly rent is $400)
$4,000 - for food from September to April 
$1,500 - for text books and sheet music
$1,700 - summer expenses;  he can't afford to return to Nigeria during the summer
Perks include, but are not limited to, the satisfaction of becoming an integral part of this young man's future success.  These are not typical 'perks'; they aren't 'physical' - he has no means of rewarding your contribution other than being intensely grateful and also working hard to honour your contribution. 
If the goal isn't reached, the money raised will go towards as many of his expenses  as possible for the first year, firstly, tuition.
If more than the goal is raised, the surplus will go towards his future tuition costs.


The Impact

Your contribution will have a huge impact for Ogo-Oluwa and you will be a part of rewarding his excellence and talent when you donate.  
"Paying it forward" is a way of making small miracles happen on a daily basis, thanks to your personal donation, you could be a part of this miracle too.


Risks & Challenges
Challenge:  For Ogo-Oluwa to excel in his studies with this once-in-a-lifetime opportunity so that he honours your donation.
Your Risk:  Minimal;  helping a very talented young person achieve their goals and dreams 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Ask your contacts to get the word out and please advertise this campaign on your Twitter, Facebook and other social media sites.
Please pass the link on to as many people as possible.
Tell your friends and family.  Support excellence and education by spreading the word.
Use the Indiegogo share tools provided!

story:
[ESPAÑOL  AL FINAL]

Hello! We are Versed, a Venezuelan rock band, consisting on Samuel Sánchez, Lead Vocals and guitar, bassist Omar Oses, Daniel López, Guitars and synths and drummer Rafael Acuña. We have been on the road for three years now. Last year we toured around our country with our first album "Visiones" and after one year of writing and producing we are ready to start recording our second album.

The situation in Venezuela is very difficult right now. The economic crisis and hyperinflation make it really hard for a bunch of young rockers to acomplish their goals and dreams of recording a new album, but we still believe in our country and that's why we are willing to record it, produce it and make it like the big guys in our beloved The Sweetspot Studios, located in Caracas, Venezuela and starting on July 8th, 2017.

Right now, recording our album costs three times more than it did on February, when we started the project. The inflation literally ate our savings and we are struggling to make it happen and that's why we need you! Our dream it's in your hands and you're the ones who can help us to get it done! 

We´ve already taken care of some expenses but we are lacking the following:

$1300 for recording (Studio, Audio-Engineer)

$900 for mixing

Also, we can't dismiss the reality that a lot of Venezuelans are going through. We don't only have an economic crisis, it has turned into an humanitarian crisis. A lot of people don't have a place to live or food to eat, and we are not only talking about homeless people, we're talking about middle-class families that only eat two meals per day, where a lot of parents don't eat dinner so their childrens won't go to bed with an empty stomach. They even have to look through the garbage for food. So we decided that a percentage (%) of the money we earn will be donated to support these people. It doesn't matter how much we earn or if we make it to our goal, we can't turn the blind eye on our fellow Venezuelan brothers and that's our way of helping. A couple of weeks ago we played a show for the benefit of "The Green Cross", a medicine students organization that's bringing support to the injured people at the demonstrations against the Nicolás Maduro Dictatorship, now we want those who need it.

So now, if you contribute to this campaign you are not only helping us, the young rockers, to make our dreams come true, but you will bring a good day and a smile to the face of a struggling Venezuelan.

Thank you very much for your time and for reading this. We are hoping we can count on you and we promess you that our next record is going to be big!

Note: if we collect more than $2200 we'll donate the total extra to food for those who need it.

You can hear our music on Spotify, Apple Music and Deezer!

Don´t forget to follow us on Instagram, Facebook and Youtube (Where you´ll find our official videos, Videojournals and more!)

@VersedBanda // Versed Banda // www.youtube.com/Versed

Prisma - Versed 

Fui Libre (Live) - Versed

 

-----------------------------------------Español------------------------------------------- 

 

¡Hola! Nosotros somos Versed, una banda de rock de Venezuela integrada por Samuel Sánchez, Voz y guitarra, Omar Oses en el bajo, Daniel López en la guitarra, sintetizadores y programación y Rafael Acuña en la batería. Hemos estado tocando durante tres años y el año pasado giramos por toda Venezuela con nuestro disco debut "Visiones". Después de un año escribiendo y componiendo ya estamos listos para grabar nuestro segundo álbum.

La situación en Venezuela está bastante difícil actualmente. La crisis económica y la hiperinflación nos dificulta mucho lograr nuestra meta y sueño de grabar un nuevo albúm, pero aún así creemos en las cosas hechas en nuestro país y es por eso que queremos grabar y producir nuestro disco en nuestro queridísimo estudio The Sweetspot Studios, ubicado en Caracas, empezando el 8 de julio del 2017.

El albúm constará de 9 temas producidos por Versed y Fernando Bosch, Guitarrista de La Pagana Trinidad, y mostrará una gran evolución y madurez en el sonido de la banda.

Actualmente, grabar nuestro álbum cuesta tres veces lo que costaba grabarlo en febrero, cuando empezamos la preproducción del proyecto. La inflación literalmente se comió nuestros ahorros y estamos luchando para poder hacerlo ¡Y es por eso que te necesitamos! ¡Nuestro sueño está en tus manos y eres tú quién puede ayudarnos a lograrlo!

Ya nos hemos hecho cargo de algunos gastos pero nos falta lo siguiente:

$1300 para grabar (Estudio, Ingenieros de Audio)

$900$ para mezclar

Tampoco podemos darle la espalda a la situación por la que muchos venezolanos están pasando. No solo tenemos una crisis económica sino una crisis humanitaria. Mucha gente no tiene un lugar donde vivir o comer, y no solo hablamos de personas en situación de calle, sino familias de clase media que dejan de comer para que sus hijos no vayan a la cama con su estómago vacío. Algunos inclusive buscan entre la basura sobras de comida para poder alimentarse. Es por eso que hemos decidido donar un porcentaje (%) de lo recaudado para contribuir con estas personas. No importa cuanto recaudemos o si logramos nuestra meta, no podemos darle la espalda a nuestros hermanos venezolanos y esta es nuestra manera de contribuir. Hace unas semanas tocamos para recaudar insumos para la "Cruz Verde", una asociación de estudiantes de medicina de la Universidad Central de Venezuela encargada de atender a los heridos durante las manifestaciones en contra de la dictadura de Nicolás Maduro, ahora nos toca ayudar a los necesitados.

Entonces, si contribuyes a esta campaña no estás solo ayudándonos a nosotros, Versed, a lograr nuestro sueño sino que también estarás brindándole un buen dia y una gran sonrisa a un venezolano en apuros.

¡Muchísimas gracias por tu tiempo y por leer esto! Esperamos poder contar contigo y podemos prometerte que nuestro siguiente álbum será INCREÍBLE.

Nota: si recolectamos más de $2200 el restante será donado en comida para los más necesitados.

¡Puedes escuchar nuestra música en Spotify, Apple Music y Deezer!

No olvides seguirnos en Instagram, Facebook y Youtube (dónde encontrarás nuestros videos oficiales, Videodiarios y más!):

@Versedbanda // Versed Banda // www.youtube.com/Versed

Aire - Versed

story:
Although I perform primarily as a contemporary pianist, I have continually revisited Bach's Goldberg Variations through intense study and performance since high school. It was the piece that originally inspired me to become a musician, and I am excited to finally record my own version of this monumental work! I am equally energized to present a recording of this work as a woman, adding my own interpretation to the catalogue of recordings by some amazing keyboard players who have come before me, including Rosalyn Tureck, Wanda Landowska, Tatiana Nikolayeva, Maria Tipo, and more recently, Angela Hewitt and Simone Dinnerstein.

 

Over the past two years, I have performed the Goldberg Variations at a large number of performance spaces throughout California, including  142 Throckmorton Theatre, house shows throughout the Bay Area, Maybeck House, the Cadillac Hotel, Blue Mountain Chamber Music Retreat, Berkeley Arts Festival, Forte House, and the Old First Series in San Francisco.

 

Recording a full-length album is quite an undertaking! This project is an entirely local production; I will be recording at 25th Street Recording in Oakland, CA at the end of December and working closely with the fantastic recording engineer David Bowles of Swineshead Productions. David will be recording, editing, mixing, and mastering my recording. Funding will go towards three days of studio rental, tuning and maintenance of the Steinway grand during the recording, David's fees, the creation of album art, pressing of CDs, and marketing materials. Any money earned past the budgeted amount will go towards the production of more CDs and additional marketing.

 

Any contribution truly helps. And even more importantly, please feel free to share this campaign with your friends, relatives, co-workers, fellow music lovers, and anyone else who might be interested! Thank you so much for supporting the arts.

story:
The 10th Annual Westerleigh Folk Music & Art Festival 

My name is Jim Indelicato and I am the director of the Westerleigh Folk Festival. My partners and myself started" WestFest" in 2008 as a venue for musical artists that wrote and performed their own material. As fellow singers/songwriters it's important to us that our artist be treated with respect. This is a cause near to our hearts. We wanted "Newport Folk Festival" type  event that encouraged creativity, welcomed all, was free, family friendly, and professionally run. Your contributions help us to pay for sound system rental, permits, free children's activities, and paying our musicians. " WestFest" is the ONLY Festival on Staten Island that pays its musicians and does not charge graphic artists a fee to display there work. 

WestFest grew from a small commumity fair 10 years ago into the regional event it is today. That was done by putting on a quality, professional show with the best local, creative talent.

story:
Short Summary

The Folkish Festival is the brainchild of six students from The Arts University, Bournemouth. Organised as part of our final major project for the course, BA (Hons) Creative Events Management, the event will combine some of the best local and national music acts, high-quality street food, a real-ale bar, craft stands and more. 

As keen festival goers ourselves with aspirations to eventually work in the industry, our current collective experience includes:

- Programmer and booking assistant at Isle Of Wight Festival 
- Intern at Cheltenham Jazz Festival
- Attendance of approximately 20 festivals
- Intern at Bournemouth International Centre and Bournemouth Pavilion
- Stewarding at many festivals including Glastonbury, Reading and 5 folk festivals
- Intern at an events production company


What We Need & What You Get

Your money will go towards: 

  • Securing our chosen line-up
  • An advanced PA System
  • Better lighting
  • Better facilities for our audience
  • Site Decor
  • A park and ride system 
If you could contribute to our event, we will be very grateful.  We also have some exclusive perks available as our way of saying thank you; these can be found in the side bar.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone will want to financially contribute in advance but there are other ways you can help!
- Buy a ticket for the event when they are released in January
- Volunteer! We are looking for many volunteers on Sunday 24th April and the week before, so if you would like to gain entry to the festival for free - get in touch!
- Spread the word! Do you know anyone who may enjoy this kind of event? Please let them know.

The Team

Jamie Lillycrop
Alex Budd
Hattie Ford
May Nguyen
Steph Ballett
Flora Kinch-Waugh

Thank you for reading our crowdfunding page, we hope to see you in April.

story:
Short Summary

By Simm Gottesman:

My friend, touring and recording artist, Elaine Silver is sharing her healing music ministry and has asked me to assist her with this fundraising campaign.  My very talented husband, Doug Tessler, often accompanies her on clarinet and flutes when she performs locally, in South Florida.  We also have put her on our YouTube channel and recorded her Indiegogo video, seen below.

Here is her story in her own words, from Elaine Silver:

Greetings from Florida everyone! 

I have been a full time musician since 1979 and have released many recordings over the years.  For the past decade or so, my career has moved into more of an actual ministry, as I have been involved with metaphysics and spirituality since the 80's.  I often fill in for ministers at Unity, Centers for Spiritual Living, Unitarian Societies and other progressive centers on Sunday mornings.  I also present secular music programs and workshops for all ages at schools, libraries, museums, parks, parties and senior centers, as well as kirtan and satsang at yoga studios.  (Yoga has been a passion of mine since the 70's!)

It has been a labor of love and joy to do this, AND it hasn't always been easy.  This path I have chosen has had many twists and turns, and luckily for me, when I am in a "dark night of the soul," I often do my best songwriting and creating.  This is uplifting for me as well, and then I get to share these co-creations on my CDs and in programs designed to open the heart and mind.  I feel so blessed to be able to do this as my life's work, and I am grateful.  :)

Now I am very happy to announce that my next CD (#19!), "The Only Real Power," is about to be released.  I have accumulated many expenses that need to be addressed, and this is where your financial support is requested, needed and very much appreciated.  I still have to fund the pressing and printing of the project, pay my artist, pay royalties for the 4 songs that I did not write, register the songs, promote the CD and find distribution!  WHEW! 

Your assistance, of any amount is GREATLY accepted and appreciated.  And there are some sweet perks for contributing here on Indiegogo.com.

Here is a sample of one of my newest original songs "It's About Love," performed with Doug Tessler on clarinet:

https://youtu.be/bgADPEOxk7s


And click on this link below to see me present "Spirituality and The Beatles":
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=delmz6j4ZI0

  • The Only Real Power CD song titles:
Love and Light to You*
Across the Universe
The Shadow of the Earth*
Thank You for Another Wonderful Day
On the Passionate Ride*
Chase the Buddha
GoD and DoG
Rainbow Bridge
Enjoy Every Moment*
Namaste'*
It's a New World*
It's About Love*
Love is the Only Real Power*

* = Original song by Elaine

The Impact

 Your contribution makes it possible for Elaine to continue offering her healing music to many communities, including yours ! 

  • Her project is not only valuable to you, But, we all know how kindness and loving thoughts through music, helps everyone on our planet and can transform our world.  Combine these thoughts with setting powerful Intentions, and we can have "A New World" that works for everyone!
  • Blessings and much appreciation to you for taking the ride with me!

Love and Light to You*Across the UniverseThe Shadow of the Earth*Thank You for Another Wonderful DayOn the Passionate Ride*Chase the BuddhaGoD and DoGRainbow BridgeEnjoy Every Moment*Namaste'*It's a New World*It's About Love*Love is the Only Real Power** = Original song by Elaine
  The Impact  Your contribution makes it possible for Elaine to continue offering her healing music to many communities, including yours !   Her project is not only valuable to you, But, we all know how kindness and loving thoughts through music, helps everyone on our planet and can transform our world.  Combine these thoughts with setting powerful Intentions, and we can have "A New World" that works for everyone!
Blessings and much appreciation to you for taking the ride with me!
campaign_city: West Palm Beach and Sarasota, United States

story:
UPDATE!!! 

Q: WHAT HAPPENS IF YOU DON'T REACH YOUR GOAL OF $20,000???
A: We are in the last stretch of this wonderful campaign, and I cannot tell you ENOUGH how touched I am by the outpouring of love, support, and generosity that has come from EVERYONE reading this. 
In order for my producer Thomas Barquee and I to fully create the most high quality full-package album, the realistic budget is around $20,000. HOWEVER, in the beginning stages of this project, EVERY DOLLAR COUNTS. When this stretch of the campaign closes, I will return to the recording studio with the budget raised thus far and continue to create and produce more high quality tracks so that I can approach large donors and investors with a diverse array of sound and product. 
My HOPE is to raise AT LEAST $5,000 through small personal donations by the end of this current campaign. So, as we finish this beautiful journey, every dollar counts! Enjoy the perks! OR just donate a dollar! 10 dollars! 10,000 dollars! WHATEVER!
I thank you from the bottom of my heart for co-creating with me. What we vibrate, we become. 
Love, 
Har Amrit 
-- 
OUR CURRENT LIMITED EDITION PERKS:





In the beginning was The Word . . . 

The entire universe was built on sound, vibration, or “the Word”… 

We humans are made up of 30 trillion cells, all dancing to a sea of creative vibration. What we vibrate, we literally become.

This is the power of mantra, the creative projection of the mind through sound. 

I started singing and performing when I was a little boy. My imagination was huge. All the world was a beautiful dream. I sang and danced on stage and basked in the wonder of playing pretend.

When I became an adult, the world around me got bigger and I got smaller. I started seeing and feeling pain. My simple faith and beliefs were tested. I was scared. I needed to uncover the mystery of what life really was.

I started recognizing the stars and the moon. Spiritual books started falling off the shelf in front of me. I began to understand the infinite nature of all there was. I was finding lasting joy, and truth, and peace in the idea that all of us are the same, that we come from the same place, and we’ll return there as well. . . that we are safe, protected, guided, and Loved unconditionally. 

I discovered many great teachers, and paths, and practices. And then I discovered Kundalini Yoga and Meditation . . .  I’ll never forget my very first class that would define the rest of my life. The moment we began to chant mantra it was as if I had come home. Everything finally made sense. 

This was how I would use my voice . .  . To heal, to teach, to uplift, to transform and change lives . . .

And now here I am, creating my debut mantra album with Thomas Barquee, one of the most renowned music producers in the industry.

What we vibrate, we become.



Becoming Har Amrit Singh

Many of you know me as David Piazza.

And many of you know me as Har Amrit Singh.

I was gifted with the spiritual name and identity of Har Amrit Singh which means: “the Lion of God who experiences the sweet nectar of God’s grace through the power of kindness, abundance and creativity."

This is the debut album of Har Amrit Singh. But don't worry, you can still call me David if you want. :)

The Sound

Press play above, and you will hear a shortened preview of my very first produced track, the Guru Gaitri Mantra (Gobinday, Mukanday, Udaaray, Apaaray, Hariang, Kariang, Nirnaamay, Akaamay). 

This mantra opens the heart center, develops compassion, patience, and tolerance, and breaks through deep-seated blocks.

Yogi Bhajan, the master of Kundalini Yoga said, “Whenever you utter this mantra, all facets of God will be right in you.”

The Album 

There are many more mantras to come!!!

I plan on taking this music to a whole new level. We are in a new day and age where people across the globe are ready to hear this type of music and to heal and transform through meditation, yoga, chanting, and sound. I find tremendous passion and excitement in touching the hearts and souls of people who perhaps haven't heard this type of music or haven't meditated before but have the hunger stirring within.

My debut album will feature mantras chanted in both Kundalini Yoga and traditions across India, especially the Sikh faith, brought to us by the master of Kundalini Yoga, Yogi Bhajan

What I Ask For, and What You Receive 

I ask you humbly and gratefully to help me bring this album to life.

This is the expression of my True Self, my dream unfolding…

With your generous donation, I will reach my budget of $20,000 to create and release a high quality, soul stirring album of mantras that miraculously control, direct, and heal the body, mind and soul. The total funds will cover all studio time, full production, and top of the line musicians, as well as the manufacturing, distribution, and global promotion of the album. 

Check out and consider purchasing some of the donation packages offered, as there are some fun and exciting gifts for YOU in store, including a digital download of my first full track, advanced album copies, social media shout-outs, special angel card sessions with me, executive producer credits and more! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share, share, share! Use the "Share" tool to get this campaign out to your family, friends, and community. Sharing is one of the most powerful and beneficial things you can do! 

I am deeply grateful for any and all support that you can bring to this project. 

What we build and create together will heal and change the world.

One vibration at a time…

Thank you.

story:
What is the Cat Call Choir?

The Cat Call Choir is a group of irreverent but hopeful women who sing street harassment quotes to the tune of nursery rhymes and original song. Our mission is to turn the inappropriate, unwanted comments and attention that women receive on the streets into campy, cheeky, colorful, and witty renditions of how we perceive these experiences.  

We Seek to:

  • Entertain but Inform
  • Make You Smile but Contemplate
  • Spread Laughter but Challenge Perceptions about Street Harassment

Your Contributions Will Help Us:
  • reward our performers ($2,000)
  • employ a crew of photographers, videographers and interviewers ($1,000) 
  • rent audio/video equipment ($500)
  • get costumes and props ($300)
  • with marketing and outreach ($200)

Show Us What Street Harassment Feels Like!

"Show Us What Street Harassment Feels Like in 15 Seconds or Less" is our video contest/campaign.  It's so simple to enter and you can win $100 cash!  Here's an example video to give your creative juice a squeeze.

The Cat Call Choir wants to help ALL female identified people express what street harassment feels like and insist that others hear it.  For some women, street harassment feels frustrating and confusing.  For others, it feels demeaning and devaluing, or worse.  Our rehearsals, song development, performing, and video-making are all part of a master plan to help our fellow females fight off the burrowing gazes, personal space invasions, and disrespect that comes from being harassed in public places.

VIDEO CONTEST DEADLINE EXTENDED UNTIL MAY 1!

Who Can Be in the Choir?

Anywoman!  To encourage more Bay Area lady locals to join me in belting out the praises of our "admirers", I am dedicating myself to singing in at least one public place every day for the entirety of this campaign.  Come to an open rehearsal and see what we're up to!  



And if you're just not into crooning you can join us in our This Is What Street Harassment Feels Like video campaign.  You don't even need to be IN the video. Give it your best creative shot and show us what street harassment feels like to YOU in 15 seconds or less.  The winning video gets 100 bucks and their video posted to our website.  Need another example?

Other Ways To Get Involved

  • Like/Follow us on Social Media, YouTube and Vimeo
  • Re-post/Re-tweet our performances and photos
  • Attend the WAH! Festival April 29, 30 and May (tickets here)
  • Come see us at any of our "shows" (online or off) and give us your feedback
  • Attend any of our free open rehearsals, video or snap pics with your phone, and send them to us!

story:
Never give up on your dreams

I am a passionate singer from Podgorica, the capital of a small and beautiful country called Montenegro. I’ve been in the music industry for 15 years and through various performances, including festivals, released singles and one album in my native language, my voice has been recognized as one of the best in my country.My first album was released back in 2008 and in 2012 I released a single “Misbehave”, hitting the Top 10 chart of MTV Adria. The time for my second album "Determination" has finally arrived.


What is Determination?


"Determination" sums up everything I've been going through in a completely new fashion. The songs are all in English, which gives my story a chance to be heard and understood on a wider scale. The songs are personal, passionate, free of shackles and bound to the truth. They sing of ups and downs, but also of victories over temptations and hardships...Hopefully, it's that time for my dreams to become a reality.

Beats, lyrics and production of two songs are finished, but I need your help to complete and release the whole album. In other words, there are seven more songs to go, plus all the other components which are included in a production of such a project. If you are asking yourself why you should be involved, just keep reading, the lyrics to my cover song say it all.


 
This is a perfect time to discover the "wild beauty"!

If you’ve never heard of my country, perhaps places such as Aman Sveti Stefan luxurious resort, Tara Canyon or Kotor would help. Long story short, Montenegro, unique for its diversity, both magnificent and unusual, is a country of the ultimate “wild” beauty, and if you’ve never seen it, this just might be the year to do so.  Guess what, I have the perk that is made for both music lovers and world travelers among you.



Some of the other perks...

Unique branded t-shirts which will be produced in limited number only for the contributors.

Album you will love :)


Distributions of funds

Here is a breakdown of the budget. This amount generated will cover the costs of:

- Recording, arranging, mixing, mastering

- Artwork, production and distribution of the project

- Videos, plus other visual material

- PR & marketing

- Indiegogo and Credit Card fees

- Creating and posting your gifts

Even if you are unable to contribute financially to this campaign, please consider sharing a link of this page with fellow music lovers in your life via email and social media.

This album bears great significance to me, not just cause I’ve put my heart and soul into it, but because it represents a whole new me. My music is my greatest gift and my everlasting choice.

THANK YOU so much for taking the time to check out my Indiegogo. I truly appreciate any and all support I receive!

One love,

M.

If you have any questions or need further information, you can always contact me: mariab.determination@gmail.com

story:
The story about Kartolina

Klapa Kartolina is an A Cappella vocal group that performs and promotes Klapa singing; which is a multipart singing tradition from the region of Dalmatia, in Croatia, and it is inscribed with UNESCO as an Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity. The word Klapa translates from Croatian as “a group of friends”, and Kartolina meaning “a postcard”. The group is based in Windsor, Ontario, Canada and is affiliated with St. Francis of Assisi Croatian Catholic Parish. Klapa Kartolina was founded in 2013 and has performed in Canada and Croatia. Klapa Kartolina is a registered Not-for-profit organization in Canada.

What We Need & What You Get

With great excitement and pride, Klapa Kartolina is announcing that they are working on their debut album, which will be the first Klapa project ever made in this area. For this purpose, Klapa Kartolina is raising funds to record and produce the album. To accomplish this fundraising objective, Klapa Kartolina is offering sponsorships to businesses and individuals and will publish a twelve page, 11x17 inch calendar for 2017. The calendar features fine art photos of Klapa Kartolina taken in Croatia during their tour in 2016, and from their concerts, accompanied by the lyrics of the songs from their repertoire (click on thumbnails below the featured image to preview). The members wear traditional folk outfits from the city of Split, Croatia. This is a tribute to Klapa music and to its homeland. The calendar will be released and sent by mail after the fundraising campaign has ended, on December 19th, 2016.

The following sponsorship levels to businesses and individuals are offered:

  • Bronze sponsorship: For $100, you’ll receive a Klapa Kartolina 2017 Calendar and a beautiful, personalized 10x8 THANK YOU photo card in High Resolution of Klapa Kartolina taken in Split, Croatia, ready to be framed. 
  • Silver sponsorship: For $300, you will receive ALL of the above PLUS you will get two tickets to Klapa Kartolina’s annual concert in February, 2017 and your name (or business name) will be printed on the calendar as a sponsor.
  • Gold sponsorship: For $600, you will receive ALL of the above PLUS Klapa Kartolina will come to perform songs from their repertoire at your event or event of your choice. The event must be in the Windsor/Detroit area, or traveling expenses will also apply.

All the sponsors will be mentioned and thanked at our annual concert in February, on our website and social media pages, and will receive the album once it is released.

The Impact

This will be the first Klapa album ever recorded and produced in this area.  Klapa Kartolina has already organized a very first Klapa concert in Windsor in 2015, at the Art Gallery of Windsor, which was a great success. Klapa Kartolina was founded in 2013 and has performed in Canada and Croatia. The group has performed in 2016 on several, prominent concerts of Klapa music in Croatia, most notably Festival Dalmatinskih Klapa Omiš, as a guest performer.

Klapa Kartolina is a registered not-for-profit organization in Canada, dedicated to promote Klapa singing and Croatian culture. 

Risks & Challenges

We plan to record and release our album in 2017/2018. Scheduling recording time is challenging and getting all of our individual schedules synchronized is an even bigger challenge! What keeps us motivated is the end product we can't wait for you to hear, as well as your support and encouragement.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to our campaign, we understand! There are other ways to support us:

  • Spread the word about us! Let others know who we are.
  • Share our website: http://klapakartolina.com
  • Like our Facebook page where we'll be posting updates on the campaign: https://www.facebook.com/klapa.kartolina.windsor/
  • Subscribe to our Vimeo or Youtube channel and watch (and share) our videos: https://vimeo.com/klapakartolina   ,  https://www.youtube.com/user/KlapaKartolina 
  • Check our Google+ page at: https://plus.google.com/+KlapaKartolinaWindsor

Thank you for your generosity, love, and support!

story:
• David Bowie said, ''Music itself is going to become like running water or electricity," he added. ''So it's like, just take advantage of these last few years because none of this is ever going to happen again. You'd better be prepared for doing a lot of touring because that's really the only unique situation that's going to be left. It's terribly exciting. But on the other hand it doesn't matter if you think it's exciting or not; it's what's going to happen.''

So here we are.  It's more or less happened.  I tour.  A lot.  And I love it.  However, I don't record and produce my own music due to the lack of financial support and time.  I hope to change that as I continue down the path as a dedicated full-time musician.  So it's time to turn to Indiegogo to cultivate support for wrapping up my solo album.  Platforms like this have evolved to become a critical and necessary tool to fund all the layers that go into an album.  These days it's generally the go-to-option for making a record independently and paying everyone involved in the process.  
My full length album is in it's final stage and I'm super excited and equally vulnerable to unveil it.  However, I've made a resolution to follow in Bowie's legacy of fearless artistry to reveal more of my deep and often hidden space-conscious.  So I'm committing to sharing it.  Many of the arrangements are older refreshed works that I recorded at home while others are hot off the press.
Your contributions will help me achieve paying everyone that has been involved with the creative process and also printing CDs.  I.E. Musicians, a studio engineer, mixing/mastering engineer, and printing & an online digital distribution company. 
Here's the monetary breakdown:
- $1000 for Mastering and Mixing 
- $1000 for printing CDs
- $ 100 CD Baby
- $ 1000 Studio Musicians 
- $ 200 Graphic Designer/Photograper 
- $ 700 Home Recording Gear (this is an endless hole - Cubase and other Software, Microphone, Synths, Music Apps, Pedals, etc.)
Your contribution will help me confidently finalize this project and do it without being in severe debt.  Plus you get a full length album with a ton of love poured into it. 
It will help bring the music forth and into the ears of the universe. I've never used a funding platform like this before for my own music but feel like now is the time to do it.  It will also help me survive easier on the road because I can sell these albums while touring with other projects such as Marty O'Reilly & the Old Soul Orchestra. Contributions empower full-time artists like myself to continue creating and give me hope for doing more in a world of under-funded arts.    
Please help me spread the word out there.  Share this campaign with anyone and everyone far and wide.  
Thank you soooooo much for your support and appreciation of music!  Chris Lynch

story:
Radix is a 23 year old Brazilian Music Producer. In recent months, the studio where he used to work in was demolished. He lost his job from this and decided to make keep making and uploading music videos on YouTube full time and seek his dream as an independent music producer. He mostly uploads Original songs and remixes and often livestreams content related to music and games.

He had some health complications and had to stay away for a few days. A few days after he returned home, he went to work on a song dedicated to his 10,000 subscriber special. As he was working on it, his computer shut off, he tried everything to get it working again, even taking it to a specialist, he was told that the computer would not work anymore and it would be much better to get a new one. Radix has no other way to continue doing his work. He would love to get started back up with making music and entertaining his friends, aka everyone who is subscribed to him on YouTube and everyone that can enjoy the content he has to offer.

If he reaches his goal of 1000 USD, he will be able to get a new computer and depending on how successful the campaign becomes he will also be able to get a new guitar and a new camera to improve the overall quality of his productions.

story:
DIY on a national level


The DIY event organization that puts on the annual festival works year round helping bands from all over the country, and in some situations, all over the world
  • In the past 3 years Memphis Punk Promotions has hosted for over 250 bands including booking, promoting, housing, and feeding bands on the road for free.
  • 2015 MPRFEST 3 included 46 bands and 10 comedians from all over the country, all bands' guarantees and venue overheads were met with a total of $5 in the end profit. 
  • By donating to help MPP reach the goal of $10,000 it will allow for booking of larger bill bands to pull more of the country into Memphis to experience our city and music community.


Booking Bigger Bands

Booking is a complicated and sometimes expensive world.

  • Most bands that have played MPP shows or previous festivals agreed to do so by door deal which is a major risk for bands touring from a long distance.
  • Having money to fall back on is always smart in a safe investments, but the owner who puts together the festival and local shows works a normal job like anyone else. You aren't donating to a CEO.
  • When it comes to booking a band that is on a largely known label, you're instantly looking at anywhere between $2,500 and $20,000.

The Outcome

Locals of Memphis young and old agree that MPR Fest is a great thing for the city and it's music community.

  • The festival and shows that happen year round include bands on their first show to ones that don't match the genre of the others giving everyone a chance to meet new people to network and become friends with.
  • The promotion of the festival exceeds most events with it's recognizable name inviting all sorts of people to find out there is still punk rock and live music happening in the city.
  • Many memories and friendships to made and the most important part is including an all ages crowd to certain shows to keep the music alive in the youth!

Risks & Challenges

Risks are always there when booking bands especially without a big bank account to fall back on.

  • By donating you are helping secure the event so the owner who works year round for free to help bands doesn't have to go in debt over anything that could cause the festival to lose money.
  • Another thing about booking large bill bands is that most of them sadly will not take you seriously unless you are able to make a deposit up front which MPP does not have the funds to do.

Other Ways You Can Help

When the Festival ticket links go live, tell a friend!

  • Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Text, or any other form of social media can go a long way with a few clicks, isn't the future great?!
  • Volunteer, email information and availability to memphispunkfest@gmail.com

story:
Hi everyone! Pete Pidgeon of Pete Pidgeon & Arcoda here.

ALL THE LITTLE THINGS
I am excited to introduce to you the strongest album of my career: "All the Little Things"! It features appearances by Levon Helm (The Band, Bob Dylan), 3-time Grammy winner Justin Guip (Hot Tuna, Levon Helm Band), Catherine Popper (Jack White, Ryan Adams, Grace Potter), Glenn Patscha (Willie Nelson, Sheryl Crow, Marc Cohn), Ryan Zoidis (Lettuce), Chris Pandolfi (Infamous Stringdusters), Leah Concialdi (Nathaniel Rateliff & The Night Sweats), Gerald Menke (Justin Townes Earle, Mercury Rev), Erik Lawrence (Aretha Franklin), RockyGrass Mandolin Champion Jordan Ramsey, and over a dozen more. It was recorded at The Band bassist Rick Danko's former residence Applehead Studios in historic Woodstock, NY by Gold Record recipient Chris Bittner (Coheed & Cambria). Click on the "Gallery" tab above the video to listen to a 10-minute sample of all the album tracks!

THE BREAKDOWN
The album was primarily written in 2009 and I've spent the last 3.5 years working hard to make the $30K needed to record, mix, and master it. Now that these funds have been exhausted, I am asking for you to take part in the manufacturing of the CDs ($4K) and vinyl ($4K), funding of the college radio ($3K) and publicity ($6K) campaigns, stocking of new merchandise ($2K), and funding of the music video for this single "The Ways We Change" ($3K). These pieces of the process are mission critical and the album won't float well without them. If the whole goal is not met, each of these items can be addressed individually in priority order. Any amount raised over the goal will be put toward funding a national tour - which has an overhead of $40K per month, restocking items that have sold, and extending the publicity campaign.

THE HISTORIC NATURE
The track "Tonight I'll Be Staying Here With You" is one of the final studio performances by Levon Helm to see the light of day and it would be a shame if you and the world don't get to hear it. It is important to the history and progression of American roots music.

PROVEN SUCCESS
I have proven with past projects, like this one, that I work harder than anyone to ensure that it's all worth your while. For example, my last release, the EP "Growing Pains", appeared on the Grammy Awards ballot in 5 categories. I'm hoping to land a Nomination with this one, and I'll have a shot with your help. You can say you were behind it from the beginning!

YOUR REWARDS
In return for your generosity, I offer you a series of enticing perks exclusively only available for the limited duration of this campaign. These include your name listed as a Executive Producer or Co-Executive Producer in the CD's liner notes, access to the songs and CDs weeks before the general public, signed guitars/ books/ CDs/ vinyl, stickers and picks, backstage access, one year of VIP guestlist, your name and likeness thanked on all of my social media platforms, a cameo in the "The Ways We Change" music video, a custom song written for you or a loved one, one month of guitar lessons for you or to give as a gift, and signed & numbered original album artwork.

TELL THE WORLD
Please spread the word about this campaign on social media and within your networks. Let people know how they can directly associate themselves with, and take credit for, the album's success - just like you.

THANK YOU!
I can't thank you enough for your kindness and continued support. I am truly humbled and very gracious for your vote of confidence. I am excited to share this new music with you and look forward to seeing you on the road!
